Posted: November 21, 2014
												I do not understand the bad reviews on this game at all.The game is slick and focus' on telling a story about two murdering, arms dealer scumbags in shanghai. Focusing on a single gameplay element which is cover based/run and gun third person shooting.The cover system works like any other game as far as I could tell press a button to snap to cover, press the button or movement, the default button is C which is annoying you can change it in the config.The shaky camera didn't both me, mosts of the time I liked it, if you don't you can also turn 'steadycam' on.The story is dark and brutal, the proganists are prposely unlike scumbags and it's brillant because even when you die you're thinking the worlds probably better off without these guys anyway. It's one of the few games where you play the bad guy and it's fun.don't let my logged game hours fool you, I've probably replayed 20-30 timesPro's graphics are still greatstory is dark and intensegameplay is simple and funruns on almost any machine from the last 4 -5 yearsThe first game is also awesome for all the same reasonsCon'sThe final level and ending is anti climaticLots of people gave bad reviews about it largely complaining about camera and control schemes than can easily be configured from the in game menu.

Posted: May 10, 2015
												The story of Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days unfolds through forty-eight hours of hell, with a script that would look deep into a film of high quality. The two characters find themselves in very difficult situations and once again have to rely on each other to survive, which is far from obvious when you were at his heels is a huge criminal organization that the law enforcement agencies in Shanghai. It is the usual "two against all", therefore, strengthened by a series of elements really hit the spot (the camera movement, the enemy AI), which perhaps is not surprising for the variety of situations but that bases its success on a gameplay solid and engaging. In this sense, the multiplayer mode serve as effective boundary while not stealing the show at the story mode, and complete the picture of an experience perhaps not very durable but certainly intense.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2013
												  Finishing Kane & Lych 2 feels like when you wake up from a horrible nightmare. You'll feel tired, with a headache, disoriented, trying to understand what just happened, trying to make some sense out of it.   It took me a while to realize that despite all the flaws that the game has concerning the shooting and cover mechanics, it succeeds in delivering a nauseating and nightmarish experience.   The dark, dirty and repulsive places that you visit, the amateur camcorder camera style, the convoluted storyline and characters and the unexpected and inconclusive cliffhanger ending all work together to make playing this game a nauseating and repulsive endeavour.   Most "critics" failed to understand that Kane & Lynch 2 is an ugly and disgusting game because it was designed to look like that. This is a game for those of us who "just want to watch the world burn".

content:
Posted: May 3, 2014
												Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is by far the hardest review I had to do. Not because it proved difficult to analyse or form an opinion of, but because it teases me with something that could have been great - yet is not. I don't like destroying a game I have a thing for, even though it's just on paper in the shape of a review, but there's no going around it. The franchise screams for a more flexible versatile game but instead I'm left with a repetitive hallway shooter.Adam 'Kane', as ex-mercenary, and James 'Lynch', as felon convicted of manslaughter, form a crime duo to arrange an arms deal in Shanghai. However, sh¡t hits the fan and Kane accidentally shoots the informant's girlfriend. Unfortunately she turns out to have been the daughter of some thé mobster in Shanghai all of China, whom is not fond of his daughter dying from a bullet Kane fired. The game follows our protagonists through Shanghai as this crime lord throws in everything at his disposal as a means of revenge, which is a lot. From local thug to police officer, a few military companies to several special forces, this guy has them all in his pocket and intends to use every man to kill Kane and Lynch.There really is nothing wrong with the writing, and reading about Kane & Lynch (either of the two parts) will want to make you play the games. The protagonist duo have a background together (as portrayed in Kane & Lynch: Dead Men) which - coupled with their voice actors - look like cold hard m☮therfµckers. There's no other way to describe them. This is actually necessary to make their survival credible as far as the setting is concerned, and it does add up.Though what doesn't add up is everything around it, with the partial exception of screenwriting: since the fundamentals of Dog Days is its hallway shooter mechanic, there isn't much freedom for screenwriting to begin with. The scenarios are heavily constrained to these mechanics and it doesn't take long for an observant player to notice that the intended storyline doesn't carry over as strong as it could have with different mechanics. The attempt is very admirable however, as even though some scenes are incredibly violent, they never feel forced or out of place.The graphical quality is above average, though the used shaders and camera movement prove to be rather annoying over time. The bobbing, lens flares and shaders look great when only observed, but when you are in control of the camera yourself it quickly feels as if the game consistently misinterprets movements. There are glitches involved as well, though this might have to do with the fact that Dog Days is an older game and my newer hardware might not render some things correctly.The sounds are too diverse to criticize in general. On one hand there are flat unconvincing gunshots, average ambience and mediocre soundeffects. On the other hand there's the convincing gritty voices of Kane and Lynch. While dialogue is well dosed, a great majority of the game still consists of shooting and as such there is little the dialogue of Kane and Lynch can do to make the game sound better in overall.All of these assets could be worked with if it weren't for the repetitive hallway shooter mechanics. All details aside, this game is mainly about sitting behind cover, shooting people that are also behind cover, and moving up through the predefined path. The entirety of the game is played like this while every now and then a cutscene plays. The motives behind these mechanics might have to do with the developers intending to reach maximum cinematic experience by constraining the player, but when a game starts to feel like something that can be played on an light-gun arcade cabinet - graphics aside - a lot of players are going to conclude the game is boring without ever finishing the first playthrough. And that's a shame because just the storyline, the strong characters being coupled with great voices, and the potential hidden in screenwriting makes this game a hidden gem. My conclusion is that it's definitely worth a play, Dog Days is truly different from a great majority of titles and a developer's second attempt to bring a franchise to life that is much more potent than the games are willing to show. While compelling story-wise, the gameplay itself will most likely bore you. In that regard it's funny how Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is only three to four hours worth of playtime, because anything more would have been too much in its current form. Collectors will probably not mind putting down €10,- for this, and I would plead the same for gamers with a thing for mentionable titles. If you are on a tight budget and have no idea about what I'm trying to unveil with my review, then you wouldn't be able to appreciate the title(s) and it's best to stay away from the franchise.I'm clicking the thumbs up for this game here because as broken as it might be: I admire the story, characters and voices, three things I value. Someday I will try the first Kane & Lynch and I'm also hoping the scheduled movie isn't going to ruin the franchise even more.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2014
												It's no masterpiece.  I believe we are all aware of this... But, to be honest, I didn't find it near as "awful" or "worst game ever" status as most "reviews" would make you believe.Let's start with one of the highlights: the scenery. Good god, this game looks the way a crime shooter game should look.  It's gray, it's shiny, it literally makes this the better-looking iteration of Shangai I've seen in a video game. The lighting in the game is very good as well. Yes, the "filmed with a phone" look can get tiring, but, honestly? I even got used to the running, which I believe it's what made most people sick with this particular aesthetic. Second highlight: the sound design. No epic music, no rock and roll, just a superb ambient music soundtrack that helped making me feel the desperation these two scumbags go through in this game. Highly recommended soundtrack. Overall, the art direction in this game is superb. Regarding its flaws, this is something no one will take away from it.Now, the story:It feels like Spec Ops: The Line without the twist. It servers its purpose, but nothing else. Now, the characters, we could argue all day long. No, they're not complex, and no, they're not even memorable, but I'm sure they don't want to be, either. They are both psychopats, there's no question about it. In the middle of a shootout you can listen Lynch trying not to lose control over himself, trying to count to ten, and by the end of the game, you can notice the paranoid feel over him. Now, Kane, he's no strange to being crazy. Most of the time he seems the more reasonable one, but there's a point where you can see he's not. Near the beginning of the game one random officer surrenders and asks you to please not kill him. While you consider sparing the poor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥´s life, Kane just comes in and kills him, and not a single frak is given. And if there's other debatable aspect on this game, is your partner's AI. Yes, he gets in the middle of the shooting because he's a friggin bullet sponge, but he PROTECTS you. More times that I can count I see an enemy shooting me from an angle I can't reach, and he takes care of him. Sadly I can't say the same thing about the enemy's AI. They're dumb. And they're bullet sponges as well. I don't believe the shooting is THAT bad, because it even feels the way these two morons would shoot guns, but the hit detection on the enemies is crap. Sometimes you empty half a clip on the enemies, and not only a fully armored SWATlike, but enemies with a shirt and a short absorb the bullets like mofos. It's even funny that sometimes you shoot them instead of falling, it gives them a boost so they move to other place. Add to this that they spot you no matter what. By the second "stealth" section I ddn´t even bother and started shooting like hell.Yet, I played through it with no regrets. There are a couple of levels that I actually enjoyed A LOT. Specially the last one you play as Lynch. That whole going through the crumbling building was great. Level design is a bit "off" (says the one who never designed a level in his life), but some mechanics, like destroyable cover and throwing fire extinguishers that knock enemies if you hit them in the head, are great. Speaking of the latter, the "shooting the whatever you just threw to make it explode" could have use some more polish. It's so random and impossible sometimes that when you are able to shoot something over 3 walls, it's ridiculous.A few bugs here and there could have frustrated me, but nothing too crazy. Haven't tried the co-op yet, though, so no idea of how it plays with a buddy. I got it for like 2 bucks, but I think it can even be worth up to $7 for singleplayer only. I wasn't sad when IO cancelled its 3rd installment back then, because I enjoyed Hitman: Absolution so much and loved they were going to focus on that, but now I do feel kind of sad. With better gameplay, it would've been the anti-shooter to hold the crown until Spec Ops came out.TL;DR: Play it, at least to enjoy the wonderful art direction.

content:
Posted: November 28, 2016
												Time for me to rewrite a review for Kane & Lynch 2.This game is misunderstood and negatively criticized for the wrong reasons (characters being old grown men, art style being intentionally "annoying", ending that is indeed empty but still fitting with the game's tone), while the real problems are, sadly, technical issues that were not addressed (poor netcode, AI at times not reacting, very basic multiplayer system etc) and might ruin the experience for the player sometimes.+ Kane & Lynch 2 is a gritty third person shooter starring "gaming's worst scumbags", in a good way. While the plot itself is nothing special, no other game has nailed the feeling of being in the middle of a ♥♥♥♥ed up situation, where corruption plays a big part into the chinese underworld and law enforcement. The disturbing art style, the shaky camera and the terrific Industrial Ambient soundtrack all add up to the darkest moments of those 48 hours of hell, making the game highly memorable. Certainly the best atmosphere in a crime shooter, in my opinion.+ The gameplay is a generic third-person cover shooter. What makes the gunfights enjoyable though, is the fact that guns are not always accurate, resulting in more immersive and believable shootouts. The "down but not dead" feature is also a nice touch.+ Multiplayer is pretty innovative and entertaining, involving heists. The strong point of this mode is the ability to betray your own teammates to try and take more money, that can be used to buy new equipment in each round.  Join this steam group to organize multiplayer matches and join them.+ Arcade mode makes the game a bit more replayable, with AI teammates instead of human players. Downside is, it is not available for the remaining 2 heist gamemodes.- Released a bit too soon: poor netcode is the worst of all issues that affects both coop and multiplayer. A few adjustments to gameplay, AI, lobby system and general fixes were also needed.- Story mode is short, lasting around 4-5 hours.- Long loading times.- Other minor flaws, like not being able to play as Kane offline, immersion-breaking hitmarkers and no facial animations during gameplay.- DLCs should have been part of the base game.Despite the lack of polish here and there, Kane & Lynch 2 is a unique experience that I enjoyed, personally. I'm sure people would have appreciated it more if developers took more time to fine-tune the game before release... which is why I think the K&L series needs to be remastered with all its issues fixed, DLCs free, better multiplayer system and online co-op for the first game in the series. What we're getting nowadays are remastered editions of games that were already bug-free to begin with. IOI and Square Enix, make it happen!

												If Gaspar Noe made a game it would probably be this, pure sensory abuse from beginning to end. A fast nightmare of car alarms, blinking lights and a drone soundtrack that really puts you into the head of its schizophrenic title character. Its basically Spec Ops: The Line if it didnt treat you like a moron. Play it, its only about 3 hours long and is a genuinely unforgettable experience. Also features probably some of the best visual and sound design I have ever seen in a game.Theres never going to be another Triple A game that delights in alienating its audience as much as this one did.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2016
THE LOWDOWN:Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is another third person corridor shooter with cover mechanics.  It comprises of a single 11 mission campaign based on a fictional representation of Shanghai, China. The campaign can be played solo or with another player.  There are also three online coop and pvp player-modes: Fragile Alliance: free-for-all team-based robbery missions, Undercover Cop: FA w/ a hidden infiltrator twist and Cops & Robbers: Up to 6vs6 shootout and escape or die.THE GOOD:+ A well established story in the mould of HEAT. Great if you loved the movie and want to play something akin to it.+ Take on the role of two great characters with striking personalities.+ Top-notch voice-overs which bring them to life. Compliments the action perfectly with some great dialogue.+ A very good selection of weapons provides decent variety in your play-style.  Limited to two weapons at any one time.+ Some great fast-paced action, gratifying kills and gory takedowns.+ The enemy A.I on the second hardest difficulty presents a great challenge if you are into hardcore shooters.  On the hardest difficulty it is even more of a ♥♥♥♥♥!THE BAD:- Levels are linear and undynamic in content.  Once you play it through, follow-ups will be essentially the same.- On the hardest difficulty even being in cover doesnt necessarily mean you are safe!- Flaky keyboard controls means you can leave cover unexpectedly and die.  Moreso on highest difficulty.- Multiplayer needs at least 2vs2 players for FA & UC modes and 3vs3 for C&R.  Which is extremely difficult given that MP is virtually dead except for a few random players.  Moreso as some achievements require all players to have the Doggie Bag (map) DLC.- Head-bobbing together with a bad camera angle may make you travel-sick, when running!- Experienced a few crashes in singleplayer.  - MP can suffer from lag though I think this is a memory leak and just needs a game restart.- Online modes are hampered with a terrible graphical glitch that sometimes also requires a restart.  - A problem with owners of the Doggie Bag DLC not being able to play a map was fixed in a patch.- Achievements cannot be 100%d because of one broken achievement.  'Harry Houdini' was likely broken in a botched patch after release.  Believe me I tested this substantially and was unable to trigger it!- Requires purchase of Doggie Bag DLC to get [nearly all] achievements.- You will need a very capable partner to complete the game at its highest difficulty.  Unless you are Chuck Norris. :)- I still dont know why they censored the gory details of dead bodies.... maybe a Germany thing!AND THE ORDINARY:* Levels are essentially enclosed areas with limited movement options.  * Decent cover mechanics but limited tactical gameplay mostly centred on pinning and flanking, taking the high-ground, feinting, or flushing enemies out of cover.* Level design is basic with only the location setting changing between each one.* Enemies range between law enforcement(mainly cops) and other villians.  As usual health and weaponary are the only thing that really differenciates between them.* AAA graphics that were probably great at the time.  Look a little dated now but still very good.* The campaign is certainly replayable.  I finished it solo and then completed it on the hardest difficulty with another player. Campaign will take around 15-20 hours.* Longevity is focused on multi-player which is actually great fun but difficult to get enough players at the same time.  VERDICT:Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is a very capable third-person shooter.  It captures your interest with some very visceral gunfights.  Without doubt despite the repetitive nature of its gameplay, its replayable numerous times.  Even for someone who doesnt like MP/PvP, online sessions are very short and you dont lose anything but some time if you are defeated.  I enjoyed playing this game. You will enjoy it too if you are a fan of the film HEAT, where this game generates a similar & familiar feeling.  If you prefer open-world games then maybe avoid it.  Also if you like to achieve 100% achievements and don't use SAM.  Just be warned that the camera angle and bobbing perspective isnt for everyone.  Its just a shame that the online side of the game is virtually dead.

number of helpful: 26 of 36 people (72%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 11, 2015
												You're running starkers through a city, your skin cut to pieces, a gun in your hand. Your buddy is also naked and bleeding from numerous wounds all over his body. This is the crazy life of Kane and Lynch, gaming's most unlikable leading men; psychos who just can't stay out of trouble. With the original game failing to be a critical success, developer IO Interactive's sequel has a lot to prove.Without spoiling the plot of this sequel too much, Kane and Lynch bodge a job, resulting in the death of someone with connections to a huge criminal organisation in Shanghai. With an army of goons out for blood what follows is an often unpleasant tale of revenge, torture, murder and the ramblings of a psycho and his mate. This time around you play as Lynch, although the slightly less unhinged, but still more or less a psycho, Kane is always at your side.Dog Days is, at its core, a fairly simplistic cover-based third-person shooter. You can now hide behind objects by pressing a button, rather than the awkward auto cover system the original game employed, and the controls feel tighter too. Environments this time around have been designed to allow for better use of these basic mechanics.With enemies dropping guns and ammo all over the place, and a plentiful supply of explosive canisters and crates, you're never short of ways to dispose of foes.The duo's fairly brief murderous adventure is unquestionably full of intense shoot-outs, but memorable moments are few and far between. The naked scene alluded to at the start doesn't deliver anything new in terms of gameplay, but the events were shocking enough to make me feel a bit uneasy. Equally, a level set inside an office block under attack from a gunship is full of things being shot to pieces, but it still somehow lacks spectacle.Dingy levels merge into one rather depressing whole, with the various Shanghai environments doing little to sell the Chinese city as a hot tourist destination.Audio work is rather impressive, with the excellent voice acting paired superbly with ambient sounds from the city. Fire fights send bullets ricocheting through your surround sound speakers, while our heroes constantly bicker with each other. The lip synching could certainly have been better, but on the whole the performances of each virtual actor make a basic story very entertaining.Sadly very little is made of main protagonist Lynch's mental state. He's almost always shouting something that only an unhinged man would, but his unique characteristics don't translate into the gameplay.A rather unsatisfactory ending to the psychotic double act's ordeal sours things somewhat. I was left expecting the pair to return to the screen after the closing credits, but there was nothing of the sort.Co-op play, via split-screen or online, adds in an element of working together, but the only differences are enhanced flanking abilities and being able to revive your buddy if he's downed by enemy fire. Split-screen is also vastly inferior to online co-op.The campaign feels a few hours short, but you do get a very decent multiplayer component, with game modes that test your skill with weapons as much as they do your morals.Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is a visually unique title, glossing over a fairly by the numbers third-person shooter. The deranged duo's return is worth experiencing and is far more accomplished than its predecessor, but the gameplay on offer still doesn't match the quality of the characters IO has created.

												Extremely misunderstood game.  It was clearly made as an artistic demonstration.  Most game characters are murderous during gameplay but heroic in cutscenes conveniently ignoring the fact that they've just killed hundreds of people.  Kane and Lynch are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s through and through.  Just thoroughly dislikeable people.  And this game is about a ♥♥♥♥ed up situation that they get stuck in and try to get out of, but everything just keeps going from bad to worse.  The visuals are intentionally disgusting with glaring lens flare, harsh neon and pixellation all designed to emphasise how messy the situation is.  The combat is also not the smoothest with you easily getting knocked down on your♥♥♥♥♥all adding up to what a total♥♥♥♥♥♥storm of a mess this tale is.A revolting hot mess of parts that somehow comes together as a great experience overall.  Be prepared to be disgusted and best played co-op with a friend.

												Terrible, TERRIBLE game. Although graphics are nice and I salute the effort it must have taken to emulate the handy cam, this game is just half baked. The cover system is broken but above all, the aiming system is awful. You can unload clips on an enemy that is 5 feet away and spray your bullets all over without a single hit. However, the enemies have dead aim at 500 feet, killing you almost instantly and they can take 4-5 bullets in the head without dying. They can also shoot you accurately hitting 90% of their shots while blind shooting from cover. And I played on easy... You survive between 5 and 30 seconds and then restart over and over again until you get so frustrated that you just dump the stupid game. Kane & Lynch? Dead men for sure!

Posted: July 20, 2015
												At first I really liked this game, but the aiming is so broken beyond repair. I'm not talking about going full auto on a 10m away enemy and miss every shot (that's of course understandable). I'm talking about unloading all the shotgun shells on an enemy at a point blank range and he wasn't even scratched - I got killed instead. Tested repeatedly on the same enemy, I always consistently missed point blank shots. This is not realistic shooting anymore, this is broken shooting and it's irritating me. I had to stop playing after like the second level or so (the first level doesn't seem to suffer from this erroneous aim issue) I was looking for fun, not annoyance.For those who complained about shaky camera, there's a setting to turn this off in "Controls". This game has issues, but shaky camera isn't one of them.

												This game has received much hate from many people, but I found it to be one of my favorite games. It's dark, gritty, and violent. Your two "protagonist" are nothing more than murderous scum  who you somehow root for. The action in this game is fantastic and it provides you with a fast paced third-person shooter.  Playing co-op makes it that much better. However, the multiplayer is without a doubt my favorite in any game. Fragile Alliance is what a heist game needs to do. You never know if your allies are actually your allies and you must always have an eye out for everyone. It's an amazing game and I have never had any problems with it. It is incredible and one of my favorite games.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2016
												I was quite surprised with this game. The story gets dark in terms of graphic violence very fast and never lets up. There are scene skips between waypoints I felt where the game was rushed and should have included transition pieces to make it flow smoother (such as a certain mission where you are trying to reunite with another group, reach the waypoint, then jumpcut to standing right next to them). Altogether the actual story portion was short and sweet, leaving a satisfactory feeling for about 4 hours of content. I did have 3 crashes in game and it was the game itself, no need to reset my computer or anything like that.I recommend playing it on easy or medium as the guns are mostly inaccurate, even when trying to fire single shots. You will often die to random headshots that cannot be controlled even when in cover on harder difficulties, so it will be mostly frustrating than tactical fun. Thankfully the camera angle can be changed on the fly, making it playable in certain environments like tight corners when the enemy has high firepower to potentially take you down fast.Online Co-OP worked very well. Me and a friend had no issues joining each other's game for the story mode. I haven't tried the multiplayer version yet because I don't like game modes that reward antisocial behavior in a team. Since it is a game, there will be somebody that betrays the group and it puts unneeded pressure in completing objectives. If you have a group of friends who aren't D-bags, then give it a go, otherwise, be cautious.After beating this on normal difficulty and expert, I'll probably never touch this game again, but I had a great and memorable reaction to the story and recommend fans of dark and semi-realistic stories to try it when on sale.

												The reason behind all these negative reviews may be the fact that this game isn't worth the price of a full game. So, now that the game is priced at 10€, I can say that it is more reasonable now. (However, it's still not worth when it is not on sale because of it's dead multiplayer and short story).It has its flaws, but if you ignore them, you will be left with a pleasing experience, especially if you play it with a friend on co-op, as there aren't any critical issues. The graphics are good (even for today's standards) and the soundtrack and the environment fit the game's dark tone perfectly. Also, the plot is okay and, even though the two main characters are "ugly", the developers managed to make me feel something for them, which is a great plus for the game. So, if you haven't played this game yet, ignore all the negative reviews and give it a try! With a friend, I assure you that you will have a good time playing it. (Be careful, though! The extreme difficulty can be quite challenging at times!) (Also, you can disable the shaking camera if that's a problem for you!)

content:
Posted: August 3, 2012
												What makes this game so disappointingly bad is not all of its bad qualities, but all the good ideas that were executed poorly.The game's unique "amateur Youtube video" style is one of the most unique aesthetics choices I've seen in a while. There is a healthy dosage of shakicam, the screen has artifacting, the video lags when you are near explosions, and there are light streaks from very bright lights. Unfortunately, the problems this game has will make you forget those things. The shakicam is very disorienting, both during combat and when trying to figure out where to go (a strangely common problem in a linear cover shooter). Furthermore, the actual combat is too basic and the enemies don't really change besides what they are using. Lastly, all the automatic weapons have terrible recoil and spread, which makes the rifles and shotguns the weapons of choice.Lastly, the game is short. It took my friend and I 3 hours to complete it on Medium. It's not worth buying even on a sale.

number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 15, 2016
												Kane & Lynch 2 is what the first game should have been. I played the first Kane & Lynch all the way to its conclusion and knew what the developers were going for, but they never really hit the high notes with their first effort. Kane & Lynch 2 is completely different in that respect as this game is raw, brutal and very violent... It still has a host of missed opportunities gameplay wise regarding controls that could have been tighter; the cover mechanic work but only just and the weapons; while most feel good, there are a few that don't really feel under powered. The game also suffers from a very short story mode that severely hampers the overall product on offer. The positives do make up for the negatives above in some respect. The story maybe short but what we have is two desperate men fighting their way out of China's criminal underbelly. From the first mission where Lynch needs to 'talk to someone’; the whole scene is turned on its head in seconds. What entails is a desperate struggle for survival for our two main men. Although the quality of dialogue varies it is still nice to hear Kane and Lynch communicate with one another. Lynch, who has deep lying mental problems, can be heard talking to himself more frequently over the course of the game. Kane tells him to pull it together has he knows what a loose cannon he can be but this fuels Lynch even more. Also, when the s**t does hit the fan, the characters sound like they are clearly fuelled by adrenaline when talking... This is a very nice touch and in some fire fights, it adds momentum to the scene. Graphically, this is where the game stands out to me! The handheld video effect is amazing and adds the grit that this story needs for player immersion. When you see naked people or shoot someone in the head, the camera goes blocky just on the 18+ parts. The brutality of the killings is better overall and I was pretty bored with other games that had gratified enemy’s heads exploding up walls. With this kind of game, this sort of graphical execution is great and differentiates it from the pack. There is other stand out moments in the game but I wanted to just mention Arcade mode and multiplayer. On PC the multiplayer is dead which is a shame has the modes on offer where great and a lot of fun to play. However, if you and your friends have this game, you can do coop through arcade mode and story mode using HAMACHI (program that lets you connect to friends over the internet but tells the game you are playing it through LAN). Arcade mode is fragile alliance which is a great and it will keep you busy for a while. It's a bank heist with 8 other players, AI or friends and you; the mission? To escape with the money but friends can turn on you at any point in the level. It’s nice being on edge all game as an alliance in one round can be forged by helping a team mate out if they are caught in a sticky situation, however; due to the nature of the levels you can sometimes shoot a heist member accidently meaning you are labelled a traitor for the rest of the round. It is a stand out feature but is lacking further development as the 7 levels can be completed in around 5 hours. The only drawback to such a feature is the guns that you unlock as you gain new ranks. In conclusion it is a package that should have been developed better as a single player game with the multiplayer additions adding weight to the product. Instead, what the game has is a under developed single player and good foundations for multiplayer. Combined it is a game that would be a good pick up from the bargain bin for under a tenner given that the online multiplayer is dead. The single player game is worth a run through twice if you like collecting achievements but a once through is suffice. I do like Kane and Lynch 2 I just wish the single player had a few more chapters and because of this, it gets a good 7/10.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												I'm writing this just after finishing the main campaign and I feel compelled to do this. (2 of those hours are the online multiplayer by the way,) Yes, this is a 3-4 hour single player campaign, I DO NOT recommend this game for many reasons.1) The levels in this game are almost exactly the same, you fight through maybe 8 different maps before the game just ends abruptly with no explanation, a story closer, or even a story wrap-up. 2) The cover mechanics are utterly useless unless you can find a place that is cut off from one side or the other and hug a wall corner.3) The guns aren't varied and there isnt really much of a selection, Oh and the shotgun is the only gun worth while in the game because it is more accuate than any other gun, even at longer distances and the other weapons seem to have so much kickback that even if you aim directly at somebodys head it'll magically miss. 4) The story itself is ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and it may be easy to follow, but you'll ask yourself what the actual ♥♥♥♥ as the story is completely uninspired and written poorly. The only thing that I can give this game is the camera effects/ graphics, it looks semi decent even though the player models look like plastic. Oh and the online play is semi-decent as well, but, like the single player campaign it gets very repetitive as there are only 6 maps to play on ( 9 if you choose to get the DLC) and the game modes are throwbacks from the first game apart from the undercover cop bit, also, you run completely naked and lashed through the streets in one level, and later in the campaign you shoot out of a helicopter that only lasts for about 8 minutes, and that is about the most variation you'll get from this game.

content:
Posted: February 5, 2014
												Kane and Lynch 2: Dog DaysPositives: + Decent graphics, but nothing amazing.+ Arsenal of weapons to use throughout the game, such as uzi's, shotguns and a variety of military grade assault rifles, along with pistols.+ This entire game is action, with frequent shootouts and some intense cutscenes (although these are all too rare). As a result of this non-stop combat you do feel engaged in the game.+ Various parts of the environment are destructible, and become damaged amidst the firefights Kane and Lynch are involved in. Negatives:- The story is lacklustre in comparison to Kane and Lynch: Dead Men (the original). The characters themselves feel dull and the interesting aspects of their personality are absent in this game. The story is straightforward and doesn't have any complexity to it. - The main campaign takes about 3-4 hours. It would definitely be longer on the highest difficulty but still nowhere near long enough.- While the constant shootouts in this game can be viewed positively, it also becomes so common  that it loses its charm.- The new arcade mode is boring and repetitive. If you like to unlock achievements this is a grind. You join a team of AI criminals where you execute a heist to steal cash or other valuables, then shoot your way to the escape vehicle. After you become accustomed to the different maps (which are nicely thought-out I shoud add), you just repeat them over and over to gain ranks and access to different weapons. Not fun.Overall Score: 5.0/10Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is ideal for an afternoon playthrough when you have nothing else to do. A short game filled with action and a story which isn't quite in-depth enough to be captivating. It features some cutscenes which will move you, but in the end falls short in many areas.Only grab it very cheap on sale like I did.

												Erm i played 2 hours and suddenly the credits rolled. lol? Gladly i got this game really cheap on discount. Well so whats to say about this game?The story is boring and just never catches you since the whole gameplay resolves around hiding behind various objects and spraying with your gun and hoping the enemy will die. Seriously, as much guns these guys use its a wonder they have such a horrible aim. But well you will never run out of ammo at least since there are always dozens of weapons laying around.Its always the same. You enter a room/hallway/open area and take cover behind some object and a wave of enemies approaches. When uve killed them all, move on to the next location and take cover again. Another wave of enemies and so on. Between those waves u get cutscenes which arent really great since they mostly consist of a shaky camera and somebody getting killed. And between those "real" cutscenes u get some short cutscene showing kane&lynch opening a door or climing a wall to get to the next shooting range area.Yeah, this game is probably an advanced shooting range simulator. That could sum it up well. Otherwise its quite boring and repeating itself til suddenly the credits roll. This title is really a shame for Square Enix. They can do way better. Still, i bought it cuz i got the First Kane&Lynch but i dont think u need to buy this game because its really much worse than the first one. Storywise u wont miss  anything since the story is probably as entertaining as vacuum cleaning.If u have a "running around naked" fetish (perhaps involving blood too) then this game is definitly for you. Otherwise....well you wont miss anything.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2015
												TL;DR♥♥♥♥♥♥story. Sickening camera bob. No blood - censored faces when headshot. Useless allies. Useless cover. Limited mobility (and therefore view/protection) when in cover. Useless graphics settings. Dead multi-player.Story is worse than the first one and it takes about as long to beat. Screen shakes enough to give anyone motion sickness whenever you're moving (and sometimes when you're just trying to shoot from cover). There's no blood, just blurred out faces. You can't switch your allies' weapons manually like you could in the first one, so a lot of the time they just have a pistol or SMG when you're fighting guys with rifles. However, they do have ammo (though they don't seem to shoot a lot and, when they do, they miss 95% of the time) and, when they run out, they pick up a weapon. Multi-player is dead, so the DLC is useless, but it sounds like it would be fun for probably longer than the story took to beat if people played it. Aiming is terrible, although you don't shoot the cover you were hiding behind as much as the first one, you do sometimes shoot it. There's a lot of cover that's breakable and after breaking, the AI will move to a different cover, giving you some time to shoot them. Although it seems like the AI could shoot you through most, even unbreakable, cover, so the cover is mostly useless. Moving along cover just didn't happen - most of places you could use cover was right at the end of an object, which isn't the best if you can't see the enemy from that spot. If you wanted to move along the object, you had to get out of cover and run to the other end of the object where you could use cover again. There are some graphics settings that are supposed to make the game better to look at, but nothing seems to make it look better. Pretty much just like any other third-person shooter with a short, poorly-written story.

												I haven't played the first game completely (only the demo), but it made me want to buy this game when it was available in a Humble Bundle.What I liked:* The environments were really good, some things like walls, boxes, signs etc. are destructible which makes it a lot more fun* The graphics are decent for when it came out* The script/story is decent - definitely wanted me to keep playing* Awesome guns - later in the game you'll be facing harder enemies who drop better weapons* Explosive canisters - you can throw them and they act as shootable grenadesWhat I disliked:* I completed the campaign in about 4 hours (on the easy difficulty), which is quite short* The ending of the campaign left me staring at the credits thinking "was that it?" Don't get me wrong, I'd love to know what happens next, just a strange cliffhanger. Not sure where they would take it if they made a 3rd game* The shaking of the camera when you are sprinting is ridiculous - this is probably the most frustrating thing in the game* Not really the games fault, but the multiplayer is pretty much dead. If you want the achievements you are going to need some friends to play this with* Some things are censored in the game - I can understand the naked parts but why is it censored when I shoot someone in the head?Overall I thought the game was good. It has it's postives and negatives, but I had a pleasant experience. The game is not as terrible as some people make it out to be. I don't think I would buy the game full price but if it was on sale or in a bundle, it's worth it.

content:
Posted: January 16
												While the core mechanics are fairly unremarkable, with shooting and movement that feels a bit titchy and weightless, the characters, world and overall gonzo-style presentation is slick, bold and very memorable, and the game-theroretic-inspired heist multiplayer mode is genuinely innovative. Though not without flaw, with each release, IO interactive seem to be edging ever closer towards Kane & Lynch's transition from cult favourites into genuine mainstream success. I, for one, hope they nail it if they ever make Kane & Lynch a trilogy.Overall: 7/10

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2016
												This is a vastly underrated game easily worth the current price tag of about 10 bucks.Whether you will like it or not, though, might mainly depend on how you will feel about the camera perspective - a shaky hand cam following your character around. I for one came to love it. Yes, it does need a bit of getting used to, but then it provides a remarkably authentic feel of actually "being there". There's no other TPS with this unique atmosphere. Also, considering the game is from 2010, the graphics did age surprisingly well. (Edit: I just became aware of the fact that you actually can make the camera more "steady" in the options, so if you're put off by the default camera, this might let you reconsider.) The shooter mechanics we get are competent. There's situations where your char will not use the cover like you'd intend him to do, but that's an issue encountered in almost all cover shooters. Also, I can't remember any other game where the impact of enemy bullets into your cover feels equally menacing.   The story is nothing to write home about, but more important IMO is that the two lead characters are interesting and - in their special way - likeable. I find they are much better than those we got with GTA V. The story mode is not very long, but quite replayable because the Shanghai settings are fun. If you're even remotely interested in third person shooters, you should absolutely get this.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 29, 2013
												Although Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days from IO Interactive has a distinct visual style, the other parts of the game never branch out in any interesting or different ways, and made worse by the shockingly brief 3-5 hour single-player campaign.The best part of Dog Days is the visual style. The game is shot like you are looking through a handheld camera. Although you can turn on steady cam for anyone prone to motion sickness, the rest of the effects cannot be turned off. This is a welcome change. Most games allow you to turn off their effects, I appreciated that Dog Days had a vision and stuck too it with this game.While the visual style is distinct, unfortunately the other parts of the game are not. It's a standard cover based third person shooter, the story did enough to keep me wanting to see how it played out, despite the fair amount of cliches, such as Kane talking about this being his last job, or one the characters literally saying "I'm too old for this".The game is also incredibly short, it took me just under 4 hours to finish the single-player campaign on medium. Even though their is multiplayer, I was unable to find any ranked or player matches.Ultimately Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a flawed game, the visual style is very unique, but goes to waste in a game that is not that much fun to play.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												I completed the first game yesterday and I enjoyed it a fair bit.I loved its variety, story, character building and level design.But I also hated the cover mechanics, gunplay and just overall gameplay stuff.Well, this time around, this game did it all kind of opposite.I'll start off with mentioning that the style of graphics/filters that this game has is pretty damn awesome. It looks like a documentary that had been filmed about the adventure of our protagonists. There are even things like rendering bugs, timers and best of all: censoring. Yup. When you see Lynch's flobby♥♥♥♥♥♥ you'll be spared the details. Same goes with a mob boss's daughter's ♥♥♥♥♥. The shooting is great and feels very responsive. All gunsounds also sound amazing. Although later on in the game, enemies become slightly bulletspongey, which I don't approve. An early game enemy can take 2-3 bullets max. While at the same time, a late game enemy will most likely take 5-8 bodyshots or 1-3 headshots. The sound design is... fitting. I personally didn't like the idea of excluding music and adding some weird noises to be played every few minutes, but at the same time, the lack of music introduces loud gunshots that were truly powerful thanks to the lack of tunes. I would've preferred a lack of music in the key points of the game, but that's mostly a personal preference and what they did was still executed well.The story is less interesting than the first K&L, but this story will instead make you care about the characters a bit more and maybe have you even root for them. The ending, while hated by most, felt ok to me. It was pretty abrupt, but looking at the game's tone, it made sense. Same went with transitioning between levels and the upright skipping of filler content, like pointless running. It made sense in this documentary format and I'm fine with it ending like it did. I would've preferred a quick 2 minute cutscene of what happened next, but it doesn't really matter. The characters are pretty boring now compared to the predecessor, but since they were built up, there was no reason to just keep adding stuff there.The length of the game has been its criticism. But... why? This game was short, but sweet. It never really had a dull moment, except for the last mission. If you want a long game, then just play Minecraft and WoW and stay there. Those are people that don't understand the idea of quality hours vs. random game hours. The tone that this game has is gritty... really gritty. There is death and violence, sure, but the way that it's presented is what really impacted me. It does the gritty stuff without ♥♥♥♥♥♥ dialogue, without bad graphic filters or anything like that. At one point in the game, it even felt more like a horror game than anything, even though I was shooting at enemies and there were no scares there. What scared me was the idea of all of that happening and looking realistic enough to be considered plausible. The spectacle that the game offers in the game is really damn great. It's like an indie action flick that knows its audience. There are no moments of downtime really and that's just perfect. Seeing random character development is not what this game should focus on and they understood that.And for my last point: Variety. It's... I mean... Hmm.. It's weird to talk about this one. There's variety, but it's nothing compared to the first game. You're mostly running around on the streets of Shanghai or in the buildings of Shanghai, but the variety comes in in the locations you're in. There's never a point, where something feels familiar or similar to something before. So, while it doesn't excel in this, it doesn't really fail at it either.Overall:Objective grade: 6/10 Above averageSubjective grade: 8/10 A truly great game(All games start at a 5/10 and move upwards/downwards based on the pros and cons presented in the review)P.S. All of this is from single-player. I didn't play in co-op. We all know co-op is better, so take that into consideration.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
												It's a fun, action packed game that has a short but compeling story if you pay attention to it.I finished the game in one go with a friend over co-op, the campaign lasts about 4 hours.The arcade mode is fun and gives the game an hour more if you want to get more time out of the game. On the multiplayer side it sounds and looks great, but there are no servers or players that you can find. During the co-op campaign I've experienced shaky player animations that weren't a problem, but brought a few laughs here and there. For those that have problems with the shaky camera and the grain effect, you can turn that off in the options menu. To summarize it's a medicore game with a few problems here and there, but it pulls through with its fun action packed gameplay, and story. I rate this game 6 out of 10.

number of helpful: 11 of 19 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 24, 2014
												This game could have been much better.First of all, let me highlight positive sides of the game (potential spoiler here). It has intensity and is pretty atmospheric. You are not playing as some badass heroes fighting for just cause. Kane and Lynch were complete bаstards in the first game, and they remain being themselves in this sequel. And even those attempts of Lynch to save his girlfriend don't change fact: he and Kane lack pretty much every good moral side that any normal person has. This makes you feel the originality of the game, as it clearly doesn't have modern popular action game cliches.But still, I can hardly recommend this game to anyone. I could barely follow the plot of the game, as it is unclear. Most of the time you are simply forced to survive in unending street gang and police gunfire. Graphically the game did not evolve even the slightest bit since "Dead Men", although there are solid 3 years between the releases of "Dead Men" and "Dog Days"; all they did is that swaying and shaking camera, as if an amateur cameraman follows every step of those two, shooting all the action on his mobile phone (it can be disabled in the options at least). Character control is rough, it lacks smoothness; try running around in co-op with your friend and you'll see. Cover system isn't great as well: you may get shot just because you hit "cover" at the wrong side of the cover itself, which leaves you exposed to enemy fire, and it takes some time to jump over to the other side. Leaving cover may not be always convenient, as the "cover" button has multiple functions depending on the nearest environment. AI is not smart at all, especially when in cover; you can simply run to the other side and shoot the crap out of your enemy while he won't be able to do anything about it, although this can be dangerous in the end, because there are usually lots of them; so, quantity over quality.And yeah, the game is too short. I mean, you are able to complete the singleplayer within, literally, 3 hours. Same is about the co-op.The game had potential, it just needed a lot more polishing. But alas.It may be worth a shot when on a discount, though.

content:
Posted: August 23, 2014
												I got this off the Humble bundle and I played around until I got really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and stopped. If you get this in a pack of games on the cheap and don't mind a 3rd person game with weird shooting - get it. Otherwise give it a pass.Pros:- The presentation is awesome- Kane and Lynch- ShanghaiCons:- The gunplay is beyond broken: hit detection is wack, recoil is over the top non-realistic (it goes all over the place even when I fire in bursts with an AK-like weapon, cmon)- The cover system is really a hit and miss: sometimes it'd get you stuck, sometimes you won't be able to get into cover and sometimes enemies somehow shoot you through a few layers of cover from an impossible angle- Enemy AI seems to hit me from across the level with an uzi / pistol, but when I shoot dead at them I get no hit markers nothing, with any weapon other than the sniper (which also doesn't work at times)- Friendly AI is complete garbage, often taking vital cover and leaving you completely vulnrable out in the open...this might be a level problem too, now that I think about it- Friendly AI's aim is...just as good as...VHS amateur porn from the 80s- On the sections where you and your Friendly AI partner are supposed to split into a two-lane style level the Friendly AI doesn't shoot the targets on its lane and they start shooting at you, and since it's a corridor where you're exposed from practically over 180C you get insta-slaughtered in no time

content:
Posted: September 13, 2014
												I loved the original Kane&Lynch when I first bought it for the xbox 360. I had never bothered with the sequel since I kept hearing so many negative opinionsWhoo boy were they right.The original game had a fairly interesting story to it and the action scenes were fun. From escaping a robbing a bank to rappeling down a skyscraper, it had me feeling like I was playing the video game version of 'Heat'. This game felt like a nonstop series of hallways and alleyways. Hallways in apartments, hallways in warehouses, hallways in airports. The one thing I did enjoy about this game was the whole handicam aesthetic. Its gimmicky and I had to turn off the shakycam sprinting but otherwise I liked the muddy noises and visual artifacts. Too bad it didnt cover up all of the awful bugs in this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
												Have you ever thought about taking on the Hong Kong underworld in a quest for vengeance, money and lost love? Well then this might be the game for you.This game takes everything the predecessor did and improves upon it immensely. The game play is much more responsive and fluid. The array of weaponry at your disposal really packs a punch adding to the heart pounding action you find from pretty much constant shoot outs.The story is winding and epic, with many great set pieces and extended firefights. The environments are more vivid and feel alive. The whole game takes place throughout Shanghai, from slums to sky scrapers each level feels unique and feels totally different. The characters are much more fleshed out and defined, there isn’t a huge cast of secondary characters but this game is focused almost exclusively on the main duo and their exploits in a very short period of time.I like this game and I had a good time working my way through everything. It is not the best game I have ever played but I did have a better time with it than the original. The one drawback is the sudden ending, but right up to that point everything was pretty solid. I would recommend this over the original but I still can’t recommend this at full price. Pick this up on sale, play it for a while but don’t bother completing it as you will be left with a bittersweet taste. Have fun ^_^

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
												Quick Summary: Kane & Lynch 2 is a superior product to the first game, not just with the improved graphics and arcade mode, but also with Steam achievements and co-op campaign play. It’s still inferior to Max Payne 3, but you should enjoy the experience. Note that the game is extremely short, and multiplayer is dead.Once again, you play one of the dysfunctional anti-heroes Kane or Lynch (which character you play switches during the campaign) and this time around you’re dealing with crime lords and corrupt officials in Shanghai. Both Kane and Lynch are bad dudes, so you’re not trying to clean up the streets, you just want to do your dirty work without being crushed by your powerful enemies. Despite the grittiness and ultra-violence in the story, the game is still censored for some reason. When you perform a headshot, the dead guy has his head pixelated. This appears to be a stylistic choice because there’s blood and gore everywhere, not to mention non-stop cursing.Just like Kane & Lynch 1, the game is played in third person and you run around blasting rival gangsters and taking cover to regenerate your health as needed. The bullets are flying everywhere, so you take cover or you’ll die. By the way, even on easy mode you die pretty fast in this game if you’re up close to the enemy. Don’t think you can just run up to everyone just because you have the difficulty set low. Just like in the first game, you can find all sorts of weapons dropped by your enemies, some good and some bad. In the multiplayer, guns you pick up have like half a clip of ammo, but in the campaign you can go through the levels picking and choosing what you want to use. Unlike the first game, you cannot request more ammo from your team mates.Pros:+Decent graphics and storyline.+The Fragile Alliance multiplayer mode is kind of fun, too bad nobody is playing online anymore. At least you can play it in Arcade mode with bots as team mates. Work together to grab cash, then turn on them so you can get it all!Cons:-Very short game. Maybe less than 5 hours for the campaign.-Nobody online to co-op with or play heists with.Overall if you got this game in the bundle with Kane & Lynch 1, give it a try because it’s better than the first game. It won’t blow you away though.

												So... This is my review for Kane And Lynch 2 Dog Days: 61% / 100%Gameplay: Well the gameplay is smooth I should say. Typicall TPS-Action shooter, but it plays fast in terms of taking cover, getting out of cover, shooting, running with camera action following you eveywhere.That's what made the game so excited while playing.Not even mentioning the weapons (there are pistols/assault rifles/shotguns and even a minigun in later missions.)But it is afterall, repetitive while you are reaching half of the game. (7/10)Gameplay Styles: Multiplayer is probably dead. So count that one out. Offline, you can complete the story missions in 4 difficulties (Easy-Medium-Hard-Extreme) which will give you 6-12 hours of gametime assuming, you try 2 difficulties. (4/10)Graphics: The graphics are not any type of special but they are well organized for a cover-based action TPS game.I'm talking about the weather, and other obstacles in every map. (5/10)Sounds: Weapon sounds are loud and clear for each weapon catagory. Characters-Wise , you hear them talking during missions which is nice even when you shoot or take cover. (6/10)Cover System: The cover system is well done, in levels of Max Payne series if you would. If you like a fast-paced and short action tps game with cover system, this is your game. (8/10) P.S even when you are down and hit, you can actually slide and shoot until you get up and take cover again.A.I: Your Side - Well it's not exactly A.I it's just one guy who's helping you alongside the campaign.He's shooting/taking cover exactly when nessecary and sometimes he will save your♥♥♥♥♥ I got no complains against the A.I in this game. Enemy Side - The A.I in Medium Difficult where challenging. I did die multiply times in a mission even tho I'm a great shooter.. So Imagine playing in Extereme Difficulty..I see the A.I a big part of this game, that's why I'm giving this section a (8.5/10)Enjoyment: (7/10) - It is fun to play for an hour or two but gets repetetive real quick.Repetetive: (6.5/10)Frustraiton (3/10) - Except for few unnessecary deaths.. I'm good.Boredom (2/10)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2016
												Short: K&L 2 is a game where you run around in a pretty city environment and shoot people while everyone around you is screaming and shouting things intensely. Long: K&L 2 is interesting. It’s one  of those games that tries to be a super-serious, hardcore, gritty, gang-war, weapon-selling, drug smuggling simulator where you’re never sure if the antagonists are heroes, or just a couple of tough guys out for themselves in a world that’s filled with horrible things.Now, we’ve all seen or played this plotline at one point or another before, but the difference between K&L 2 and say, GTA, is that in GTA I can never take the plot or the environment seriously, even though I get the feeling you’re meant to. Let’s be honest--you only do the missions in GTA because you have to, and really you’re just planning the next hooker bar you’re going to shoot up. Here’s where K&L 2 gains my respect--it maintains a more or less completely immersive experience within the environment I’ve described--it doesn’t relent in being an uncomfortable gritty world where the mire is as thick around the heroes as it is the world they live in.The environments in this game are superb--not strictly from a graphical sense, but from a design standpoint. Layouts feel natural and detailed; desks are lined with believable objects, streets are filled with restaurant tables and stacked chairs. It truly feels real, as you wander through the city streets and in cramped buildings.The problem is that in its essence, K&L 2 is merely another cover-and-shoot game. It starts off with you interrogating some guy, which quickly leads to taking cover and shooting a bunch of dudes. It then cuts to a car crash where you take cover and shoot a bunch of dudes. Kane and Lynch decide to go visit the gang boss that is harassing them in hopes of figuring out what’s going on--all the while taking cover and shooting all his dudes. You’re at a restaurant… suddenly people bust in and you take cover and shoot. Mechanically speaking, while the game isn’t horrible, it’s nothing new or particularly engaging.That’s not to say that the game is easy--staying true to its sense of immersion, it’s actually somewhat difficult. You never really feel powerful as you hide behind every piece of cover you can, and if you think you can run into a room and reliably gun everyone down like some super hero (or villain) you’ll quickly find yourself flat on your back in a puddle of your own bodily fluids. That being said, one rather unrealistic feature is that you can soak up more bullets than an elephant could, but considering the intelligent and coordinated attacks executed by your enemies, you need to in order to make the game playable while you learn your way around.Kane and Lynch are interesting characters, in spite of not really saying much about themselves. I’ll admit to having no clue about any of the previous plot concerning the duo, but the two of them have an uncanny unspoken chemistry between them--something that oddly might be described even in the short time that I saw them, as a trusting love. That being said though, very little of who they are, what they do, or what their motives are, are revealed to the player early on. I have no doubt that there would be some interesting twist, some dark reveal near the third act of the game’s story, but I haven’t played far enough to see it, and I’m not sure I’m really motivated to do so.In closing, I feel that K&L 2 would probably have made a much better under-funded TV show than a game, if they could somehow have kept the same feeling the game provided and just cut out 80% of the “running around and shooting guys” segments. Kane and Lynch are interesting characters, and I would love to see more of them… I’m just not sure that I’m willing to fight through bloodbath after bloodbath to find out. I would recommend that those who enjoy cover shooters with a gritty, uncomfortable, Pulp-Fiction-like atmosphere give it a try, but otherwise you might, like me, find yourself wishing you could just walk through the well-built streets of China, listening to conversations between Kane and Lynch instead of the sounds of bullets and the F-bomb being dropped every-other sentence.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2011
												Bland, unoriginal, uninspired. Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is exactly how you shouldn't do a sequel and why you shouldn't do a sequel to a bad game anyway. The worst thing about it has to be the use of the awkward Youtube filter, it blurs the visuals and makes what could of been a visually superb game into a grotesque being equivilent of Katie Price. Ultimately this Gears clone lacks any sort of a substance. Kane & Lynch 2 has a weak story, weaker characterisation and is an unrewarding experience all in all. Levels grow repetitive fast, cover doesn't actually work and online co-op is laggy even on a solid connection. Please, please, please avoid Kane & Lynch 2. IO Interactive, it's developers, are capable of more - their work on Freedom Fighters and Hitman is evidence of this. As attractive as Kane and Lynch 2 may seem, especially for it's low cost price tag, the game is worth no attention.

content:
Posted: August 5, 2016
												I don't find this game to be bad, but rather the opposite. The one negative point people tend to make, is that the camera is god awful. I don't think so. I beleive that it makes the game unique and really fits in the gritty world of kane and lynch. (Also, if it bothers some people that much, a simple trip to the control settings will solve your problem).Speaking about the world. The developers really did a good job portraying Shanghais underbelly. They did good work with the story, and an absolute steller job with the setting, which really stands out to me, especially the neon lights and market stalls. The gameplay is solid, responsive and brutal. The game does get rather challenging on higher difficulties, but that is to be expected. Sadly i wasn't given the chance to play the multiplayer portion of the game, because it's practically dead. Although the arcade mode is a good distraction and serves as an offline multiplayer mode. There is also a co-oprative campaign mode, which the players will both control Kane and Lynch.The only really negative thing i can really make about this game, is that there are some minor bugs (nothing game braking), short story mode (finished it in a few houres) and finally the ending...What a bad ending. The reason why it's bad is because the game just ends. That's it. No real conclutuion to their story or anything like that. Overall, the game is good. Dispite those hiccups, the game is a fun and solid experience. If anything, download the games demo. If it interests you, buy the game only when it's on sale.

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 17, 2014
												The problem with Kane and Lynch is not the approach IO Interactive has to tell a story. Some notable elements people do not like about the game: shaky cam when running (you can actually turn this off), pixelation and "elongated" lighting effects. The last two are in line with the documentary style concept the developers had - all these serve to tell you a story in a more realistic way. To a certain degree you feel like watching a sequel to Heat. Now, how cool is that, right?The problem with Kane and Lynch is how IO Interactive could not put these pieces together very well. Instead, the game is marred by several other issues that do not let you understand what the creators tried to achieve here. Notable examples: the game is extremely short. Can be completed in a couple of hours and then you are off to coop should you be able to find anyone out there waiting for you for the same reason (it is unlikely, though). The game utilises a cover-based system in a horrible way: enemies can easily hit you once behind cover for no apparent reason. This is challenging, yes, but not in a positive way. Furthermore, each and every foe is a sharp-shooter while you can barely hit anyone with precision aiming as the controls are so bad. Even headshots do not count occasionally. And as throughout a level you are apt to eliminate dozens of criminals, cops and members of the special forces the aiming issue is an unforgivable one.It is already difficult to accept a game that follows a very violent, dark and gritty theme. IO Interactive made it even more difficult by not paying enough attention to the gameplay itself - it is simply not fun to play this game. Its predecessor was already a passable product but this is quite horrible, actually. Skip this one and pick up something else that is on sale.

Posted: January 16, 2014
												This is a really cool and stylized thrird-person shooter.  The game takes place from the perspective of Lynch and if you can find someone to play with you can get a very Dead Space 3 type game in which Lynch is having delusions that Kane cannot see.  Dog Days is really interesting because you are throwsn into a gang war right from the start.  The camera is really well done in a modern reality T.V. type perspective as though it is a camera person following you around.  This leads to the action feeling appropriately jarring and disorienting.  I'm really enjoying this so far and find it to be a huge improvement over the forst game.  Definitely check this out and get a friend to play with if possible.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												My review is based purely off single player mode. Do understand that this game comes with multiplayer mode as well as co-op mode which might differ from my playthrough experience.I was very excited about this game right after i finished the prequel. The excitment was because the prequel was promising, and had potential back did not deliver thus I was excited to play this sequel hoping to see improvement. Man was i disappointed.Yes its true that there are improvements on the gameplay etc, but the major turn off about this sequel is the camera. From what i read about censorship, it seems that the developer chose for a "handheld", "youtube", "homemade" camera art direction style. Oh my, its the first time i ever get giddy from playing a FPS.Improvements such as better aiming and hit recognition (still bad) can be seen in this sequel. The AI partner also has been improved greatly. They actually do kill the enemies unlike the previous game. Storyline is very shallow, worst still than the first. I personaly preferred the plot of the first story. Not to worry, you won't miss out much in terms of story if you decide to hope into this.I would say i'm greatly disappointed about this game. Just can't wait to faster finish it (self fullfillment of clearing backlog) and leave it in my library for good.Do not recommend it.

number of helpful: 11 of 20 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 3, 2015
												Most of film directors and film studios are professional in specific genre(s). It usualy does'nt work when a famous director who makes horror films, leaves his major genre to make movies in different genre, for example comedy. It would be interesting to see their effort in different fields but just for a test. It would take so much time and effort if Rockstar want to leave open world games to develop a FPS like COD and I believe it won't be a good game, atleast not like COD.I wrote all the description above to say it dose'nt work for IO interactive too. When they developed the first Kane and Lynch, I played it and it was obvious that the game is'nt a good Third Person Shooter. I found that IO is not a good shooter developer and they should remain at stealth genre and just rule at Action/Stealth kingdom. I was never thinking that IO is going to develop a sequel for Kane and Lynch.Kayne and Lynch Dog Days is just ordinary and even bad. Like the previous game, here we face repetitive action flow in most of levels. Developers have tried to refresh the game flow by defining some action scenarios like shooting from a flying heli or scorting a car but num. of these scenes are very low and they can't help. Shooting machanic does'nt feel good again just like KL1. Enemy AI is awful and It does'nt try to challange player through the appropriate way like flanking, changing cover to get some better position or trying to get player out of his cover; they just wait for player to peek cover to start shooting him. In some of the levels, there are encounters which player faces so many enemies and because of AI system. it just turns into a frustrating battle. The only innovating element of the game is its camera which would seem very intresting, but after a few minutes, the feel of interest will be replaced with headache because of its shake and noises. Kane and Lynch characters may seem attractive at the first place. I know people who say they like Kane and Lynch serie just because of their characters. But good characters need room in a good story to act and shine. Both Kane and Lynch games have very simple and repetitive story so there's no chance for characteriztion. Honestly, I really don't know why some of gamers like Kane and Lynch characters, because except some cool visual elements, Kane is an ordinary criminal who loves his daughter and Lynch is a crazy idiot partner who always makes trouble.After all things I wrote, you better know that Kane and Lynch 2 has an online mode too with some interesting modes, and you can also play coop throuhg main campaign with another player which sounds great. But unfortunately, there are no online players most of time and unless you have some friends in this game to play with, you won't be able to try the online or coop mode.Final word, just try IO's hitmans and enjoy them because there's nothing precious in Kane and Lynch waiting for you.

content:
Posted: December 28, 2013
												This game really isn't as bad as some people say. Once you disable the annoying effects and enable steadycam in the options menu, the game actually becomes a fairly solid 3rd person cover shooter that you can play with your friend for about five hours or so. If you can get Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days at a low price during sales, then it's worth your time. But I wouldn't recommend paying more than 2€ for it.The game is not perfect though, and it does have flaws. One complaint I have is that the enemies take a lot of bullets before they die unless you can land a perfect headshot. Also the controls can feel a bit floaty compared to other games in the genre, but this is something that you get used to after playing for a while. Besides that the game is a lot of fun when played in co-op mode. Just make sure to disable the "Fullscreen Effects" before you start playing.

												This gritty, new-age, third person shooter brings Shanghai to life in a brand new way.   Kane and Lynch are back in a new action packed adventure that will keep your blood pumping all through-out.  The dynamic between the characters is less like actors, and more like life-long friends. You really begin to attach yourself to these characters, whether its lovable Kane, the tough guy with the heart of gold, or that wacky Lynch the comedic relief of this otherwise serious game. All in all its the best game i have ever played. (2.5/10)

												Jesus, this kotaku BIG TURD web site don't know♥♥♥♥♥♥about video games ! Kane & Lynch 1 & 2 are in my favorite games list. They are living Action-movies, with an outstanding level design, dynamic movie-style' story-telling, very immersive "taking cover" gameplay, and even the voices and the sounds are way better than in most games. You can replay chapters with different weapons or for achievements, you always have enough ammo or you can pick up enemy weapons if not, and when you take cover for a while, you recover slowly, which is a very good gameplay option to keep you focus on the action. (better than running under enemy fire like a crazy rabbit to pick up ammo like in "The Heist" or than searching for med packs)And in addition to the story you can play it in coop with a friend or even play the multiplayer mode alone with bots.In 2014, this game is still beautiful.Thanks to Square Enix & I.O. those games are as nervous and powerfull as their model HEAT. I want Kane & Lynch 3 !

Posted: November 12, 2015
												Sadly a short, awkward, terrible looking game.  Some interesting ideas, but quite poorly executed.  I really wanted to try and meet it halfway but ultimately felt it outstayed it's welcome even though it is also a very short campaign.  Best played on easy as the mechanics don't hold up to a satisfying playthrough on the harder settings.  Momentum is important to the scripted scenes fast pacing and I feel this breaks down when the enemies take many hits.  The guns are unbelievably inaccurate and once all the eye candy/ set dressing has been destroyed and yet you are still firing at the same enemy in cover, well it becomes rather tedious and at odds with the narrative.Really can't recommend overall.  Just not worth your time.

Kane and Lynch are back in a new action packed adventure that will keep your blood pumping all through-out.  The dynamic between the characters is less like actors, and more like life-long friends.
