Posted: November 12, 2015
												Sadly a short, awkward, terrible looking game.  Some interesting ideas, but quite poorly executed.  I really wanted to try and meet it halfway but ultimately felt it outstayed it's welcome even though it is also a very short campaign.  Best played on easy as the mechanics don't hold up to a satisfying playthrough on the harder settings.  Momentum is important to the scripted scenes fast pacing and I feel this breaks down when the enemies take many hits.  The guns are unbelievably inaccurate and once all the eye candy/ set dressing has been destroyed and yet you are still firing at the same enemy in cover, well it becomes rather tedious and at odds with the narrative.Really can't recommend overall.  Just not worth your time.

content:
Posted: February 28, 2015
												I don't know why people dog on this so much (see what i did huh huh, no? f*ck you then) from the reviews i read beforehand and from just having played the first game this is much better than i expected, much less jank than the first one, i really enjoyed the shooting in this.This had to have influenced Max Payne 3 as well from an aesthetic perspective. For some reason which isn't explained in the game, there is an documentary style guerrilla filmmaking gimmick used in this, where when you run the camera shakes behind you violently like Paul Greengrass is the cameraman. There is also this terrible filter used throughout the game where the faraway image is compressed and when you move around or things explode you can clearly see compression artifacts...purposefully done to cement the fact that you are viewing this on a really bad £200 handheld camera. This is never even explained in game from a storytelling point of view, like seeing the police or someone watching the footage back. It's just one of the worst if not THE worst design decisions i have ever seen used in a game before. There is even this pixelation that occurs when you shoot or shotgun enemies in the face, like they do on tv when it's too graphic to censor it or they want to blur someones identity (again unexplained).Max Payne 3 had a blurry drunken effect every so often throughout the cutscenes which was a mistake but nowhere near as bad as this. One thing i noticed is that both games removed being able to use grenades which annoyed the hell out of me, i miss using grenades! you're taking my fun away.There is an option to turn off the shakycam in the game if it makes you feel nauseous, i kept it on because i was already used to it and it looked weird to me when it was turned off.Story wise i still don't understand why Kane & Lynch continue to work together, especially after what happens to them halfway through the game. After what they were put through why would Kane continue hanging out with Lynch? There was talk of them making a movie out of this property and if that ever happens i really hope the writing is 100 times better than what they used in the games.If you can get past those decisions then the actual gameplay is fun and the level of detail used in recreating Shanghai where the game is set is second to none. It really feels like you are in Shanghai and there is a nice variety of locations throughout the city, but the best ones are in the first half of the game, with more warehouse style bland stages towards the end, with a peak again at the end with a shootout at an airport. The graphics are a huge step up from the first Kane & Lynch.The game is really short though, i completed it in 3 hours (it's meant to take 4) but i did play it on the easiest setting to start with. Multiplayer seems to be dead, i couldn't get into any games, but apparently there is a bot mode where you can play against AI.I would recommend this if you can find it dirt cheap like i did and are a fan of shooter games, and cover based Gears of War style gameplay.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Despite quite a short campaign with a fairly abrupt ending, this game is still worth playing because of its co-operative mode.The visual style is very dark and dreary, as if filmed from a low-end camcorder in the hands of a novice journalist documenting the exploits of an ex-mercenary and his unmedicated psychotic best friend, complete with light flaring, grainy image and mosaic censoring out headshots and nudity.The co-op campaign is interesting enough as-is, but the game also comes in a co-operative/backstabbery multiplayer flavor called 'Fragile Alliance' where teammates rob a cache of money and compete to try to make it out with the most cash. Everyone starts out as friends and teammates, but at any moment any player could decide to betray the alliance, to try to keep his share for himself and not split it. This fact keeps the multiplayer very dynamic and tense, and you have to keep an eye over your shoulder constantly, as any of your teammates could decide to shoot you in the back, given the opportunity. The multiplayer is, in that way, just as vicious as the campaign.The game isn't without flaws, the campaign is fairly short and ends pretty suddenly, and the story may be lacking in some departments. But it's still a solid title for people itching to play something with a friend. As opposed to the first game, this title can be played in co-op online.The gameplay is fairly standard third person cover shooter with pretty entertaining gunplay and cool effects.All in all I recommend a buy. It's 9,99€ so if you want a good co-op experience, do pick it up.

												Kane and Lynch 2 is in some ways better and some ways worse than the previous game. This game focuses more on Lynch and has a great atmosphere and presentation once you're used to it. content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												Vastly superior to the first game, what this game lacks in plot it makes up for with its impression of constant forward progression and connectivity between levels. Unlike the first game, this time you play through as the more interesting of the two, Lynch (until the final level, for no clear reason), and it's more of a typical AAA third-person cover-shooter. The constant shaky-cam will likely make you feel ill after a while (imagine your average 'running' shaky-cam when you walk, and multiply that by 4 when you run in this game), but it's not too bad as to be unplayable. There's no team management like the first, but Dog Days give you far more interesting visuals, locations (if you like a Chinese aesthetic) and set-pieces (the standout moment of playing a full level compltely naked after being tortured). This game is by no means ground-breaking, but if you like the genre you won't find anything too offensive here.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2014
												Pros: One of the most intense shooters out there. The "YouTube/documentary" filters(and don't complain about the "hand-held" camera style - go to Options, turn Steadicam on. You're welcome) are well-done and a memorable approach to the gritty, realistic TPS. Both new multiplayer modes are great(Undercover Cop joins Fragile Alliance in providing a unique approach to multiplayer shooter game-play). The setting of the crime-ridden, corrupt-laden Shanghai manages to be bleak without getting boring, repetitive or off-putting. Controls, shooting and cover mechanics are responsive, open enough to not feel linear yet tight enough that it always does what you want it to. This never, ever lets up, telling the story, establishing characters and keeping it all moving with twists along the way without ever, for a single second, pausing... and yet it doesn't overpower the player; it's like The Terminator in video-game form. Challenging. Online co-op. Great graphics and atmosphere.Cons: Not only should the first one never have a sequel, but plot-wise, this does not need to exist, and completely undersells both leads; why is Kane doing another job(and don't say "money for you-know-who" - that's an excuse, and not even a good one), and in what *universe* could Lynch "settle down" like this? This is one of the shortest SP campaigns you'll ever find, and the ending is unsatisfying. Multiplayer is all but dead, the only way you'll get a match going is to find people who also want it.My recommendation: Only the biggest fans of the TPS gritty crime story will like this, and most people will never need to give this even a first look.

content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												Well, I would have said they just didn't have the time or money to make this properly. But they made one before it... and it was just as bad. I'm not really sure what they're thinking... it must sell to some large group of idiots or something. The bad guys run around like headless chickens and appear and disappear all over things. Like briefly on top of a box, suddenly behind a car, at the top of stairs suddenly at the bottom. They can be anywhere, and you won't be able to hit them because the accuracy of your gun really sucks. So shooting a lot and having very limited ammo and having erratic NPC behavior is not fun at all. Also, the cutscenes have overly shaky cam. Why? I have no idea, I mean it's super shaky, so bad that i can't even stand to look at it. It's horrible, like you have a disease or something... who thought that was a good idea? They didn't put any thought into this, no quality control, no polish... it's a game that is still in beta. Don't bother buying it unless you really like being annoyed.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
Kane & Lynch 2: We should have stopped at oneThe first thing I noticed with this game, was a headache. I mean, the shaky cam gave me a headache, and for the first time in my life I got to experience motion sickness. Once I figured out where they hid the option for the shaky cam (hint: it's in the controls section), I finished the main game in only 3 hours... without rushing.The main story revolves around Kane and Lynch getting together for one more job. Everything goes to hell, and you shoot your way out. That is pretty much the whole story, right there. I wish I was kidding right now.The game was short, repetitive, and for the most part, downright awful. Aiming sucked, the cover-based mechanics were sub-par, and the story was nowhere to be found. The graphics, while alright in some places, were stitched together with overused lighting effects, and what J. J. Abrams would consider to be too many lens flares. This was likely used in an attempt to hide their rushed graphics.They also do this weird thing in the game where they censor headshots... you shoot someone in the head, a big blur spot appears and breaks immersion. If you want to kill a game, this is a good place to start. Was it supposed to be artistic, like the shaky cam?I'm really not sure there is much to recommend with this game, I barely stuck with it long enough to finish it.Graphics: 6/10 (once you turn off shaky cam)Story: 2/10 (Hey, we're shooting people... that's a story, right?)Gameplay: 5/10 (it was playable, not much else)Overall: ... 3/10? I don't know, the game sucked and caused me physical pain from trying to play it.Not recommended.

content:
Posted: March 28, 2016
												Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is much better than the first game. However, I still cannot recommend the game due to the extremely short story (<3 hours to complete) which makes no sense, insanely shakey camera (you need to turn on SteadyCam to remove), and the unnecessary full screen effects and filters (you can also turn this off under Video options), and no attempt whatsoever to develop the story or the characters. It appears the characters have had their personalities "changed" from the first game and there's very little mention of actions from the first game. It's almost like they took the characters and just put them in a whole new game without any care about the first game. The graphics and gameplay this time is much better, however there's simply not enough content in this game to keep people interested. The story is forgettable where you just run around Shanghai killing everyone for no reason and the arcade mode/multi-player is fun the first time around and then you realize it's essentially PayDay.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												Not sure why this game gets so much hate. Sure, if I had paid a lot for it, 3.5 hours of single player content is simply not enough. Pick this up in the bargain basement however, and that's 3.5 hours of highly stylised adult entertainment, that feels like playing a movie.Graphics look highly original and stylised (but only with full screen effects left on) and the gun play does feel good, once you realise that SMG and Shotguns are next to worthless and that headshots are king.The compression artefacts are overdone, as well as the shaky cam when running. In the last level this actually made me feel a little ill. However I found the cam when walking etc to be great, and it felt like a movie.If you are looking for a quick, violent adult experience that plays a little like the child of Gears of War and a Quentin Tarantino movie, this is for you. Wouldn't pay more then £5 for it though! 7/10.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2011
												While the original Kane and Lynch may be remembered for its review controversy, for me, it was a title that really tried to do something fresh and unique in a lot of ways. Kane and Lynch: Dead Men had main characters that were difficult to like, but by the end of the dark and compelling story to save Kane’s family, players felt a bit of Stockholm Syndrome for the duo. The co-op, while offline only, offered a unique perspective for both players, something we rarely see in the age of co-op clone characters. The sequel has arrived and our anti-heroes are back again, this time across the world in Shanghai with Lynch’s story as the focus. But can Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days recapture the same fresh feeling of the first game?The story of Dog Days has Kane meeting up with his old pal Lynch who promises a job with plenty of riches. Upon Kane’s arrival a simple task for the two turns sour and inadvertently starts a gang war. Soon you realize that your deal is going south as your contact is attacked in an intense highway assault and you make a desperate attempt to escape with all your lives. It wasn’t long after this I lost what was going on, the overall purpose of what the duo was doing.Despite some great voice acting and plenty of memorable lines - I had completely forgot the purpose of what I was doing midway through the title. “Why am I shooting these army guys again?” I asked my co-op partner. It had something to do with a big Chinese mob boss and not dieing, but beyond that everything is a bit of chaos. Perhaps this is what IO Interactive was going for, as the main character this time is Lynch, who’s not exactly mentally stable. There’s plenty of times Lynch voices over to himself, trying to use psychological tricks to calm his nerves - no doubt from some sort of therapy sessions.The graphical style and display are going to be the most memorable and controversial piece to this game, the shaky YouTube style camera is either going to be a complete turn off or something people really like. At moments the grainy and over saturated look of the game world makes it look eerily realistic. The neon glow of lights bouncing off reflective surfaces, the distant city line of Shanghai, and the dark alleys all can trick your eye in an almost photo realistic moment. Other times poor textures in certain areas, stiff character animation and improper lip syncing totally break the immersion.Shortly into my first mission I almost felt nauseous from the camera movement - but it passed. The shaky camera is only really bad while running and once you get used to it, it provides some useful info on enemy position and adds to the immersive effect. Thankfully if you can’t get over it you can disable it, though it’s still there to some degree. IO Interactive really wanted to have the feeling of intense and gritty shoot outs. They wanted your palms sweaty and your grip tightening on your controller through every twist and turn. To some degree, this holds true. There were times the firefights were memorable, with exploding objects and cover flying everywhere as bullets rained down on Kane and Lynch. The atmosphere is further enhanced by Asian inspired pop music blasting from in game radios and intercoms, giving it an almost John Woo movie feel in certain situations.Sadly the intensity is broken once you realize the firefights break down into duck, pop up wait for guy to peak his head out of cover, and shoot mechanic. This style of combat is rinse and repeat for most of the game with save for a few battles. Which is sad, because some of the key moments like a helicopter attack on and in an office building and a mission where you need to cover Lynch’s girlfriend in an apartment building across the street are really fun. The level after Kane and Lynch are tortured is one that will be forever burned into my retinas. I just wish there was more of these moments. Kane and Lynch 2 does make a huge improvement in terms of co-op options over it’s predecessor. Full online play and local play is supported and there’s options for matchmaking too. And while the single player is fun, like all good co-op games, playing this with a friend is much more satisfying. You can really tell that K&L 2 was designed from the ground up for co-op play; level layouts are well crafted into separate paths for cover and flanking maneuvers and there’s a nice balance of weapons to choose from for both close and long range giving players defined roles. One thing that sadly appears to be missing is some of the crazier elements of Lynch from the first game - instance where the players actually see different things. As far as we could tell they weren’t as prominent as the cops/civilians bank scene from the first game. Co-Op makes the game a bit easier as well. While in the single player game if you get shot you’ll get knocked down and have a chance to get up, a second subsequent knock down will kill you. In co-op this second knockdown is actually revivable by your co-op partner. This can help in some of the trickier situations when the game is throwing what seems like hundreds of guys your way only to be killed by the last group and having to do it all over again. While the checkpoint system seems ok, it never seems to be quite enough, and starting a co-op game will lose any single player checkpoint progress - so you’ll need to restart back at a chapter beginning. It’s these little nagging issues that constantly remind you that perhaps Kane and Lynch 2 wasn’t quite ready. I hit numerous technical bugs as well - mostly while playing as a guest co-op player over Xbox Live. Cut scenes were missing characters, character animations got stuck, audio cut out on me completely, and the game even crashed at one point. Strangely while playing solo or as the host these seemed almost non existent. If you don’t want to play Fragile Alliance online there’s a new Arcade mode where you can use all AI guys and try to get the highest score possible. This mode is surprisingly addictive, though, it does get a bit long in the tooth by the 9th or 10th round. The game will up the difficulty with every round and you can keep going until you run out of your 3 lives. So does Kane and Lynch 2 deliver that fresh feeling of the first game? Sadly I don’t think it does. While IO did a great job of fixing the cover and shooting mechanic, adding online co-op, and deepening the addictive multiplayer modes - it seems the rest of the game suffered as a result. With two characters as memorable and unique as Kane and Lynch, I was sad to see the story - which took only 5 hours to complete - a bit lacking. Don’t get me wrong, Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days isn’t a bad game, it’s just not a great one. The Co-Op Experience: Team up online or offline through the story in co-op with a friend. Play as Kane or Lynch and work together with a revival mechanic. Online play allows 8 players to rob a bank together in a Fragile Alliance that can turn co-op into competitive. Co-Op Score: 3.5 out of 5 General Score: 3 out of 5

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												I want to start by saying that I absolutely loved the first game. I'd heard bad things about it, but wanted to play it for myself and give it a chance to stand on its own.IMHO, this game is terrible. The story is nonsensical. It seems to try and be gritty for the sake of it. Its extremely clunky! It seems to play far worse than the first game, which to be honest also had some flaws in regards to smooth gameplay. It all feels slapped together hastily and in the most wonky way possible. I was shocked that it was made by the same team from the first game.I got it on sale a while back for around $3 I think. I beat it in one sitting, and I unlocked a slew of achievements that were just handed to the player, well because. I didn't do anything special, just obtained achievements for playing the game. I don't feel that a game should be measured based on how long it is, but I really can't honestly say my 3.7 hours was 'fun'. I finished it just for the sake of doing so, and because of how much I loved the first game.If you are curious about Kane & Lynch, play the first game. If you are interested in playing multiplayer, then 'maybe' play this one? I didn't play the multiplayer, but it does look like it offers some decent fun with interesting modes. You may also like this game if you love shakey-cam...seriously, this game is Shakey-cam and Camera Filters 2: Dog Days -_-What happened IO Interactive? What happened? :(Pros: Kane & Lynch are interesting characters overall         Some of the sound effects are decent         The voice acting is fairly good         Some of the environments are pretty awesomeCons: Terrible cover system           Really really really bad gunplay           AI so stupid, it made my head hurt! Or maybe it was-           The shakey-cam...seriously, too much shaking           Very short with a stupid ending thrown in for good measure

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 18, 2015
												Kane and Lynch are back in this sequel and it is improved. While the story still doesn't deliver, the game is a big improvment from its previous version. This tyme around we play as both main characters from the games. Everything was repolished and improved in this sequel. The enemy AI is not good here, however the damage you take from getting hit have increased and the game will throw tons of enemies at you all the time. Now you need to be careful not to get hit, because 4 to 5 shots from an automatic gun will take you down on normal difficulty. The graphics have increased drasticaly and the good cover system is back with even more destruction. It is obvious that the sequel has the same concept as the previous game, but this time around the overall story and feeling of the game is much darker. You will find really disturbing scenes and crazy new ideas the developers used to make a great experience.Don't worry about multiplayer, because this time around it works. However you won't find many people playing this game. But once you gather a group the multiplayer mods are really enjoyable. Such as cops and crooks.The different levels of difficulty and new achivments will make you want to come back to replay some levels you unlock. However, one of the annoying aspects of the game is the camera system. The default camera system is aweful. It will shake a lot when you run or fire the weapons, they try to make the game more realistic but it just gets extreamlly annoying not to be able to shoot your enemies because of it. Thankfully there is an option to tun off this shakey camera system, which improves the gameplay a lot. This time around the weapons have some good weight and feel good to fire. Alhtough they are not very accurate and one can't simply click the mouse button like crazy, they still feel good to use.Overall this sequel is an improvment over the first game with an even darker feel and good combat. The game is still short but fun. Good:- The mood of the game and overall feel- Improved difficulty - Voice acting and characters- Great Multiplayer (if you can find a match)Bad: - Shakey camera system, even in cutscenes- Censored head shots and nudity (with pixels)- Again the game is too short (4-5 hrs. to finish on normal in Single Player mode :/)76/100

												As a Dane who loved the original HitMan from Danish IO Interactive I also eventually decided to like the original Kane & Lynch Dead Men. There is so much wasted potential in this unsatisfying game.You will hate the generic enemies coming at you in endless waves and if you have played the original the missed oppotunity in regards to the story will be down right insulting. Actually the story is insulting even compared to a generic shooter as the ending sets a new standard for 'worst ever'.While the original also had broken game mechanics you came to accept this as a 'factor' in the fights. In Dog Days it's even worse. At the end of the day I'm sad to say the game is not worth your time.

												A nauseating experience even with the horrendous camera effects disabled. Most firefights are orchestrated behind cover, turning the game into a cakewalk even on the hardest difficulty coupled with truly putrid graphics and engine glitches that turn even a modest playthrough into a bug-ridden train-wreck.The gunplay is awful, with most weapons having the realistic accuracy of an episode of Operation Repo with a multiplayer element that is actually worse then the first game.And that's just the gameplay. Kane and Lynch are a couple of morally bankrupt ♥♥♥♥♥♥s and the story is a♥♥♥♥♥♥show from start to finish with no rhyme or reason to the chaos and sensless logic of our main leads.The only redeeming qualities are the COOP (preferably while done drunk) and the (praise the lord) laughably short lengh. There is nothing fun about this game! The entire experience went by like the worst day at school and my only regret is that I should have spent the paultry sale price on a decent BLT.Spend your money elsewhere, hell, spend it on Hitman Absolution. You can rightfully execute both Kane and Lynch who make a cameo a couple times in the main game. That's a great selling-point in my book.

number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												Rating 6.5/10 Recommend at discountOverview: Third Person ShooterThe Good:+ The only thing that I can say is good is Arcade mode. A mode in which you and 7 npc's rob a location and then proceed to the extraction point fighting off police. The cool thing is you can kill your own partners and collect their money at the expense of everybody turning on you. The mode features different maps to play on, some easier than others. The AverageThe single player campaign is woefully average, from the graphics to the gameplay to the design, nothing about it stands out. The game has a filter to give the appearance that its being filmed by a cheap video camera, apparently this is suppose to make the game 'edgy' but in reality its incredibly annoying. The good news however is that you can turn this filter off. Technically the graphics are good giving you plenty of graphical options to play with yet artistically the game is boring, every level looks and feels the same and no risk or creativity was taken with the level design. In a third person shooter you need interesting set pieces to keep things fresh and engaging and this game has none of that. Every level plays out exactly the same way, enter a room, kill wave of enemies and proceed to the next area...rinse and repeat until the game is over. One aspect the campaign got right was your AI companion is actually useful and is pretty effective in combat, something that I rarely see in games these days, most AI companions are either incompetent, bullet sponges or distractions. The other positive thing I can say is that the campaign is short so you don't have to suffer through mediocrity for too long.The character Kane and Lynch are decently written but nothing really makes them stand out among the other generic videogame characters in the same genre.  The Bad:Multiplayer is dead as usual, shame, because if arcade mode is anything to go by, multiplayer looks like fun.ConclusionI never played Kane and Lynch before, the first one requires GFWL...so yeah... and this game did little to impress me. There are plenty of other great third person shooters on Steam worth your attention and money. This is a game you play when you have no other games to play. Worth purchasing at a steep discount.

The game was so much fun because my friend and I didn't take it seriously (like everything else) and in turn made it fun.  This game has a lot of bad reviews, I recommend getting it on sale with a friend if you just want to have a laugh at this game.

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												This game only took 3 hours to complete, that being said I only paid $2.50 for it so it meets my value requirements.  The gunplay is pretty fun, the recoil really isnt that bad just don't be firing on full auto.  Being an invulnerable tank is part of what makes the game fun.  The cover system is a little wonky but I didn't have much trouble with it, only got me killed a few times.  Your allies have the aim of a 5 year old attempting to fire a S&W 500 but is also an unkillable bullet sponge so I think thats a balance thing.This game gets more hate than it deserves, did the develpers mail it in? Probably. Is it still pretty fun? Yes. Is it worth buying? At $2.50 yes.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												I never was able to play the first game in the series, and went into this game knowing nothing about it or its background.I can't say very much for the story. It is violent, but I can't get a hold of the story. I'm a believer that you should be able to glean even a bit of story if you jump into a sequel, but there is none of that here. It almost seems as if you're just re-enacting a bunch of gunfight scenes from a bunch of different movies.One thing I noticed is that a lot of the game seems similar to those 'carnival-style' games where you have to shoot the ducks as they pop up behind obstacles.Another criticism I have is the lack of jumping. You have to crouch, then press a combination of forward and uncrouch. It's a 21st century 3D game, how hard is it to add jumping over obstacles?The graphics are fairly good, but I hate the way the camera moves. I get that its supposed to be mimicking a handheld camera, but it really goes over the top, and it makes it very hard to play the game.Also, the very-close over the shoulder angle is very difficult to play by.As for sound design, I found that in some of the cutscenes the background sounds were loud enough to encroach on the spoken words, and I had to rely on subtitles.I just don't think this is very much of a game. I guess if you're a fan of the series you might be able to make more out of it, but to me it just seems awful.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												I love Kane and Lynch, don't get me wrong.Everything about the game itself is appealing and really well done.This is the second chapter in a third-person shooter franchise made by the creators of Hitman.It is gritty, it is vulgar and it is relentless.Most of the issues people complain about are the cinematic effects the developers chose.Which admittedly after awhile I did get nauseous, but you can turn it off in the settings menu.The most I can describe it is that the camera moves as you move.The idea was they wanted to give you the sense that you were being followed by a guy holding a camera.It's a cool concept and it was innovative going even further with blurred out ultra-violence...And I get that the dev's wanted a sense of realism and immersion. But such type of immersion hurts. Alot.Anyway, it's the port I have a real issue with. You see I have 184 products in my account and none of them have any issues launching...None except this one.It will get the start menu and crash upon clicking anything. I have to disable my internet connection if I want to play the game. That is really, really lame and there is 100% no excuse for such a thing.I will be uninstalling this as soon as I am done and never playing again.Gameplay 8/10Game on PC 5/10

content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												★★☆☆☆ - "Average at best, Id give it a miss" PROS:- Destruction effects are pretty good- Difficulty is just right and is a decent challenge (played on normal)- Range of guns and you you can shoot them at people or gas canistersCONS:- Cover system is awful, especially getting up into cover. The game will place you against any surface in the line of fire or not, many frustrating deaths to be had.- AI is terrible, they stand in the middle of nowhere going in circles or go through walls and kill you out of nowhere.- Both characters are unlikable.- Story is non-existant, but you dont care cause the characters are pants.- Controls are clunky.- Opponents, gameplay, script is all repetitive, even the animations are the same.- Shakey camera, I dont usually have a problem with this and understand its effects in both game & film, when done right. Here it isnt, its quite funny cause when you run you cant see a single thing.- Filter, there is some type of dull filter on the screen which makes everything look like dog crap, ah thats where they got the title from!VERDICT? I played this through just because I wanted to shoot at things but the game is just lazy in every aspect so I cannot recommend it.

												Didn't know exactly what to expect when I purchased this title.. So far it has been quite enjoyable. For a moment I actually thought that something was wrong with my monitor because their were blue lines going through my screen and some distortion, but it turned out to be part of the experience. You feel like someone is following you with a video recorder.. Took some getting used to but it really adds to the atmosphere of being in a run down part of town in constant gun fights, battling for your life while someone is filming the entire thing. Some areas can be quite challenging but overall fun. Has good graphics, sound, and controls.. The story is dramatic with some disturbing moments.. basically everything I paid for.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												Kane & Lynch 2 is another example of why the outside public believe gaming is aimed at an adolescent audience of monosyllabic thingy somethings.  The main focus of the game, being the story campaign, boils down to a 2.5-3 hour endurance of the two antagonists (Kane & Lynch if  you've forgotten already) cursing at one another, cursing at the triad, cursing at the police, cursing at the army and cursing at anyone else they feel like cursing at. The actual gameplay is a rather rudimentary objective consisting of trying to shoot and trying to hide, "trying" is what you'll be doing, as the overrall mechanics just work, if they were more polished, the game would be much shorter and easier to play than figuring out which side to aim from or which gun shoots better.  Not only is it not a particulary interesting game of hide and go shoot, but it tries so very hard to be mature by gratuitously showing 80s style video nasty sequences, in its approuch to appeal to an audience who think acting in such a manner would be considered edgy; by saying some rude words and shooting lots of people. An interesting side note would be the digital mosiacing of graphic scenes of violence, that for some reason is deemed to be too mature and gritty. Kinda of a dichotomy to the overall nature of the game.   The only few possitive things, one being the lead voice talent for Kane (Brian Bloom) and Lynch (Jarion Monroe ). The other being its unique approach to its visual asthetics, simulating digital video noise and video grime, bringing with it a documentarian style cinematography during its cut scenes which may be nauseating at times. But the immersive effect is often broken by the overall graphics looking poor and AI enemies missing key frames of animation when they move.  As a cultural artifact Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is not something to be held with high regard.

												Like the first game this one is pretty good. It has about the same problems as the first, but as you don't control teammates the bad AI isn't that much a problem, and checkpointing was greatly improved. Overall much better than the first. The camera system is made to feel a bit like an amateur movie, and that's a bit distrubing at the first but once you get used to it, it's good. A lot of effects to reproduce this, like lens flares or "bleeding" lights, but it's ok because there's a reason. Unlike most FPS that uses lens flares. SP is very short but nice. Good game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 25, 2014
												Kane & Lynch 2 is another example of why the outside public believe gaming is aimed at an adolescent audience of monosyllabic thingy somethings.  The main focus of the game, being the story campaign, boils down to a 2.5-3 hour endurance of the two antagonists (Kane & Lynch if  you've forgotten already) cursing at one another, cursing at the triad, cursing at the police, cursing at the army and cursing at anyone else they feel like cursing at. The actual gameplay is a rather rudimentary objective consisting of trying to shoot and trying to hide, "trying" is what you'll be doing, as the overrall mechanics just work, if they were more polished, the game would be much shorter and easier to play than figuring out which side to aim from or which gun shoots better.  Not only is it not a particulary interesting game of hide and go shoot, but it tries so very hard to be mature by gratuitously showing 80s style video nasty sequences, in its approuch to appeal to an audience who think acting in such a manner would be considered edgy; by saying some rude words and shooting lots of people. An interesting side note would be the digital mosiacing of graphic scenes of violence, that for some reason is deemed to be too mature and gritty. Kinda of a dichotomy to the overall nature of the game.   The only few possitive things, one being the lead voice talent for Kane (Brian Bloom) and Lynch (Jarion Monroe ). The other being its unique approach to its visual asthetics, simulating digital video noise and video grime, bringing with it a documentarian style cinematography during its cut scenes which may be nauseating at times. But the immersive effect is often broken by the overall graphics looking poor and AI enemies missing key frames of animation when they move.  As a cultural artifact Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is not something to be held with high regard.

content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												★★☆☆☆ - "Average at best, Id give it a miss" PROS:- Destruction effects are pretty good- Difficulty is just right and is a decent challenge (played on normal)- Range of guns and you you can shoot them at people or gas canistersCONS:- Cover system is awful, especially getting up into cover. The game will place you against any surface in the line of fire or not, many frustrating deaths to be had.- AI is terrible, they stand in the middle of nowhere going in circles or go through walls and kill you out of nowhere.- Both characters are unlikable.- Story is non-existant, but you dont care cause the characters are pants.- Controls are clunky.- Opponents, gameplay, script is all repetitive, even the animations are the same.- Shakey camera, I dont usually have a problem with this and understand its effects in both game & film, when done right. Here it isnt, its quite funny cause when you run you cant see a single thing.- Filter, there is some type of dull filter on the screen which makes everything look like dog crap, ah thats where they got the title from!VERDICT? I played this through just because I wanted to shoot at things but the game is just lazy in every aspect so I cannot recommend it.

Posted: August 19, 2014
												Didn't know exactly what to expect when I purchased this title.. So far it has been quite enjoyable. For a moment I actually thought that something was wrong with my monitor because their were blue lines going through my screen and some distortion, but it turned out to be part of the experience. You feel like someone is following you with a video recorder.. Took some getting used to but it really adds to the atmosphere of being in a run down part of town in constant gun fights, battling for your life while someone is filming the entire thing. Some areas can be quite challenging but overall fun. Has good graphics, sound, and controls.. The story is dramatic with some disturbing moments.. basically everything I paid for.

content:
Posted: September 18, 2015
												Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days. What can I say about this game... Well, it's mildly entertaining and does have some nice set pieces, moments, etc. But, after the 4 hours (3.8 to be exact) it took to beat the game, I'm left saying, "meh" to it all.The story is pretty hum-drum, i.e. The big crime boss' daughter gets killed and suddenly, *SPOILER* you're in the line of fire for being the ones that got her killed. And if you think it gets any further than that, story-wise, you'd be wrong. It just felt like a generic 80's film where some americans shoot some guns at the "bad guys" with the loosest possible plot being attached. Oh, and Kane & Lynch are not exactly likeable, so...yeah, there's that.The gameplay itself is enjoyable to a point, but it does get pretty repetitive. Take cover, shoot at some menz. Run up to the next area, but, oh no, more menz! Best take cover and shoot them when possible! Rinse and repeat. There's nothing else in this game! No variation. Well, except for a brief helicoptor ride, but that's all I can remember.And the last thing I want to touch on are the graphics. They're ok, but, the FOV is HORRIBLE! For the first time ever, a small FOV actually did make me slightly nauseous. Well done K&L2, no other game has ever done that to me! Also, some of the art style choices were a little odd. E.g. the game censors people who you shoot in the face. Legitimately, it puts that mosquito looking haze over someone's face! But it never explains why it does this. If it's a style choice, it's a strange one for a game. And there are parts of the game where dead characters are similarly covered in this hazy effect to hide their nudity or injuries. Lighting could also have weird (not even as good as) J.J. Abrams lens flare effects!Overall, I have to say, it's not worth recommending. I mean, true, taking down the gangster's henchmen while juggling which guns to pick up from the bodies that littered the streets, was mildly entertaining as a game. If it's a couple of quid and you just want some mindless shooting with a minimal plot, go for it. Anything more and you're in a HUGE disappointment. But yeah, it's not really a recommendation! Saying that, try it, don't try it. But don't say I didn't warn you :)

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												I have been on Steam for more than 10+ years now, and this is the first time ive EVER written a review...  That's how dissapointed i am with this game.  First of all...  I finished the game in just over 2.5 hours.  It was fun for a while (Maybe the first 30 minutes) but it was over WAY to quickly...  Now i know what chicks feel like...  This game also has near game-breaking bugs.  For example: when i started the second level, the game was litterally running at 1fps.  I had to constantly alt-tab the game to keep the glitch in check.  This is more than what i can say for the first version of this game.  The entire game runs a 1fps reguardless of the gfx settings, or any tweaks or hacks.  This game doesn't have this issue in an unfixable way, but it did threaten to do that 1-FPS thing -- just like the first Kane & Lynch game.In short...  I bought the two game "Kane & Lynch 2" and "Kane & Lynch 1"  I payed under $4.00 for the both oth them.  And although i could finish "Kane & Lynch 2" - the first one was unplayable even on my High-End gaming rig.  Compatibality issues caused the game to run at 1-fps.  So if you wan't to kill 2 hours play "Kane & Lynch 2".  But STAY AWAY from "Kane & Lynch 1"P.S.  The ending sucked!

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												Before anything, you should take note that this game has to most daring title you can find in the whole of gaming industry. This game is racist, in the way that you and your best buddy are 2 white dudes taking on and killing battalions after battalions of Chinese gangsters, soldiers, special forces, apaches, and any chinese being which you care to put a bullet throguh. All the female characters in this game are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥killed/kill♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ except for the air-stewardess at the end, which maybe the main characters will♥♥♥♥♥♥as well. Shanghai is your playground, where the dammages you will cause are in the billions. This game is also highly queer as you and your best buddy are two middle aged white men, of which they have shown affection towards each other, and this affection grows strong as one of the men, Lynch, screws up over and over again while the other, Kane, sticks with him throughout the series. These two men are bonded by sweat, blood, tears and expletives. A fine piece of affection is displayed between these two men throughout the game. This game has gore as well, though which game doesn't?But the thing is, why does this game have to censord anything that they feel "gruesome" or "obscene"?! I don't really care if a naked girl is♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and gutted and killed with blood and sperm all over the place, or that a girl is stripped off her underwear, showing her pubes (or that she doesn't have pubes), or even if the two protagonists have their 7-inch ding-dongs (not measured) dangling out and swaying around in a pendulum motion, but why the hell do you have to put mosaique on almost everything?! That girl without her underwear looks like some actress from Japanese pornography, and so do the two main characters and their hanging ding-dongs! Worse still, any gore are censorded with squarish mosaique boxes. Meaning: headshot - censorded. Blood, censorded. Naked chicks, censorded. You got shot, censorded... Not that I care about a few extra boxes (well, I actually do when you are censording cute naked girls, just saying), but do you have any idea how laggy those mosaique boxes are? My computer has no problem running Dark Souls 2 at max setting, but my system hanged while the mosaique strikes - the only time my computer crashed when I run any games! Heck. Talking about bugs, please do expect some unforeseen circumstances, such as the loss of voice, sudden lags, teleporting enemies, and, for my pal, the inability to deal any dammage. Yes, this game is quite buggy at times, especially when you are in a co-op game with your pal, so do expect some turbulence at times.I am not saying that this game isn't good. The story-line is worth exploring with your pal, but please bear in mind that this game does NOT contain a free-world, meaning both the story and the maps are extremely linear. You walk from point A to point B, cutscenes, repeat. Some of you might like this bold story, and others might not. Whatever the case it is, try it, but only at an extremely discounted price.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2015
												Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is the worst video game I have ever played.The story begins with Kane and Lynch in Shanghai trying to scrape together a gun running deal.  Before the deal goes down, Lynch drags Kane to go settle a grudge match with some guy for some reason.  The duo accidentally kill a girl who happens to be the daughter of some government bureaucrat with enough money, power, and influence to not only control his own gang, but the police and even the Chinese military.  His goons pursue Kane and Lynch.  Kane and Lynch get caught and tortured.  What follows is the most gruesome, unncessary, and tasteless sequence in an already awful game, in which we see our lovely protagonists running around naked and covered and blood.  Then they get captured again, get taken to the villain's building, and decide to kill him while they're there, because why not?  After killing him, they escape, and the player is left wondering what the point was.Because having a shallow, pointless, and disgusting plot wasn't enough, the game also features a shallow, pointless, and disgusting graphical gimmick.  The entire game is designed to look like it's being filmed on a handheld camera.  This makes no sense in-universe since nobody with a camera is actually following the duo around.  The result is shaky cam that would disgust Paul Greengrass, horrible looking lens flares, and a generally disgusting visual aesthetic.  The effect is amplified when running, and will make you want to puke as the visuals go out of focus and shake wildly.  Just charming!The gameplay is built around simple, co-operative third person shooting.  It's about as standard and bland as it can get.  Headshots instant-kill enemies that would otherwise be massive bullet sponges.  You hide behind cover (which feels miserable).  There are the mandatory "stealth" sequences that don't actually work.  A turret level.  Shooting down helicopters.  Pretty much all of it is standard to the point of being boring, or it would be if not for the horrific AI.  The enemies are both dumb and dangerous, featuring absurdly good aim (despite the guns being horribly inaccurate when you wield them) and bricks for brains.  They also have a tendency to only peek out of cover for a fraction of a second at a time, turning the game into an obnoxious whack-a-mole clone.  The terrible AI is made even more obvious in coop, since the AI will only ever target one player at a time, and will instantaneously snap between the two.  Because of this, it's not uncommon to sneak up on an enemy only to have them abruptly spin 180 and kill you.  Getting killed is also very frustrating in coop.  You can mash E to stay alive longer so they can come help you up, but the timer is really short and mashing E appears to make absolutely no difference in the amount of time you can survive.  In addition, the E key is used for pretty much everything, so it's not terribly uncommon to try to pick up a friend and find your character instead picking up a fire extinguisher.  While mentioning multiplayer, I should also mention that my experience was extremely laggy.  This could have been my connection, but I think the game just has bad netcode.A terrible story, hideous visuals, and awful gameplay are capped off with glitchy animation and showstopping bugs.  Numerous animations look quick and jerky.  When you open doors to proceed to the next room, the animation just cuts midway through.  Later in the game my friend and I began to experience characters getting stuck on geometry, massive frame-drops, garbled video, and outright crashes.  The game barely feels functional at all.Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is the worst.  When the game isn't glitching itself into unplayability, it's merely disgusting and unpleasant to experience.  9/10 pretty ok.

												Has a sickeningly wobbly camera like a drunk with parkinsons following you with a camcorder. Thankfully you can turn it off in the options, problem avoided. Otherwise it gives me a really bad headache.The shooting system is only decent, but still manages to be satisfying when you figure out which weapons are horribly innacurate (useless) so you can avoid picking them up unless you are out of ammo and have no choice which normally isn't a problem. There's no time to ♥♥♥♥ around with garbage weapons when you get downed in only a few hits. As far as everything else? I love it. Super violent, plenty of attitude, and it is dark and gritty, even as dark as Max Payne 3. Kane & Lynch are really awesome badass characters, some of the best I've ever seen in any game. If nothing else, pick it up for some solid movie-style fun. And give us a K&L 3, you A holes.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												I don't usually recommend games that are physically painful to play, but Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days has managed to defy the odds and gain my love.I'd like to preface this review by saying that I have not played the first game, Dead Men, in the series, but I am fully up to date with the story and many of the gameplay elements. The first one never drew in my attention because of certain mechanics it used, but this one did.Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is the second instalment in a third person cover based action shooter game series focused around the stories of two guys. Kane, and Lynch. Kane, a man with a questionable past and morals (who was the main playable character in the first game) has come to Shanghai to visit his... partner, Lynch, a literal psychotic with who he has worked with before, in order to do some business with him. I won't help into too many details, but as expected, things go bad really quickly, and you're thrust into a non stop action thrill ride that will either make you violently ill, or wanting more.What do I mean by this? Well, if you've played the first game, you'll know that it was a fairly normal feeling third person shooter, in which you played as Kane and focused on his story. Now, the focus is put on Lynch, the psychotic. And boy, the game sure does feel like it was made with you actually controlling a psychotic. If Dead Men was a Kane focused normal third person shooter, Dog Days is a Lynch focused psychotic trip.The way this is accomplished is mainly by the visuals and camera, which I feel is one of the biggest draws in the game. The visuals in Dog Days behave as though the entire game was being filmed by someone with a camera. There are visual artefacts, intense glare, and blur/pixelation effects used throughout the game. When you get shot, you might see your screen go fuzzy in some areas. If you see a bright light, you might get intense glare. If you shoot a civilian in the face, you might get a pixelated area where their face should be. These are all really neat features and really help to make the game feel like a video. While these have a relatively minor impact on gameplay, there is one more effect that is always in use that may make or break the game for you. The screen shake.The screen in this game is ALWAYS shaking. And I do mean ALWAYS. Even when you're crounching behind an obstacle, the screen is still shaking slightly. Sprinting make the camera shake like you'd expect someone sprinting with a video camera would. You get shot? Shaking. You need to run? Shaking. Getting into cover? Do you even need an answer? And considering this game really is non stop action with hardly even a minute of relaxation every now and then, the screen is going to be shaking more than wet dog that's had 50 cups of cold coffee in the snow. This shaking, along with the other effects, can make the game more difficult to play, and can make it difficult to see enemies sometimes, it is also the cause of many headaches from many people, and it's clear to see why. And yet, I absolutely adore this feature. Once again, it really helps with giving the game a gritty feel, and a sense of speed and urgency. Everything is always moving so fast, and Lynch, being a psychotic, obviously has a harder time dealing with it than most people. He's in constant pain, and to a degree, you feel this as well.Speaking of fast, by god is this game fast paced There's no collectables or anything to slow you down, and the game in constantly RUN AND SHOOT COVER AND SHOOT RUN AND SHOOT COVER AND SHOOT REPEAT FORVER! The game can be pretty difficult as it doesn't take much for you to get killed, but you also regenerate life fairly quickly and this works really well. Since you play as Lynch for the majority of the game, you always have the computer (or other player) controlling Kane, who is with you for almost the entire game. You can't give him any commands or whatever and he just deals with things himself, and he can't die, so there's no reason to pay mind to him. But the banter between the characters in game is really enjoyable and he doesn't have any negative effect on the game at all. The game is build around having these 2 together and it does so well. If you hate having an extra character constantly tag alone, like Ashley is RE4, Shiva in RE5, or Alyx in HL2, I assure you, the game works really with both of these characters and you are still in complete control the entire time. No waiting for the other character, no inventory management, no revival, or anything like that exists. At least not in single player. In multiplayer, a revival mechanic does exist, but not the other stuff.However while the game is really fast paced, naturally, the game is also over really fast. It takes only 4 hours to beat the main campaign, and I'm counting deaths. If you managed to beat this game without dying (extremely difficult even on normal difficulty and probably on easy, I'd say I died about 100 times on my first playthrough, and don't worry, there's VERY frequent checkpoints) then you're looking at maybe 3  or 2 and a half hours of straight gameplay. While this is a con, the game is VERY jam packed and never has a dull moment to lengthen it out. It also have several extra missions that you can play alone or in multiplayer which add a few hours. I also feel the game is very replayable, as there are no skills trees or anything to worry about. This is a game that starts fast and keep going.The story, while nothing particularly noteworthy, does at least draw you into the feelings and thought of the 2 main characters, who are still totally jerks, but ones that you can't help but feel sorry for.Music that shows up now and then isn't very noticeable and very forgettable, but isn't bad, and sound effects are fine for the most part. There are some glitches in the game, like the screen going grey and not showing the game, but these are rare and usually fixed just by restarting the game. The weapons feel pretty good to me to be honest, but some seem to not like the sound of them. True, they don't feel overly strong, but since you're shooting 90% of the time anyway, I feel that they feel strong enough. Some of the guns also feel as though they have little to no accuracy to them (except the shotguns, which have a pretty good range for most videogame shotguns) but these weapons are quickly replaced by much better guns with better accuracy. In general, the gunplay feels quite good, covering works fine (most of the time), and it's a joy to play.Sometimes, it also feels like the game hates you, as some parts are incredibly difficult, even at the start, and the ending really seems to come out of nowhere and leaves you asking "was that it... seriously?", but to be honest, I feel this is very refreshing, and sort of goes along with the struggle of Lynch through the game and his deranged mind.All in all, Dog Days is a fantastic game, but one that most people will not enjoy. I feel as though a game like this will never be made again considering the reception it got, so this is one of a kind. It's sick, twisted, sad, and psychotic, just like Lynch. And I wouldn't have it any other way.Want to keep updated on games I recommend? I'm a curator! Follow me here!http://store.steampowered.com/curator/8963340-NeonAbomination/

content:
Posted: May 18, 2013
KANE & LYNCH: DOG DAYSA flawed follow up to Kane & Lynch: Dead Men that covers much the same ground.Rating 4/10Great art style, setting and characters in a story that doesn't go anywhere. Its greatest strength is the style; similar to lo-fi handheld shaky cam. The setting of Shanghai is also well realised, showing the seedy underbelly with bustling streets and markets however in later levels it reverts to overused locations such as warehouses and docks.It also suffers the same problems as Kane and Lynch: Dead Men, great characters but stale and awkward gameplay. Simple mechanics such as getting into cover can be tricky and the aiming is clumsy at times. There also aren't any real variants on the gameplay, often narrow alleyways where it's a repetitive game of whack a mole, popping in and out of cover until it's safe to proceed. The recent Spec Ops had an interesting story to make up for it's lack of gameplay, Kane and Lynch Dog Days has two great disaster-prone characters but not a great story. It's also so short the first time I completed it I thought it was the end of Act 1 only to realise it was the end of the game, and incredibly short single player campaign that ends suddenly.  Multiplayer isn't much better as it died a month or so after release and now it's impossible to find other players.There are far better 3rd person shooters out there now such as Kane and Lynch: Dead Men, Max Payne 3 and Spec Ops which all do it better. Worth picking up for the art style alone but don't expect much from the game.

content:
Posted: October 3, 2014
												The first game finished so badly (one of the ending anyways) that it had to continue with Kane & Lynch 2. Thats a good thing, right ? Nope. Not here.  The story uses the same overused theme thats been done in movies and games since the beginning of games...revenge. Its predictable from start to finish which is kind of boring if you think about it. Theres no more character dept and Kane stops Lynch from learning more from each other right from the start, Personally I think its the biggest mistake that the devs made.For the gameplay, I have to be honest what impressed me the most are 2 things. First is the enemy AI...It's brutal. If you take cover and don't look around you, the enemy will come up to you and ♥♥♥♥ you up. That is impressive since most AI will just stay behind cover and shoot you endlessly without anything more to do.Second is the cover system. Far from perfect but at least this time I press C to activate it so in a very wierd way...its works. Since Kane & Lynch : Dead Men, the cover didn't work almost all the time.The game forces you to change weapons since enemies don't use all the same weapon so its possible you'll run out of ammo for a specific weapon so you'll have to change. I personally don't mind that because it forces you to change strategy to kill your enemies (don't snipe with a shotgun) and you have to think about ammo conservation as well.Level design is the most absurb thing besides the story of course. What you see is only Shanghai city...its the same view you get from room to room, to buildings to ... well everything looks the same. So level design is just really bad, boring not appealing at all. Story doesn't make any sense to me, why the hell are they staying in Shanghai ? Everyone in the city goes after them and the only thing they have in mind is...complete the transaction...stay here. WTF ??? It's just an excuse to use the same textures over and over....and I completed the game in 4 hours...shorter than the first one.Sorry but this is not recommended. If at least they would of done a great job with the level design I would of recommended this. If you add everything with the bad levels, the game becomes unacceptable.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												After playing Kane and Lynch first game I have high hopes for this game.  Game had story.  Characters were distinct.  Each level was different.  Leaderboard make people cry.Kane and Lynch 2 is a game where you play same level over and over again.  You shoot either Chinese street brawler, Chinese police or Chinese army enemy across map from behind cover.  When loading level it give me message saying this is not racist.  Just coincidence that everyone you kill is Chinese.  Once I shoot some helicopter.Levels are small such as go around corner in street or run through abandoned pillars.  At one point you shoot out of helicopter but level last 5 minute.  If no texture load then you see that every level is the same.Cover system is very bad.  Most time I did not bother hugging wall and just line up shot by standing near corner.  Enemy cannot hit me but I kill them no skill.  When I use cover I get hit.Many gun bad.  Really bad.  Like you do cover battle with uzi.  Uzi terrible.  Shotgun seem like only accurate weapon until you fight army.  But you only carry enough ammo to kill like 3 Chinese at any one time.Story line is terrible.  Kane do some deal and need Lynch.  For some reason you try kill some man in underwear but kill wife.  Then you try to patch wound by just killing anyone Chinese.  Lynch new wife get killed.  You then need to run around a level completely naked with Kane.  At end of level Kane give a motivation speech completely naked.  It should make you say "Yeah, let's do this" but pixel♥♥♥♥♥♥kill moment.  After long cold shower I play final level on skyscraper then airport whilst crying into my goat's milk.Lynch is no longer crazy man who need pill otherwise everyone appear like bunny.  Kane no longer leader with all the ideas.  It is like watching James Bond film after Sean Connery leave.  Everything different.  Tim Dalton different.Multiplayer is dead but new arcade mode is only good thing about game.  Arcade mode made into new game called Payday 2.I wish I never play this game.  It is very bad and make me very upset.  Like hearing joke about He-Man sexuality when older.  I have the power.If you really hate someone tell them to play this game.

Posted: May 7, 2016
												The camera is insanely shaky. Until I found the setting to disable it, I literally couldn't tell what was going on in the game. Shooting mechanics are also pretty terrible with every weapon having ~3% accuracy. I'd be okay if weapons had imperfect accuracy like a Gears of War game, but the sheer amount of enemies who are almost always in near perfect cover makes for tedious fights that force you to charge ahead only because your ammo capacity is too low for a firefight.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2012
												I don't know quite what to say about this game. It has contempt, utter contempt, for videogames and for the player, and it's ugly -- very, very ugly. They've done something very strange here; it's a game about bad people doing bad things and destroying themselves because of it. The protagonists are not likeable, and the people they kill are only trying to kill them because Kane and Lynch tried to kill them first. It's very stylized, but the style is terrible -- the whole game, from beginning to end, looks like a badly framed video shot handheld on a terrible camcorder.People criticize it for being too short, which was valid when it was Sixty US Dollars, but is no longer the case. If you want to play a cover shooter for thirty hours, you're probably not going to want to play a game which seems to deliberately destroy everything that justifies those games. This is a game about the death of the American Dream. Play it.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2016
												I bought this cheap and I'm still disappointed. The first K&L felt like a decent B movie. You could see some thought and soul in it. This one, feels like the corporate rip-off of a sequel that always follows. The camera is terrible. I'm not usually picky on this but it appears they just gave a camcorder to some random buzzed out teenager and said "watch us do stuff". There's actually a part later in the game where the already bad camera becomes worse. There's nothing new or exciting for gameplay. In fact, I would argue they actually downgraded on the gameplay from the first. Kane and Lynch are...boring. With the exception of some shock value scenes, there's very little to grasp you into the story line. Overall, the only way I can recommend this is if you're like me and enjoy terrible games. (The sort of idea that it's so bad, I have to see it).

Hey, ♥♥♥♥, Kane, ♥♥♥♥, want to ♥♥♥♥ing help me with this ♥♥♥♥ing last job? Why the ♥♥♥♥ not, Kane? *2 hours later* Oh♥♥♥♥♥♥ What the ♥♥♥♥, we got to get the ♥♥♥♥ out of here ♥♥♥♥! ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ity ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥! *1 & half hours later* Black screen. That's it. They do a job, it turns to♥♥♥♥♥♥ they get away. The most innovative and creative thing in this game? You play a level where Kane and Lynch are slashed, beaten and naked. Yeah. Awesome. Breaking ground here Eidos. Shame the game is shot like a badly directed Youtube vid with pixelation. Dong physics would have given innovation 10/10.♥♥♥♥ this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 3, 2014
												Welcome to the lives of Kane and Lynch. One man is a psychopath who just loves the thrill of crime, the other a psychopath who blacks out in fits of murderous rampages when his medication wears off basically. The unlikely duo have one last deal to do in Shanghai before they stop their crime ridden lives to live in normalcy...of course this deal goes horribly wrong when a government official who is involved with the mob daughter gets shot by Lynch on accident and dies.The games story is very much a crime drama, and if you're into that the story alone is more than enough to keep you hooked through the four hour campaign. Yes, the campaign is THAT short, though this isn't that bad of a thing. I feel like if the game were any longer it would have wore out its welcome. I say this because the gameplay is your standard third person shooter.You take cover on walls, you can pick up weapons and ammo dropped by dead bodies, and when you get knocked down before death you get one more shot to get back up before you're down for the count. This is all fun and well even with the linear progression, but taking out one horde of cops, thugs, and scumbags after another does become slightly repetitive.The game is more style over substance than anything with how the camera is. The camera works like a camera man is following you through the campaign filming every little thing with a grainy, somewhat low res camera. Kane and Lynch 2 does this very well, and it goes with the gritty graphics, story, and violence perfectly, though it can sometimes be a strain on the eyes.Overall I recommend the game. If you like violent crime drama films you'll feel right at home with this game. If you're against a ton of blood and dead bodies all over the place...Well, you should probably stay far away from Kane and Lynch.

Easy is too easy and hard is too hard. Not fun. Buy it if you want something to laugh at with a buddy, but even then it's kinda sketchy. 1/10...maybe.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 13, 2015
 Pros -  Some degree of realism.  Shots to the head or upper torso kill you instanty (in  Extreme  difficulty atleast). Shots to other body parts hurt you or knock you down.-  Nice setting.  You get a glimpse of the dangerous life in the dark alleys of Shanghai. Cons -  The camera is horrible.  I don't understand what the developers were going for. The shaky portable-like camera during sprints and cutscenes was a bad idea. It didn't make the game any better, it makes your life more difficult. On the bright side, you can turn on Steady Camera.-  The aim system is bad...  I couldn't find a better way to put this. I know aiming a gun in real life isn't easy but the way it behaves in this game makes  Extreme  difficulty unnecessarily stupid. Enemies have incredible aim and range (they are police officers, SWAT agents and Shanghai gangsters after all), they can headshot you from a ridiculous distance or atleast kill you with a couple of shots. In my opinion, the least the game could do is let you aim your guns properly from the same range (or any range above 10 feet (~3 meters)) to stand a chance.-  Checkpoints are too spaced.  Yes, this is one of  those  games. You spend half an hour trying to get through a tough spot or a difficult situation where you're always outnumbered and outgunned, only to be killed by that last single ************. What happens? You start way back there, one or maybe two areas before that one. Again, really frustrating in  Extreme  difficulty.-  Graphics.  Not as relevant as the former cons but still. They aren't total garbage but they're not good either. Some edges and textures are poor and the shaky camera just makes it worse (or better if it can distract you from them).In conclusion, I wouldn't recommend this to most people. If you like the chinese setting and/or old school clunky gameplay go ahead and try it. Or if you're that guy that wants to try every shooter out there, try it aswell. But don't say I didn't warn you :POh and don't judge me on only 3 hours game time. I had played this before without Steam and I thought I'd play it one more time. Not one of my best decisions... I stand by what I've said in this review.

 DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a game developed by IO Interactive and published by Eidos Interactive and Square Enix and is a sequel to Kane and Lynch: Dead MenEverything about this game is so middle of the road, from the ordinary combat & weapons, to the glitchy mess that is the cover systemThe story is no better either. An annoying shaky cam and some choices with censorship I am confused by. This game isn't that great, nor is it bad... its just mehKane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a good time to play with a mate for a few hours and enjoy the overall clunkyness and ability to murder countless civilians Pick it up cheap and with a friend as it's not worth it outside of that... RECOMMENDED :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2013
												If ever there were a time to recommend Kane & Lynch 2, now would be that time.With the sudden glut of shooters focused on characters going mad, the darkness of the average video-game player-character, and what I see as the start of unique artistic approaches to games (see: Routine, Tangiers, etc), it should be clear that this game was well before its time.It was critically derided, despite being Spec Ops: The Line's nasty older brother. The censored headshots turn a stomach far faster than the gory over the top madness of any other game that comes to mind. The visual style is bright, eyepopping, unique, will never be seen again due to gamers not being ready for the game when it was released.This game is worth a playthrough if you want to taste blood, smell sweat, hate yourself. That is in no way a point against it as a game -- it is uniquely visceral, and we will have a hard time seeing another game willing to go so far until the critical backlash from it is forgotten.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2015
												Did you like K&L? It had a good story, ok gunplay, levels were more or less varied, etc.This is not that game. It's got a gritty presentation, that's it. The story is not worth mentioning. Lynch calls Kane to work with him on a weapons deal in Shanghai, supposedly his last deal, before he wants to spend life with his daughter (who hates him). That's it. Everything around that is just bland paste of names who are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off.The German version is also severely cut (pixelated headshots (even after death), enemies don't really die, but are just "injured", etc.). You can kinda get around with it, because the impression is that Lynch is being followed by a camera man who films the whole story. Meh. It's unique, I'll give it that. Graphics are also neat for a game this old. Very nice setting and all.Now to the main problem of the game, besides its lackluster story: The gameplay is severely unfun...every level has you fighting lots and lots of goons, I know that this was also the case in K&L 1 to some extent, but here the enemies just keep spawning from doors and everything...you easily kill 50 or more enemies per level. It's always just shoot, go to the next "checkpoint", shoot some more, and so on...and 1 on-rails-session for good measure which is absolutely boring.I completed the game in 3 hours...three. It took me twice as long for the first game I think. 3 hours is just ridiculous, but I was glad it was over, because each level simply plays the same way, just a slightly different look. The best thing about this game are its gritty cutscenes and implications...but there is no real character development, nothing. Guess, that's also why there is no 3rd game...better that way, but too bad, since there aren't enough games out there, in which you play as the "bad" guys.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												A flawed, divisive shooter that focuses on a story of nihilism and brutal violence.Its unique design choices far overwhelm the flaws though.Right from the start, the first thing that hits you is its art style, which is a fully realized gritty, and grimy Shanghai. The game never lets up from its dark tone, and this will divide players from loving or hating this game. If you dont mind a game with a darker tone, with a focus on antiheroes who dont actually become heroes, this game may surprise you.From its intentionally inaccurate weapons that force you to spray, to its visual effects and sound design, it sucks you into the underground world of violence, and 2 Anti heroes. Word of caution, At 5 Bucks, this is a steal, but multiplayer is pretty empty now, and so is Coop.There is a stand alone Arcade mode but that wont last very long.Still, this is well worth getting for the Campaign Alone at a discount.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2013
												If ever there were a time to recommend Kane & Lynch 2, now would be that time.With the sudden glut of shooters focused on characters going mad, the darkness of the average video-game player-character, and what I see as the start of unique artistic approaches to games (see: Routine, Tangiers, etc), it should be clear that this game was well before its time.It was critically derided, despite being Spec Ops: The Line's nasty older brother. The censored headshots turn a stomach far faster than the gory over the top madness of any other game that comes to mind. The visual style is bright, eyepopping, unique, will never be seen again due to gamers not being ready for the game when it was released.This game is worth a playthrough if you want to taste blood, smell sweat, hate yourself. That is in no way a point against it as a game -- it is uniquely visceral, and we will have a hard time seeing another game willing to go so far until the critical backlash from it is forgotten.
