content:
Posted: April 19
												Kane & Lynch are two characters I've liked since the first game.In this sequel they pair up again and quickly end up in deep trouble with various parts of the underworld, gangs and police.Story is good and gritty like the first.Gameplay is mixed in that some weapons can feel pretty useless with not much accuracy, while others are great and effective. Enviromental destruction is decent in some levels too.Thirdperson can be troublesome given the "shaky-cam" effect...but I liked the whole cam-corder reality vibe and stuck with it. (you can turn it off in options)Graphics and sound are good. To sum up, I really liked it but I can see why others don't.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												A clunky, boring, uninspired disaster.The entire game consists of running between cover and trying to kill the exact same bullets sponge enemies over and over and over again. All that changes is the look of their character model. And he shooting system is horrifically bad; machine guns will miss constantly as you fire but shotguns can pull off a surgical headshot from three rooms away. Objects have strange collision dection too, so many times you won't be able to shoot an enemy despite seeing a whole arms sticking out from behind a car's hood. It's the most bizarre hit detection I've seen in an FPS.There's no music and virtually no story either. Kane and Lynch just run around a few corridors over an over in an attempt to pull off one last heist and retire. Obviously things go wrong early on and the remainder of the game is running from A to Z while you listen to some of the worst dialog I've ever heard in a buddy game storyline. Someone made the brilliant decision to film this game as if it were taken from Michael Bay style security footage. It's god awful and make running a chore (not to mention any time it zooms in on a character model you want to cry at how horrible the graphics are).Stay away. I feel sorry for anyone who paid $60 when this game launched.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 12, 2016
												I really wish I hadn't wasted my time playing through almost the entire game.Like the first game, it has highly inaccurate weapons that will mean you will only want to use the pistols or rifles when you find them, or the ammo for them. Pair this with the bullet-spongey army of enemies, and you have firefights that last forever because you cannot damage anything further than point blank at an acceptable speed. The enemies seem to have pinpoint accuracy with all their weapons, which is very irritating.The cover system is bad. Enemies will still be able to hit you sometimes, and you will only be able to poke your head up for long enough for the animation to finish before being damaged enough that you have to retreat back into cover. You will need to wait 5 seconds before popping back up to fire off another bullet only for it to miss and have the cycle start again.The camera shaking and the J.J.Abrams effects are some of the most obnoxious and nauseating graphical effects I have seen in gaming. The game actively tries to make you sick and hurt your eyes. I did not find out until an hour in that these could be disabled because they are not labeled well in the options menu.The game is around 4 hours long. I quit 5 minutes before the end because I could not handle anymore of the cheap deaths or bad gameplay. Do not buy. If you own it from a humble bundle, you can experience all the game has to offer from the first hour.

number of helpful: 12 of 26 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												Its ok for a very high discount, but not really for € 10.-, let me explain why.Its pretty uninspired and very short (3-4 hours), its one of the worst sequel of this generation, its very insulting. The story is almost non existent, many plotholes and the game is basically "OH SH*T duck shoot duck shoot". The gunplay is not that good and thats a huge problem because thats the only thing you do in this game. Enemys take way too many hits and its hard to hit them in a long distance. If they hit you, you mostly fall down and you have to get back up, in the meantime you are a very easy target and you die fairly fast in this game, especially if some guy sneaks up to you and shoots you in the back. The coversystem is also a joke, you get hit so many times anyway. The AI is actually pretty bad, some enemys just stand in the open or take in open places cover and civilians sometimes just act like nothing is going on and walk casually into your shooting sight. Some parts are so hard because the game throws so many enemys at you that you can barely survive and there are also stupid escort missions (ugh...), all this probably because to extend the game lengh, but in a bad way. It almost seems like the devs put most of their effort into the Multiplayer that no one wanted and cared about in the first place and also into visuals, irritating mobilephone filming filter effects and the annoying as hell shaking cam and called it "immersion", but actually forgot to make the mouths of the characters move when they talk in gameplay (they did in the first one actually). It also seems like they cut allot of content and ideas out of this game because of time isssius and rushed it out of the doors, there are some huge areas where you just run through and its nothing going on there. The ending is one of the biggest middle fingers in gaming i have ever seen, when you thought the game is finally about to start, it just ends without warning and lefts you with some stupid porn music in the credits and you're like "huh? What, thats it? THATS IT?! WTF?!".They probably thought the Multiplayer will hold this game up and thats why there was allot of focus there, but no one is playing that anymore and thats not what the original Kane and Lynch was about. It was about the two antiheroes, one a professional criminal with a dark past and one a psychopath with mental blackouts, in a cruel and tragic storyline against a powerfull criminal organisation, all inspired by movies like "Heat". But they threw everything that made the first game good out of the window (the good characters and what made them interesting, engaging storyline, different locations etc.) and desided to make one generic immersive shooter instead and reduced the gameplay just into "duck, shoot, duck, shoot" with a annoying shaking cam and ugly filter effects which just looks cool in trailers but doesn't feel good in the game. Kane and Lynch 2 improved nothing as a sequel gameplay wise over the original and made actually some things worse and the first one wasn't actually that good in the first place, but still much better than this. Where are the teammates which i can give orders like in the first one? There is only Kane, but he doesn't seem to do much and i can't give him any orders. In the first one we had multiple teammates that can revive you with a adrenaline shot for a second chance, but you would die of an overdose if you get another injection immediately after you had one already or if your teammates dont make it to your position in time. The only downside of this is that your teammates can die too and you have to revive them in time as well, that can be really annoying if they go down in a position with allot of enemy fire, but this does mostly only happen in later levels. There was also a system where you can change weapons with your teammates and give them the ones you want. This could have been improved in the sequel, but they desided to drop all this entirely instead and if you go down, you're just dead now, no adrenaline shot, not be able to change weapons with kane and no orders. In the first one we had splitscreen co-op on PC, but they removed it in the sequel and made it console exclusive. Why?! There is no reason to remove this, i don't get it if developers do something like that, especially if it was in the first one. They also removed grenades and smoke grenades which you were be able to throw and also the ones from your enemys back as well, but now we have fire extinguisher and oil containers which we can throw and enemys can throw them too. Its a neat idea, but there is no reason to remove grenades completely anyway. In the first one we had unique locations like the streets of an american city, the bank, the prison, the tokio nightclub, the skyscraper, the streets of tokio and also havana. In the second one we got the slums of shanghai, a skyscraper with an office and the airport, thats it! It was a game that had HUGE potential because of its predecessor, but they screwed up almost across the board. I was actually one of the people that waited for this game because i liked the first one allot, but i'm glad that i waited for the reviews and didn't bought it on full price. I'm still dissapointed though but not as burned as others because i had patience and waited for the price drop, this is why i'm glad that a platform like Steam exist. Later i found the Kane and Lynch 2 i wanted actually in Max Payne 3 which was ironically hated by the fans of the previous Max Payne games too. But atleast it didn't forgot its roots completely and its a great game with nice value and has a engaging storyline with interesting characters and awesome gameplay, like Kane and Lynch 2 should have been.

content:
Posted: September 5, 2016
 IntroductionThis game is a linear 3rd person shooter that tries to look like a documentary. Gameplay The gameplay is quite repetetive, it is just shooting every guy in a room and proceed to the next one for the most part, the biggest problem with that is that the guns are highly inacurate so it is mostly spray and pray at the exception of the sniper rifle which you are only able to use it a couple of times since you get very little amunition for it and there is very few snipers in the game. You can only carry 2 guns at the time and when you ran out of ammo you have to pick up another gun on the ground so you will be forced to switch weapons whether you want it or not and alot of them are very similar in gunplay. So yeah the core gameplay is quite repetive and dull. Story The story is mediocre at best since is extremely predictable and linear like a battlefield game campaign's story. The idea was to show the raw lifestyle of people of the ppor parts of a city however it doesnt acomplish bc the story becomes rediculous pretty fast just to give more enemies to shoot at so overalll the story is extremely dull and mundane. Camera The camera by default moves around woubles a alot in order to give a sense that someone is filming the thing as a documentary but that only made me want to vomit bc the camera shakes alot and it just makes trying to aim a nightmare thankfullly you can disable that in the options menu but the woubly camera is still there in the cutscenes. Conclusion Kane and Lynch 2 tries to innovate but fails miserably and the result is a repetive shooter with highly inacurate gunplay I honestly recomend people to play something else bc even for free this game isnt worth your time. If you want game that shows the street life of a place in asia try Sleeping Dogs is alot better than this crap.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2016
												Kane and Lynch 2 is a sequel to a game no one wanted - at least this is what the press tells you. I played Kane and Lynch 1 and the game definetly has its flaws. But story wise the game is unique as hell and has introduced two of the most memorable characters of the gaming industry. Kane and Lynch 2 looked great on the paper. They took the dark and gritty atmosphere from the first game and made it even more ♥♥♥♥ed up. The tech of the games wasn't too great in 2010 but the game doesn't look horrible. This "cameraphone" style also hides the fact of the aged graphics. Are the graphics bad? I disagree. Is the filter bad? I don't think so, I really liked the visuals. I also haven't seen anything like this in any other game. This doesn't sound too awful so far. Not super-duper graphics and a weird filter aren't a dealbreaker even if you are not a fan. The gameplay is unfortunately pretty bland so is its story. You have a simple cover mechanic, your cover can sometimes get destroyed just like you can destroy other's cover and that is it. The guns perform a bit weird, they aren't spot on with their accuracy but I think this is a gamedesign choice and not the result of bad programming. Funnily, the shotgun is the best game in the game - even in long range. I like the idea, because "shotguns" aren't the spray and pray close-quarters-combat thing everyone thinks. They are pretty precies and can shoot pretty far, but that is offtopic.The story isn't well written as well and stays bland most of the time as well. It has its moments though and I liked the scenery of this dark Hong Kong. To be real honest, Kane and Lynch 2 isn't a bad game but not a great game as well. If you are looking for a 3rd person shooter, K&L 2 is a choice and you can get it fairly cheap. The biggest point of criticism was back then, that you simply didn't get your money's worth. 60 bucks for 5 hours isn't great and the game was only mediocre at best. But times changed and you now get it for a lot less. I would suggest to go for it, if you want a simple game with a really raw feeling to it with its style and the small plot.

Spoiler - This game doesn't answer what happened to Kane's Daughter, Jenny. Lynch has turned into a family guy from psychotic madman without any explanation. He even has a chinese wife, I think devs forgot the fact that he killed his own wife in the past. Don't bother with another sequel IO, stick to Hitman and maybe Mini Ninjas. No Kane and Lynch 3 please.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2016
												I spent quite a number of hours on this just to actually wager on how bad people say it is. In the end, it’s not bad at all. Without a doubt, there are noticeable flaws in this game, so I’ll push them out of the way now. The annoying camcorder effects -- which thankfully can be turned off in the advanced settings, except the constant shaking when you run -- and the abysmal ending that was set for a sequel. When there is enough damage to the head (i.e. a buckshot from point-blank range) causes a censor effect. To me, this is questionable, but when you have that chance to see what it's censoring depends on the viewer. It does have detail, such as the bullet hole down to the blood streak coming from the eyes. I guess people really did want that gruesome detail. I can see why the shotgun is “accurate” due to the fact that it fires buckshots. But they don’t cause that much damage.The StoryThe introduction jumps you to how badly Kane & Lynch are involved in. Throughout the game, they are hit from practically everywhere they go, desperately trying to make it better. Character development is practically nonexistent in here, or rather, much of their character from the previous game. Lynch’s psychotic episode isn’t involved here, not like it was back in Dead Men. Disturbingly enough, they remind me of Michael and Trevor from GTA V, only one is keeping his issues under control now. Vague conversation is used between the two, unless it’s later in the story, where Lynch describes who or what is going on. Finally, the levels are incredibly linear, the story is pretty weak, and -- of course -- it's ending is unsatisfactory. Arcade ModePossibly the best thing that came out of this game since this is where most of my time was used on. The heists were nice, ranging from difficulty rising after each completion, along with the option to select various weapons (that are named differently from the realistic versions, take the PAC 10, Kaliningrad 47, and Doretta that are obvious to spot) to the scenarios of said heists. The characters here are fine, along with the detail that differs from each other, such as their conversations in the loading screen. Even the characters in this mode have more… well, character when it’s compared to Kane & Lynch in this game! Ranking up in this mode is a pain, but is worthwhile later on, making the heists much more easier for the later rounds. The opportunity to turn into a Traitor is nice, if you want to be the greedy all-for-me type of person, or just want to be that much of an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.MultiplayerIt’s dead, couldn’t try it for jack.I can’t hate nor love this game, it really did put me in the center of the two. What does upset me is the fact that the third installment is cancelled. Not sure if it’s better off that way, seeing that we received all of these Hitman games over the last few years. Personally, I wouldn’t mind a continuation, but oh well. Sadly, I cannot recommend this game, at least in its full price. Buy the collection when it goes back on sale, enjoy the story (or what’s left in it) and the Arcade mode. No doubt the Co-op must be fun, if you find a friend that’ll play with you.

content:
Posted: September 12, 2014
 2/5. BAD GAME !  OVERALL Have you forced yourself of finishing a game just to see if you get to enjoy it down the road? Well, that's what this game was for me, it's a really unrefined shooter and would never pay $10 for it, I got it in a bundle but wouldn't pay more than $3 for it, and even then I would rather expend the $3 on an indie game who will be over 5h of fun. REPLAYABILITY Once you finish this dull adventure and try to squeeze a little more of fun from it you may replay a couple of levels to get some achievements, I did so in about 35min just to convince myself to never ever touch this tittle again.  GAMEPLAY The shooting is horrible unless you are using a shotgun at close range, assault rifles or pistols at mid or sniper at long, other than that forget altogether the SMGs unless you want to save some bullets and prepare to be frustrated with the low accuracy of the guns when they are in your hands and the ultra high precision they get on AI hands, seriously the reticle of the AI is perfect and you get one the size of a watermelon. AESTHETIC The visuals of your surroundings might be the best part of the game, and that's not something to brag too much about, however the character models are bland and don't look very good, shooting cars and some elements in the environment might be what gives your heart content at the end of the day, after gunning down your enemies of course. STORY If you look at the big picture the story isn't THAT bad, but while playing it it feels very uninspired, there are parts that are really stupid and to make it worse you have to deal with some horrible animations and rather dull voice acting (the phone calls between chapters are the best voice acting you will get, I guess not looking at the stiff animations helped). In my opinion the story twists were pretty dumb, *SPOILER ALERT*  when you get caught and thrown into the garbage after been cut off by a butcher you were supposed to be dead, but no, you get back into the building and manage to kill the bad dudes with your bare hands...  that's the dumbest moment in my opinion. MUSIC The ambient sounds and gun shooting aren't bad, but in the end the score is pretty forgettable, you know, if there was any...

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												It somehow manages to be worse than the original. This game has no redeeming qualities other than the fact that it takes place in shanghai which is cool. They center the gameplay even more on cover based shooting this time and it is probably the most generic third person cover based shooting I have ever played. The shooting is so unbelievably basic, bland and dull. It’s just bad, all the guns feel awful to shoot. The controls in this game just feels very finicky and sluggish both on keyboard and controller. They could have done so much with this setting but they squandered the opportunity because the level design is very generic and lacks creativity. The story is horrible and these characters are horrible too. Even if for some reason you liked the two protagonists in the original they made them even worse in this game by pretty much removing that tiny shred of personality that they had in the first game. Thank god this game is as short as it is people use the length as a complaint but I was just glad it was over.  I would go as far as to say it’s one of the worst games I have ever played.2/10 (Awful)

number of helpful: 5 of 13 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2013
												A sequel to a 2006's generic third person cover based shooter - Kane & Lynch: Dead Men. You'd have think, that after a failure that was the first instalment of Kane & Lynch, IO Interactive would carefully analyse all the feedback and adjust to it. Sadly this isn't a case. While K&L2 no longer uses GFWL and allows to play cooperatively over the internet (finally?), it still has all the flaws of the first game. Hell - it even has few more.Firstly, Lynch's episodes of violent psychosis? No longer present in the game! It's kind of depressing that IO basically killed the most interesting (although, certainly - not positive) aspect of Lynch.What is also a step back, comparing to original is the music. Jesper Kyd - the composer behind music to Assassin's Creed, Hitman series and many others... no longer present in here. And sadly - a music of a new composer - Mona Mur doesn't really work. It isn't bad - it's just so easily forgettable.Forgettable is also a word, that describes storyline of Kane & Lynch 2. After the first level, everything is based around the same idea - you trying to escape from Shanghai. It's "OMG, we have to get out of Shanghai... Lynch, let's get your girlfriend and then we go" (*level later*) "Plan failed... it's all your fault, Kane... she's dead... you've destroyed my life (blahblahblah) let's get out of Shanghai". How does it end? Kane and Lynch get to the plane and leave Shanghai.Whole storyline takes around 3-5hrs to complete, which is just a terrible length for a game, where singleplayer is focal point of the game. There is a multiplayer and you can play the game in COOP. Problem is - I was never able to find anyone playing anything except COOP. And while playing a game in COOP certainly helps - it doesn't even add much replayablity (at least nowhere near as much as COOP in most of shooters).What kills the game however is its gameplay mechanics and terrible visuals. I get the difference between aesthetics and graphics and I do understand importance of artistic vision. And to some extend I do admire it's interesting visual style. Problem is - all of the post-processing effects get in the way of gameplay. With all the intense lens-flare effects, noise, color correction etc. not only spotting enemies becomes difficult. It's hard to aim and shoot. And when you disable them - you are left with nothing but highly outdated graphics, that look like something from 2003 (although - aesthetically, Unreal Tournament 2003 still looked better than K&L2)Shooting in K&L2 lacks impact and isn't satisfying. Combine that with a glitchy cover mechanics and you have 2 main reasons why K&L2 fails to be an enjoyable shooter. What makes the cover mechanics even worse is something what should have worked in game's favour - destructible environment. Destructible environment sounds cool, but sadly, you are the one that dies more often, because of it. And while games like BFBC2 or even Red Faction were able to make it work in their favor, in K&L2 it's just another frustrating feature.Bottom line: Kane & Lynch 2 is a bad third person cover based shooter, that fails to provide entertaining experience. Avoid it, if you're planning on playing alone. It can be a bit of fun while playing COOP, but in that case - I recommend picking up Rainbow Six Vegas - it's at least equally as long, has higher replayablity, looks better, has better level design... hell, it even costs less!

content:
Posted: October 24, 2014
												Repellant and pointless.  Kane and Lynch 2 is the worst kind of bad game, one made by a developer with the talent and resources to have done something better.  What goes wrong here-and it's just about everything- feels deliberate, not the result of inexperience or a lack of money.The protagonists are utterly unlikeable and barely developed except to constantly reinforce their odious nature. The story goes nowhere, the gameplay is nothing but repetitive shooting behind cover, and the shakycam/lensflare effects are obnoxious.Mercifully, the experience ends with a soggy whimper after a brief 4 hours.  Everyone's got one game that they consider the worst they've ever played, and this is mine.  Avoid at all costs.

Posted: November 27, 2010
												Being an IO game I really wanted to like it, but I just don't. In fact, I have a hard time even comming up with something positive to say. Sure, the weird hand-held camera view is somewhat stylish, but it quickly just gets annoying. Also, who's filming and why? And why is gore and nudity censured?The guns are weak, and doesn't really feel like they do any damage. The story, well, I never really got it - you hunt someone in the beginning, and your girlfriend gets *snip*, and you hunt the people behind? From all previews I thought it would be about a robbery, but that's only the multiplayer part (or arcade mode).I've played 4.4 hours so far, and that's 3.5 hours of completing the whole campaign(!), and 0.9 hours playing arcade mode. I'll try to complete the co-op campaign, and then I'll just try to forget this game...

content:
Posted: February 2
												If you were looking to give yourself a giant headache then this is the game for you! The game is a bug ridden intensely ugly mess.------Firstly, the game crashes for me on launch unless I'm in offline mode for no obvious reason and google doesn't have an immediate fix for this.The oddly positioned camera has giant amounts of sway. There's also a regularly reoccuring bug with aiming down sights in which your character model gets stuck directly in front of your crosshairs and aiming from cover is flat out broken.Guns have ludicrous spread. Enemies are ever-so-slightly bullet spongey. Every time I pressed the sprint button I had to go and sit in the bathroom due to nausea. 95% of the game's dialogue is four letter words. Every light source emits a strange, intensely distracting verticle bar. For much of the game there is a constant droning noise in the background.There is a story but it can be summed up as "Weapons deal goes bad and lots and lots of shooting happens. There's also a bit of torture." It also has probably the worst stealth section I've ever seen, though thankfully it's quite short.They must have released this having done zero testing on the product at all. It's a thoroughly bad time, has unforgivably horrible gameplay and I don't recommend it not one bit.You might be thinking "Well, it's a third person shooter and I feel like some junk-food nonsense gaming so I'll try it anyway". Don't. It is genuinely atrociously awful.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
(As i'm writing this, i'm expecting a lot of hate for this review.. In case anyone happens to read this in the first place.)Kane And Lynch 2 is a good.. Well at the very least a competent third person shooter. It's almost literally like Payday The Heist/Payday 2 except that it doesn't have nearly as much depth or content as those two games mentioned before. That being said, I feel like this is still a better game than THOSE TWO GAMES MENTIONED BEFORE. Allow me to tell you why:People always complain and whine about the length of the Story in this one, yeah you can finish it in 2 or 3 hours, yeah it's very linear, yeah it's very repititive.. But at least this game has a f*cking story mode to begin with. Which Payday doesn't.. The reason why i'm comparing K&L2 to the PAYDAY series because they're so similar to each other gameplaywise. The Characters, Kane & Lynch (who woulda guessed?) are also pretty cool and brutal characters.. Very interesting characters indeed since they're sort of evil people. The game has character development, does the PAYDAY series do any of these? Nah.Also, the multiplayer mode is pretty decent if i do say so myself if it wasn't dead.It's 9,99 Euros guys.PAYDAY 2 is 29,99 Euros.Despite the short story mode it's a good game. And the multiplayer being dead really isn't even that big of a deal considering you can play the Multiplayer with AI. And the friendly AI in this game manages just fine, compared to PAYDAY. Since in the PAYDAY series you have objectives that you must complete in order to progress through the match or whatever, in K&L2 you get the loot and get the f*ck out. The AI is competent enough in K&L2, in PAYDAY, it isn't.I hope my gibbering nonsense has made some sense and given you some new perspective about this game. TL;DR IT'S PAYDAY 2 WITH LESS CONTENT, DEPTH AND THIRD PERSON VIEW.Note: When i talk about depth i mean the multiplayer, PAYDAY 2 has a LOT more of guns and other cool stuff to waste your money at.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												Despite its atrocious length (just under 4hrs on medium) and oft-annoying cover system, I really enjoyed this game. That said, I am fully aware that Im one of the very few who think this way:). I do have my reasons, however. Firstly, the game possesses an atmosphere that very few developers can match, even to this date. Its gritty, unforgiving, brutal and very realistic/life-like. Even before I got to the ending, which basically confirmed my thoughts, I constantly felt like in a 1990s Michael Mann movie (Heat, anyone?). The shaky cam-style, along with its visual effects is another major plus in my book. Immersion is simply a given, the mechanic is not violated or overused. Voice acting is a third plus, but only if you consider the two main antagonists (cant really name them protagonists, now can we). So basically, I got so immersed in the world and the perdicament that the two psychos got involved in, that I forgave the game its length, its problematic game mechanics, heck, even the (at times) mediocre graphics. I did not really dwell on the fact that the characters are visualised in a less-detailed manner, the Shanghai setting sold me alone. I will not grade the multiplayer, as by now, it is totally dead, arcade mode is fun, but given the low number of maps, its a try-a-few-rounds kind of entertainment. To sum up, if you are into gritty, brutal crime stories told from a view point of two very despicable personas, Id say go for it:) I sure had fun with them.

												Do not buy this game. Don't do it. It's not even the kind of bad that's funny. It's just flat-out bad, the kind of flat-out horrible-ness that doesn't justify playing it even if you got it for free. What's wrong with it? Everything. Camera is awful in-game and in cutscenes. Storywise, I'm not even sure what's going on. Controls are clunky, and that's being generous. Gameplay wise it's about as entertaining as repeatedly slipping in a pool of liquified crap. Cover system works about as well as a potato works for cleaning your dishes. Half the guns can't hit anything within five feet of them turning shoot-outs into a horrible process of wasting ammo in the hopes that something will hit, or charging the enemy head on and using the ol' spray and pray. Health makes little to no sense with random blots of blood splattering all over your screen to confuse you as to where the enemy attacked from and just how much health it is that you have. Overall there's about a dozen different things to plague the experience at all times to make it as much of a chore as possible to trudge through the game. Do yourself a favor, don't play it. Save your money and buy a potato or something, whatever it is it's bound to be better than this game.

												This game holds it's prime with it's amazing atmosphere. The soundtrack really made you feel part of the situation and feel worried. Not to mention the soundtrack gave it a very dark feel too which I enjoyed very much. The story felt a little too predictable and has it's share of bugs and glitches. One of the major bugs I bumped into was in the last mission. When I had aimed down the sights of my gun, the whole screen went pink. It took me about 30 minutes of messing around with settings until I ended up restarting the game and it had seemed to work fine. I think it was the restart or the fact I was able to hit the next checkpoint. Towards the end of the game it'll get pretty challenging which I feel was pretty nice and bad. Enemys had more and more health and dealt more and more damage further in the game. On normal I felt like the last 3 missions were expert difficulty. So expect to die a few if not a lot, even on normal. So overall this game holds key it's atmosphere and it's ability to bring you in the game and really be embraced into the situation which I thought was really amazing. At the end of the day this game is a 8/10

content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I bought this game last year in a sale without actually playing the first one, completed it in co-op with a friend in around 3 hours which is very short but worth it for the price which I have paid. I believe that many people were dissapointed with this game's lenght when they paid the full price.The shooting mechanics are solid and fun, the action is great, the soundtrack is great too and atmospheric.The game has a very unique art style, the whole game looks like a gritty amateur homemade movie shot by an unseen cameraman running after the player, complete with lens flares, distortions, blurs and even a shaky cam while sprinting which can be turned off. It's so bad it's good.The game has a serious and mature storyline which gets kind of repetitive.It basically goes like this:"Kane, come to Shanghai, I need your help."A few moments and dead bodies later..."Let's get out of here!"The environments are detailed and look authentic.If I were to review this on release it would be terrible due to it's lenght but for what I bought it I really can't complainThe game takes you throught 3 hours of of non-stop action which follows the same routine: cover, shoot, run, cover, shoot, run, repeat.The game ends just as it was warming up and the ending is nothing thats worth mentioning.The multiplayer is pretty fun and a mode called 'Arcade Mode' is included which is the Fragile Alliance multiplayer mode in singleplayer which is pretty fun and adds replay value.The co-op is fun and worthwhile and may add to the replay value if you want to play with a friendOverall this game is recommendable only if it's on a sale, it is worth no more than £5 due to the linear short and kind of predictable story. But there are some memorable moments and fun gameplay as well as a great visual style. The game is like a gritty action movie, short but sweet.Good to complete on a boring night, buy it on a sale, play with a friend.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												So after beating the first Kane & Lynch I can fairly say that they improved a lot of things that really bugged me. Shooting is more accurate (still a little fustrating at times especially when the bullets are not going where you aim), they added hit markers to indicate that you hit them and where. The levels are drastically better designed in this one, from the streets of Shanghai to the dirty cluttered sweat shops, everything is beautifully done giving you a sense of realism the last one lacked. The variety of weapons was definitely welcomed, there were several different kinds of pistols, machine guns, and shotguns. This game encourages you to experiment with each one to find out which compliments your playing style. They improved the cover system as well by simply giving a cover button, letting you control where and how you want to take cover, its way better but could use some tightening up. The characters Kane & Lynch are better represented and displayed this time around, Kane is again hastily trying to rush to his own agenda (doesn't really contribute to the story beyond the point of telling us what happened to his daughter who we saved last game, and providing some assistence in fire fights), Lynch on the other hand puts on a pretty good show, I actually felt bad for the guy, he had his life together then all these bad events start to happen. There are plenty of memorable moments in this game, like when Kane & Lynch get sliced up all around thier bodies and they have to escape while running around completely naked. A lot of tense fire fights and action to keep you busy (which was one good thing about the first game), it rarely slows down to catch your breath, you always want to keep going and see what craziness is going to happen next. For the most part this game was really good with only a couple of issues that bothered me, one was the camera, they were going for an amatuer filmed experience, its a great idea but in practice it got really annoying and bothersome, so I'm glad the developers thought of putting an option to disable it (steady cam). Its very shaky at tmes which can throw you off because the game has a lot of tense battles, you don't want the camera to assist the enemy, so I ended up turning steady cam on. Another thing thing that bothered me was again the lack of any real story, this game is a short experience (beating it took me 4.6 hours) and there is no reason to replay it unless you want the achievements for beating it on hard or extreme. So I'm confused to why they didn't try to throw some more story, whether learning more about the character's past or adding some information about the current relationships these characters have. There is really nothing here story wise which is a shame because I like this game.Kane & Lynch 2 is a good game that I recommend giving it a shot, but since the multliplayer is dead the $10 price is pretty good, not worth $60. Playing co-op with a friend is also a great idea for a short acton packed experience.

												  This is a strange game, you are not a hero, in fact you are a really, really bad human being, is more difficult than you are average shooter, that corner you didn´t check before you entered the room? sorry, you´re dead. you rush in guns blazing, you ´re dead. i´m suree you get what i´m trying to say, you´ve got to take you´re time, but not to much because the enemies are going to flank you, if you take cover, and you happened to be behind something that would break in the real world? it breaks.    The story is a dark as it can get, no redemption, no happy endings, only killing and suffering, this game would have been a critical darling if it was released after Spec ops the line, because it shares a lot of things with that game, essentially that is difficult to play, because it was designed that way, the shooting mechanics are hard in an almost phisycal way, it shares is grim tone, but doesn´t fall in the preaching tone of spec ops the line, this game is an ugly game, because it´s protagonists are ugly people in all the senses, and they live in an ugly, depressing world, specs ops is a glorious failure, this game was a failure in its time, and that´s a shame, its not for everyone that´s for sure, but if you like to take a walk outside of the usual path, this game deserves some of your time, but be aware that is not going to help you, it´s going to make you sweet, it´s a game that knows what it is and is not ashamed, and i can believe how much i liked it

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												One of the most underrated games ever made. Beneath the cookie-cutter gameplay lies disturbing and damning revelations about modern FPS games. The hand-held camera visual style adds a visceral touch to the goings on, but it's the up-close headshots being pixellated out that should do the most psychological damage to the thinking gamer. This game will make you really think about the violence being carried out on-screen. The two anti-heroes are also well worth the entry fee and their depressingly familiar descent into violence really makes you question where there's any good guys here. There is a very abrupt ending (almost akin to how the Pink Panther series ended back in the day) so a sequel is unsure... but definitely play through both games just so you can say "I was there, and I GOT it".

												OK, this game is not good, I mean not good at all, at least that's what all the reviews say. And they are RIGHT, at least from one point of view. I played the first Kane and Lynch and quite enjoyed it,it had a fairly good story, even though the story was very predictable, it played fairly well, it looked somewhere between ok and mediocre it was just another cover based shooter. But I still enjoyed it. But part 2 was just bad, I was able to finish the story in some 2-3 hours and the MP didnt work very well for me... I liked the art style of the game, it managed to cover a lot of the games technical shortcommings, since at times all you see is blurry visuals and video artefacts, you dont see bad textures or crappy animations. Anyway I do not recommend this game for the full price, hell even a discount of 75% still is not fully ok, I bought the game together in a package with the first one for a few euros, which still bugs me...Nevertheless if it's for 1-2 E you can give it a try since it's a mediocre shooter with an interesting visual style (I'm not saying pretty) Other than that just get something else...

												I liked this game for the Multiplayer - not sure if there would be that many people still on the servers these days but if there are you will have some fun. You can play the campaign story in co-op or multiplayer heist mode. The heist mode is set up so that you all start on the same team and have to rob the target store, you do this by standing next to cash points which then gets transferred into your bag. You then have to escape at the getaway point where the loot is shared among the survivors. The twist is that you can choose to betray your team mates by killing them or escaping by yourself. On top of this if you die you respawn as a cop and get a monetary reward for killing the other players.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 14, 2015
												Kane and LychA pair almost as misunderstood as the games they inhabit.Both the original and the sequel do not conform to the norm.They have their flaws - but despite or perhaps even because of these flaws they are valuable. They are different. This game presents a unique and well executed visual style. The weapons feel potent and sound brutal. After finishing this game I felt compelled to visit China and Shanghai. To soak up the grime, sweat and the thick, heavy air. To see the decaying buildings and the crime and the corruption. Whether these things exist in this way? I dont know, but for me this game recreates precisely what it feels to be in a place I have never visited and for me that is the essence of what a game should do.To provide some context, games like Mirrors Edge, Far Cry 1 and Far Cry 2 also had this effect on me.If you want to sit in your living room and glide through bland environments in your gucci camo yelling oorah, then leave and never return.If you want to stumble through the streets of Shangai naked in the rain, in a nightmare that doesnt end until it does :), then play this game,As with every game, best played in CO-Op.

content:
Posted: November 4, 2015
												This is a tough one because it was too expensive when it first released but is now too outdated to really justify. PROS: -Interesting "internet video" artstyle. When i first played it years ago i was stunned when certain scenes from certain angles looked almost exactly like a low quality internet video captured on a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ video camera..... This sounds bad but it actually lends to the artstyle and makes it a unique experience. -The gameplay is solid and competant. Can be intese depending on the situation. Sometimes when you're shot you will be knocked on your♥♥♥♥♥and forced to shoot from a laying position until your character can get up. This is well implemented. -The multiplayer is the same as the first game. Very cool mode for its time but by now probably outdated with a dead community. -Coop is fully supported and is honestly how this game was meant to be played. -Story isnt bad but isnt great. Comparable to a decent crime movie. CONS: -Outdated graphics-If your internet craps out during coop you will be lose significant progress. This is frustrating during the more difficult levels. -Run of the mill cover based shooting. Lots of games do it better. - short campaign. - ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ending. -Dead multiplayer-The first Kane & Lynch game was probably better overall. CONCLUSION: I would give this one a pass unless you are desperate for a cheap crime game or simply love these characters. Otherwise play GTA5 instead.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												I know this game has its draw backs, poor controls, imbalanced weapons and its short. But for all its flaws I have played, replayed and replayed it. It is an adults game with some hardcore sequences....the razor blades is a horrible scene. The story though lacking doesnt seem to matter as the characters of Kane and Lynch are so fascinating. The action sequences are thoroughly enjoyable if you can get past the poor contronls. It is visceral and totally unrelenting, at times I felt like I need a break as it is a constant onslaught, which I guess is why I love the game. I do feel like a character in a Michael Mann movie and its  a great thrill. I hope if there is a 3rd they will take their time and do it right. I would like to mention the workmanship on the game which is shoddy at best. It feels half finished, the ending is abrupt and the central plot is weak to say the least. The controls and enemy movement are poor. I would also like to point out how it takes 3 shots to put down Kane or Lynch yet the enemy can take almost an entire magazine and still get up.... I have seen this - not to mention a headshot, bing right in the dome...and yet he is still running.In its current state it is a £10 game and worth it....if you can get past its flaws.....but nothing more.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 16, 2014
												So after beating the first Kane & Lynch I can fairly say that they improved a lot of things that really bugged me. Shooting is more accurate (still a little fustrating at times especially when the bullets are not going where you aim), they added hit markers to indicate that you hit them and where. The levels are drastically better designed in this one, from the streets of Shanghai to the dirty cluttered sweat shops, everything is beautifully done giving you a sense of realism the last one lacked. The variety of weapons was definitely welcomed, there were several different kinds of pistols, machine guns, and shotguns. This game encourages you to experiment with each one to find out which compliments your playing style. They improved the cover system as well by simply giving a cover button, letting you control where and how you want to take cover, its way better but could use some tightening up. The characters Kane & Lynch are better represented and displayed this time around, Kane is again hastily trying to rush to his own agenda (doesn't really contribute to the story beyond the point of telling us what happened to his daughter who we saved last game, and providing some assistence in fire fights), Lynch on the other hand puts on a pretty good show, I actually felt bad for the guy, he had his life together then all these bad events start to happen. There are plenty of memorable moments in this game, like when Kane & Lynch get sliced up all around thier bodies and they have to escape while running around completely naked. A lot of tense fire fights and action to keep you busy (which was one good thing about the first game), it rarely slows down to catch your breath, you always want to keep going and see what craziness is going to happen next. For the most part this game was really good with only a couple of issues that bothered me, one was the camera, they were going for an amatuer filmed experience, its a great idea but in practice it got really annoying and bothersome, so I'm glad the developers thought of putting an option to disable it (steady cam). Its very shaky at tmes which can throw you off because the game has a lot of tense battles, you don't want the camera to assist the enemy, so I ended up turning steady cam on. Another thing thing that bothered me was again the lack of any real story, this game is a short experience (beating it took me 4.6 hours) and there is no reason to replay it unless you want the achievements for beating it on hard or extreme. So I'm confused to why they didn't try to throw some more story, whether learning more about the character's past or adding some information about the current relationships these characters have. There is really nothing here story wise which is a shame because I like this game.Kane & Lynch 2 is a good game that I recommend giving it a shot, but since the multliplayer is dead the $10 price is pretty good, not worth $60. Playing co-op with a friend is also a great idea for a short acton packed experience.

												  This is a strange game, you are not a hero, in fact you are a really, really bad human being, is more difficult than you are average shooter, that corner you didn´t check before you entered the room? sorry, you´re dead. you rush in guns blazing, you ´re dead. i´m suree you get what i´m trying to say, you´ve got to take you´re time, but not to much because the enemies are going to flank you, if you take cover, and you happened to be behind something that would break in the real world? it breaks.    The story is a dark as it can get, no redemption, no happy endings, only killing and suffering, this game would have been a critical darling if it was released after Spec ops the line, because it shares a lot of things with that game, essentially that is difficult to play, because it was designed that way, the shooting mechanics are hard in an almost phisycal way, it shares is grim tone, but doesn´t fall in the preaching tone of spec ops the line, this game is an ugly game, because it´s protagonists are ugly people in all the senses, and they live in an ugly, depressing world, specs ops is a glorious failure, this game was a failure in its time, and that´s a shame, its not for everyone that´s for sure, but if you like to take a walk outside of the usual path, this game deserves some of your time, but be aware that is not going to help you, it´s going to make you sweet, it´s a game that knows what it is and is not ashamed, and i can believe how much i liked it

content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												Despite a five hour campaign with flaws, I feel the gameplay and the moments is quite hectic and tense, and associates with the setting of Shanghi perfectly. Its a pity that splitscreen cooperation is left out despite the predecessor having the ability to play like so. In comparision to the original Dead Men, the original has narrative that spans across multiple countries and gives it freshness and varity as the sequel lacks it. The improvements in the sequel is the ability to be knocked down and not fallen down to be unable to be revived in safety and the complete frustration of the fact that it has AUTOMATIC cover system meaning some segements take a while to force the character to take cover and thus in a fatal situration be dead from the teammates inability to be revived for example after a a handful of missions the huge amount of ai being pitted against you in open space to take cover in a low cover wont register renderign you to get downed then die;the very ability to MANUALLY take cover allieviates the frustation while inaddition to the ability to move when knocked is an extremely helpful feature allowing the game to stay tense, and not frustrating knowing you can defend your self and not killed due to the ai after getting up or teammates dead from the inability to revive in time.is it worth $5 USD / $7AUD? For me use, the gameplay changes make it vastly less frustratiing, the narrative falls flat. So probably not since it was rushed sadly... After all its my opinon, you shall do what you wish with that information.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 23, 2012
												Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a much improved version of it's predecessor.  The ai has been improved, as has the cover system and hit detection.  What stands out the most about this title however, is the dramatic improvement in graphics.  The developers really have gone to great lengths to deliver a visual feast.  At times, the natural movement of the camera combined with the stylized but detailed graphics deliver an almost cinematic experience.  Like the original, Kane and Lynch 2 also featured an online co-op mode, Steam Overlay support, and of course widescreen resolutions.  The title is so improved over the original, I would endorse this title at full price.  Altogether the game is a solid choice at full price and a must buy on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												Having played the "flawed in everyway" frustrating first game I was not excited to play the second. Having purchased them together for $5 I felt obligated to play them both instead of them sitting there in my library never to be touched. When I started playing Dog Days it was like a completely different IP than the first.  Shooting was about the same but cover mechanics were vastly improved, with a dedicated into and out of cover button, and a whole array of new weapons, and most importantly a story you cared about... to the extent a game like this can have.  If this had been the first game in the series I'm sure it would have been much more successful. Although it was generally panned by most critics it improves over the first in everyway.  The pacing is tight and there is always the sense of "you have to keep moving" or the situation just gets worse.  Constant difficult battles, even on medium, challenge you to be frantic with your movements, and small amounts of ammo, combined with how innacurate most aiming is, constantly require you to go pick up dead enemies weapons or rush out into gunfire to collect ammo. The "found footage" style of the camera movements (sometimes nauseatingly shakey :D) and the quality of the picture make it seem like a documentary of two men that just can't catch a break playing back on a vhs player.  There isn't some grand epic adventure unfolding before you a la uncharted or gears of war.  It's just 2 guys trying to escape the streets of Shanghai and it's all gone to hell.  For how cheap it is you should pick this up.  You can skip the first game and just play this one without being out of the loop on things for the most part.  If you can stomach the first one play it to get a little backstory.  Or just read the synopsis on wikipedia. I'd give it a 7/10.  Not amazing but a solid game worth the money and few hours of insanity.  I think it took me 6-8 hours to beat.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2015
												I can't really recommend this game.I really tried to like it and push on in the campaign, but there is just some things that bug the **** out of me.- Story isn't good, but are not bad either. In the beginning it's confusing though.- The camera tends to bug and makes the game unplayable from time to time. (By not follow you in cover and by doing that, you are not able to take proper shots without having to stand up and expose yourself)- Cover system is not that good, i got killed several times without looking, no matter where the enemies stand. Oh yeah, 50% of all the times i looked i get shot isntantly with no time to shoot anybody.- SMG's.... they suck for you... but apparently the AI can headshot you from 100 kilometers distance without a sweat.- Shotguns should be a close quarters weapon.. can almost be used as sniper rifle.- It might be a 2010 game, but i've seen better graphics in games from before that time.- Somewhat boring characters.-There's no ending.. just a short cutscene with little to no content.Must say that the atmoshpere as a whole is quite dark, that's one thing i like about it. No heroic stuff like in so many games, and whole story isn't great, it's not bad either. Basicly it's just about 2 dudes who got themselves into some♥♥♥♥♥♥ but that's it.So buttom line is: Gameplay is choppy and buggy. Story is average.. AI is a bit stupid and predictable, but can also prove very challenging by headshotting you through cover. So, nope, won't recommend it. It's bad. And before you judge my review, yes i did complete the story mode. Replay value is zero.

content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												PLEASE make Kane and lynch 3! This one’s SO good. This is one the most atmospheric shooters ever made.  I don’t understand the bad reviews for this game because it is addictive and stylish and creates a feeling of tension and dread and exhilaration like no other shooter I’ve played, and I’ve played a lot of shooters.  The aiming is difficult but that’s what makes the game so unique because your shots will go astray meaning you really need to judge each weapons handling, recoil,  bullet trajectory and move to a position where the weapon can be best utilised. That’s what’s so great about this game is that it forces you to keep moving and create better angles and tactical positions with each fire fight you can figure out your own strategy. I played on the higher difficulties and it is very challenging and satisfying to think up a plan and execute it or try something else when it doesn’t work.The game is short and repetitive but that’s the only negative. It has great characters, environments, graphics, phenomenal weapon sounds, tight game play, and rewards risk taking, strategy, and creative movement in a fire fight.  It’s a shame they won’t make a third because I would love to see another game like this with more weapons, items, maybe opportunities for stealth. But really, Kane and lynch 2 is already so refined you wouldn’t have to change much. I love the handheld shaky cam style of the game and the lens flare and just the general grittiness. I-O interactive needs to make the third one. Seriously.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 23, 2015
												If you're expecting a solid and interesting thirdpersonshooter, look elsewhere, the gameplay -while functional- is the standard modern shooter fare: cover based shootingbloodyscreensorealannoying squadmate that gets in the line of firepress X to stealthkillcarry only two weapons at maximumblind fire and hipfire near uselesswait for your squadmate to open the door for youhelp your squadmate over the fenceshoot explosive barrels etc. etc. etc.The game doesn't even try to hide that it is uninspired, it has no gimmicks at all, the mechanics never evolve, it's just a shooting gallery from start to finish.So if you're coming in from a gaming perspective, stay away. Because this game is nauseatingly generic and wants to be a movie really bad, it has that nasty framework that people are so fed up with these days, i.e: "corridor-shooting gallery-cutscene-repeat"But here's where things might get a bit controversial: if you come in from the perspective of a movie fanatic, and review the game as if it were a movie, this game is actually pretty neat! It turns out that it works pretty well as a pseudo-movie.and since i didn't go in expecting a good game, and just wanted to see how the game handled that striking neo-noir theme its got going on. it actually didn't disappoint in that department.The cinematography and level compositions are gorgeous. Gritty city decay contrasted against neon-spangled streets, all viewed through a wide angle lens camera with deliberate digital artifacts such as scanlines, noise, low bitrate, screen tearing, bokeh, light bleed, chromatic aberration and dynamic range fluctuations. the acting and pacing is on hollywood level and the soundtrack and sound design has a real sense of space and depth. It's field recordings of city noise interwoven with eerie electronic patterns and feverish soundscapes of pulsating drone.I personally think that it all is meant to convey the mind of lynch, and how he is hungover, miserable, confused, disorientated and detatched from reality.Definitely something to check out if you're into neo-noir movies. if you can bear the gameplay that is. Its atmosphere felt reminiscent of enter the void or trainspotting, and if compared to games i would say i felt a bit of the hotline miami and max payne mood.That's all folks! Pretentious hipster and wannabe critic signing off~

												This one is a mixed bag. All I can tell is that it is really underated. The game has an amazing graphics with detailed environment and an unique graphics style. Every scene in the game is rendered like the effect of a shaky, entry-level camcorder, even in the gameplay. Some may feel frustruate, others consider as challenges. The game is strongly brutal, but most of them are censored. Again, not everyone loves that. The story itself is just like a great movie which is a bit complicated. Its gameplay is pretty basic cover point style, which seems okay in general. Talk about the game as a whole, some might love it, other would hate it, but surely you won't see that kind of game coming out often.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 4, 2013
												"Kane & Lynch 2 is definitely worth playing, as it's unique in a way where brutality, violence and misery of the protoganists crosses the line over perhaps any video game out there. IO Interactive is not afraid to step over it. A tip: Play it coop-compaign with a buddy, it is something you will not, I repeat not forget".As you may be aware Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is the sequel to the infamous Kane and Lynch: Dead Men, a mediocre cover shooter by IO Interactive(Hitman<3), notorious for being so bad it got Jeff Gerstmann fired. Really, it's not THAT bad. I mean it's pretty bad but I'm pretty sure I like it better than the first Uncharted at least. And anyways it came pretty close to having an interesting narrative. It starred two awful, irredeemable people(and not in the Booker DeWitt way where they're still cool and doesn't afraid of anything), one of whom has an estranged daughter. Like a lot AAA games this generation with a focus on story, it kinda fell short of its potential. 2, though, is something special. It feels like a singular artistic vision rather than a design-by-committee Frankenstein.Dog Days takes place several years after Dead Men. Lynch is now living in Shanghai with a woman named Xiu, and works for one of the local crime syndicates. He calls in Kane to help with an arms deal. The game follows the two for 48 hours starting when Kane arrives. The very first level involves Lynch taking Kane along on a small errand to "send a message" to someone who's apparently been talking too much. Things get out of hand, the man in question leads them on a chase, the girl he's with ends up taking a bullet. The man then slices his own throat. This seems bizarre now but it will become obvious why he did it in retrospect.- The Michael Mann Connection: (Director; Heat, Public Enemies, Collateral):Now Dead Men took a lot of notes from Michael Mann movies, particularly Heat and Collateral, and did its damnedest to imitate that style to a tee. Honestly it does a pretty great job at it, with the club section and the Tokyo streets level in particular evoking iconic scenes with skill. Dog Days follows in these footsteps, but in its own way. For the past ten years or so, Mann has been shooting on digital instead of film, and using hand-held camerawork more often than not. K&L2 takes this and cranks that mother up, making a kind of grainy found-footage look.That said, while Dog Days may model itself after latter-day Mann's aesthetic, it has much more in common with his 90's classic Heat. The mondo rad DeNiro/Pacino joint is about two men who can't conform to a normal way of life. They seek the thrill of The Score at the expense of everything else, including their loved ones(notice how Pacino's scene with the mother at a crime scene is more emotionally powerful and wrenching than anything to do with his family). Kane and Lynch are two men trying to reconcile the fact that their only verb is kill.Contains probably the best quote from a video game I've ever played.GLAIZER: So how you like Shaghai, Kane?KANE: It's ♥♥♥♥ed. I hate it.Kane and Lynch 2 especially has some of the best atmosphere and use of style I've seen in a shooter. Shanghai looks beautiful, yet gritty underworld, this seedy urban nightmare I find really intoxicating.Verdict:A real underrated title. I like its solid/no frills shooting and the visuals/atmosphere is one of the best this gen. Voice acting is top notch. A unique game overlooked due to poor reviews and media journalism, give this a go, you'll be doing me a huge favor!

												Good enough for a bargain, but the game could have been much better. The main problem are the controls and the camera, which are quite frustrating. The control system is similar to Rainbow Six Vegas or Deus Ex HR, but both them are much better. In Kane & Lynch, you have too often the sensation that controls are not behaving properly and the camera is not focusing where it should. This never happens in Deus Ex or Rainbow Six Vegas.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 14, 2015
												PLEASE make Kane and lynch 3! This one’s SO good. This is one the most atmospheric shooters ever made.  I don’t understand the bad reviews for this game because it is addictive and stylish and creates a feeling of tension and dread and exhilaration like no other shooter I’ve played, and I’ve played a lot of shooters.  The aiming is difficult but that’s what makes the game so unique because your shots will go astray meaning you really need to judge each weapons handling, recoil,  bullet trajectory and move to a position where the weapon can be best utilised. That’s what’s so great about this game is that it forces you to keep moving and create better angles and tactical positions with each fire fight you can figure out your own strategy. I played on the higher difficulties and it is very challenging and satisfying to think up a plan and execute it or try something else when it doesn’t work.The game is short and repetitive but that’s the only negative. It has great characters, environments, graphics, phenomenal weapon sounds, tight game play, and rewards risk taking, strategy, and creative movement in a fire fight.  It’s a shame they won’t make a third because I would love to see another game like this with more weapons, items, maybe opportunities for stealth. But really, Kane and lynch 2 is already so refined you wouldn’t have to change much. I love the handheld shaky cam style of the game and the lens flare and just the general grittiness. I-O interactive needs to make the third one. Seriously.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												At the risk of sounding like a rant, I'll like to begin with saying that there were a few elements in this game that I found attractive - especially with playing the first game by Square.  Now the beginning of this sequel had a lot of promise with it's cinematic feel and it's very realistic atmosphere - you feel like you're getting dragged into the game and caring for it's characters.  Unfortunately, this honeymoon period ends rather quickly with a very uninspired cover-shooter with a lack of fresh mechanics.  In trying to maintain realism, the game lacks any actual boss battles but this just means the gameplay is dampered by repeatedly shooting waves upon waves of generic enemies.  The camera becomes a problem in this thirdperson shooter - especially on cover mechanics where it won't shift over the left shoulder correctly at times and putting your avatar smack in the middle of the screen.  The hollywood-esque shaky camera is used often even when you begin sprinting which doesn't heighten the experience or make the action more frantic, it's just a cheap trick that invokes dizziness/confusion.Now the main focus of this game is the story - unfortunately it's like a hollowed out action movie's plot where it begins with some buildup then quickly deteriorates into "NOOOOOOOOOOO" territory.  The villians become one-offs that should just be dispatched like the hundreds of other faceless mooks rushing at you. The inbetween level voiceovers lose their charm after a few levels and 12 chapters later the game just abruptly ends with a credit screen into a return to the main menu and no actual closure.The game had the high production values (for it's time) and the potential to be much bigger but unfortunately it falls short in my book and I couldn't recommend it to others unless they were real fans of the first game and wanted to see a continuation.

												i) This sequel has way better gameplay than the first Kane & Lynch. ii) Its graphics somehow, often  reminded me of the image of a typical 80's movie on a VHS cassette, they are very good in their own way.iii) Good use of interactive scenes.iv) At last, no Windows Live. Also the personalities of Kane & Lynch, aren't so emphasized like the first one.d) The plot is a bit weak and although they tried to create a connection between the first and the second game, it failed but anyway it doesn't matter that much.I'd love to watch a movie based on the characters or the game itself, but with more details and no plot-holes.Recommended, wait till you find it on sale for like 4 - 5 euros.

content:
Posted: July 14, 2012
												Always ready for moreDespite all the badmouthing this series has received, it remains to be one of my favorite.  Dog Days drops the GTA style gameplay from Dead Men and injects it with pure arcade adrenaline!  The story is very dark and mature, with some of the most memorable moments i've had in a game.  The ending definately has a big middle finger salute to the player, but the overall experience is still worth it.The gameplay is some of the most fun I have had in a shooter.  Having the all out shoot outs in the streets or parking garages will fill that void left by Michael Mann's HEAT.Overall, it is not a perfect game, but what it lacks in fluidity, it more than makes up for in overall experience.  This is one of the only games I find myself playing over and over, even as Steam sales are going on!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												One of the most underrated games ever made. Beneath the cookie-cutter gameplay lies disturbing and damning revelations about modern FPS games. The hand-held camera visual style adds a visceral touch to the goings on, but it's the up-close headshots being pixellated out that should do the most psychological damage to the thinking gamer. This game will make you really think about the violence being carried out on-screen. The two anti-heroes are also well worth the entry fee and their depressingly familiar descent into violence really makes you question where there's any good guys here. There is a very abrupt ending (almost akin to how the Pink Panther series ended back in the day) so a sequel is unsure... but definitely play through both games just so you can say "I was there, and I GOT it".

Posted: March 29, 2014
												  This is a strange game, you are not a hero, in fact you are a really, really bad human being, is more difficult than you are average shooter, that corner you didn´t check before you entered the room? sorry, you´re dead. you rush in guns blazing, you ´re dead. i´m suree you get what i´m trying to say, you´ve got to take you´re time, but not to much because the enemies are going to flank you, if you take cover, and you happened to be behind something that would break in the real world? it breaks.    The story is a dark as it can get, no redemption, no happy endings, only killing and suffering, this game would have been a critical darling if it was released after Spec ops the line, because it shares a lot of things with that game, essentially that is difficult to play, because it was designed that way, the shooting mechanics are hard in an almost phisycal way, it shares is grim tone, but doesn´t fall in the preaching tone of spec ops the line, this game is an ugly game, because it´s protagonists are ugly people in all the senses, and they live in an ugly, depressing world, specs ops is a glorious failure, this game was a failure in its time, and that´s a shame, its not for everyone that´s for sure, but if you like to take a walk outside of the usual path, this game deserves some of your time, but be aware that is not going to help you, it´s going to make you sweet, it´s a game that knows what it is and is not ashamed, and i can believe how much i liked it

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 28, 2012
												K&L2 is a cover shooter with a very good single-player/two player story mode and novel themed multiplayer modes. Its story mode is very tightly written and well-voiced, and it took me through gunfight to gunfight at a very quick pace. MP is more straightforward, but is more involved than other shooters' MP modes. All are co-op/team based to an extent, but they all boil down to earning the highest score at the other criminals' (your teammates) expense.The shooting feels appropriate, the cover shooting system is quite good (for a cover shooter) and moves at a very frantic pace. It's almost always easier to survive by moving over cover to get closer or to flank. The guns are interesting if not punchy, firing blindly from behind cover is possible, and fire extinguishers and gas cans provide meaty explosions when thrown and shot. Solid, if not innovatK&L2 is exceedingly stylish, and it received too much undeserved negativity for its divisive art design. I love the hell out of it.

content:
Posted: August 15, 2014
												Personally I love Kane and Lynch 2: Dog days. The theme of the game gives you a feeling of raw brutal criminality. The characters is like taken out of a action movie, two hardcore old timers in shanghai to do an armsdeal with the chinese mafia. But  something goes horribly wrong and Kane and Lynch ends up being hunted through the streets of shanghai, and the run of their life begins to escape the chineese mafia. The game graphics are ok, at times the extra graphics effects can be a little annoying. But you have options for that.The gameplay can seem a little booring and at time a little monotonous for some, its a typical hallway run for cover type of shooter. This game is for people that loves the criminal action hero type of theme game, and there is not a lot of those kinda games around. For me the game is all about the theme, the characters and the city scenery. The gaming critics around the world slaughtered this game, and it was no hit when it was released. But I say it deserves a try!!!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												I bought this game last year in a sale without actually playing the first one, completed it in co-op with a friend in around 3 hours which is very short but worth it for the price which I have paid. I believe that many people were dissapointed with this game's lenght when they paid the full price.The shooting mechanics are solid and fun, the action is great, the soundtrack is great too and atmospheric.The game has a very unique art style, the whole game looks like a gritty amateur homemade movie shot by an unseen cameraman running after the player, complete with lens flares, distortions, blurs and even a shaky cam while sprinting which can be turned off. It's so bad it's good.The game has a serious and mature storyline which gets kind of repetitive.It basically goes like this:"Kane, come to Shanghai, I need your help."A few moments and dead bodies later..."Let's get out of here!"The environments are detailed and look authentic.If I were to review this on release it would be terrible due to it's lenght but for what I bought it I really can't complainThe game takes you throught 3 hours of of non-stop action which follows the same routine: cover, shoot, run, cover, shoot, run, repeat.The game ends just as it was warming up and the ending is nothing thats worth mentioning.The multiplayer is pretty fun and a mode called 'Arcade Mode' is included which is the Fragile Alliance multiplayer mode in singleplayer which is pretty fun and adds replay value.The co-op is fun and worthwhile and may add to the replay value if you want to play with a friendOverall this game is recommendable only if it's on a sale, it is worth no more than £5 due to the linear short and kind of predictable story. But there are some memorable moments and fun gameplay as well as a great visual style. The game is like a gritty action movie, short but sweet.Good to complete on a boring night, buy it on a sale, play with a friend.
