number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 2, 2014
												Despite its atrocious length (just under 4hrs on medium) and oft-annoying cover system, I really enjoyed this game. That said, I am fully aware that Im one of the very few who think this way:). I do have my reasons, however. Firstly, the game possesses an atmosphere that very few developers can match, even to this date. Its gritty, unforgiving, brutal and very realistic/life-like. Even before I got to the ending, which basically confirmed my thoughts, I constantly felt like in a 1990s Michael Mann movie (Heat, anyone?). The shaky cam-style, along with its visual effects is another major plus in my book. Immersion is simply a given, the mechanic is not violated or overused. Voice acting is a third plus, but only if you consider the two main antagonists (cant really name them protagonists, now can we). So basically, I got so immersed in the world and the perdicament that the two psychos got involved in, that I forgave the game its length, its problematic game mechanics, heck, even the (at times) mediocre graphics. I did not really dwell on the fact that the characters are visualised in a less-detailed manner, the Shanghai setting sold me alone. I will not grade the multiplayer, as by now, it is totally dead, arcade mode is fun, but given the low number of maps, its a try-a-few-rounds kind of entertainment. To sum up, if you are into gritty, brutal crime stories told from a view point of two very despicable personas, Id say go for it:) I sure had fun with them.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												One of the most underrated games ever made. Beneath the cookie-cutter gameplay lies disturbing and damning revelations about modern FPS games. The hand-held camera visual style adds a visceral touch to the goings on, but it's the up-close headshots being pixellated out that should do the most psychological damage to the thinking gamer. This game will make you really think about the violence being carried out on-screen. The two anti-heroes are also well worth the entry fee and their depressingly familiar descent into violence really makes you question where there's any good guys here. There is a very abrupt ending (almost akin to how the Pink Panther series ended back in the day) so a sequel is unsure... but definitely play through both games just so you can say "I was there, and I GOT it".

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 6, 2014
												OK, this game is not good, I mean not good at all, at least that's what all the reviews say. And they are RIGHT, at least from one point of view. I played the first Kane and Lynch and quite enjoyed it,it had a fairly good story, even though the story was very predictable, it played fairly well, it looked somewhere between ok and mediocre it was just another cover based shooter. But I still enjoyed it. But part 2 was just bad, I was able to finish the story in some 2-3 hours and the MP didnt work very well for me... I liked the art style of the game, it managed to cover a lot of the games technical shortcommings, since at times all you see is blurry visuals and video artefacts, you dont see bad textures or crappy animations. Anyway I do not recommend this game for the full price, hell even a discount of 75% still is not fully ok, I bought the game together in a package with the first one for a few euros, which still bugs me...Nevertheless if it's for 1-2 E you can give it a try since it's a mediocre shooter with an interesting visual style (I'm not saying pretty) Other than that just get something else...

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												Lots of players and 'le critiques' gave this game so much s*it.I honestly didn't mind the stale gameplay (at the end of the day, a good shooter ends up on how well the firing weapon feel was executed), it felt good and sounded good to shoot the baddies.Yeah, there's a non-sensical "Crank"-like type of excuse for plot, but, for one, voice-acting was done on a level. Plus, an interesting story is always a nice feature, but not necessarily a "must have" in FPS-games (don't say you didn't mind to have your fun with Doom and/or Duke Nukem with their one-liner stories)But the most important thing I like in this game is how the combination of "sh*tty mobile camcoder" post-processing effects, a well done photo-captured texture work + high quality of ambient sound design captured alive the atmosphere of rotting pits of urban low-life blocks. The game's really got that unique illusion (not through the good NPC/protagonists characterization, but solely by its visuals) of a having stuck inside some disgusting, but very real and alive place of our world.Could probably recommend it only in case, if you'd want to have some mindless, smoothly controlled, GoW-type of shooty fun in Chinese district.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												The game has a clearly distinct visual asthetic the developers were trying to convey. Unfortunately that aesthetic was a faux low bitrate/live footage/youtube camera simulation that didn't age well with the game; it makes the game feel like there is texture pop-in or there are glitches in the game rather than being perceived as an art style. The campaign didn't make a lot of sense either. The entire story played out like a DLC add-on that was difficult to follow. The characters are in a strange land, get in trouble, shoot their way out of trouble, then the game ends abruptly. The gameplay mechanics are OK, but the aiming is terrible. You have to get really close to enemies to land a shot. Otherwise the reticle on any weapon is too big. The weapons aren't very diverse either.The whole game can be completed in ~4hours. 4/10. If you were a big fan of the first game, then you'll probably want to play this. Otherwise there are much more polished 3rd-person shooters out there that don't try to overplay their hand in pushing an "edgy" visual aesthetic.

Posted: March 23, 2015
												Dog days is the sequel to Dead Men game, this time around you're in china dealing with some dangerous people Lynch calls Kane for help.The game starts with you and Kane being tortured by the infamous 1000 cuts method with a nasty youtube camera effect and i do not mean nasty in the good way, in fact the entire game has the stupid pixelation and camera shake effects making the gameplay really unconfortable.Also if you headshot someone his head becomes pixelated...... same goes with naked characters.It's a shame they had to go with that idea of game style, because it really does ruin the gameplay a lot.Don't buy this game at full price, not even during discounts, maybe if you get it from a bundle then it's ok , you can beat this game in 4 hours tops, with probably one of the laziest endings ever, less even if you're decent at third person shooters.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												Before i write my rating so will i say this is MY personal preference of this game, thank you.Story: 3/10 (didn't understand much of the story exept that i needed to kill people to escape)Gameplay: 6/10 (Awkward cover system)Visual: 6.5/10 (can't really say more before of my crappy PC)Voice acting: 7/10 (heard better) Sound reality: 8/10 (as before, heard better) AI: 7.5/10 (got supriced the AI actually tried to flank me then in other games, which they just stand behind cover and pop up sometimes) Overall rating from me: 6/10And now to what i think about the game which is not a whole lot because of the numb get in the cover and shoot when the enemy pop up once in a while, and resurecting your partner. I will admit that this game is not a walk in the park as some may believe as you can easily die in this game if you're just trying to go gun blazin', which is not a good advice to do. The character per say can use a bit more character than just the crazy guy and the semi-stupid guy which just follows around for the ride. This game give the player different locations throughout Hong Kong. I dont have much more time to follow up with more of my thoughts on this but i sincerely say and hope that you dont buy this game as i did, even if you just want to shoot people for no reason in China, just buy CoD (Call of Duty) or CS (Counter Strike) instead. Well thanks for checking my rating/review of this game and i hope it will decide if its worth your purchase. Good bye and have a good time. -ZKD

content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												It looked like a good game when I was buying it, but after playing 2 hours of storyline, I do not recommend this game.TL;DR: Characters (Kane & Lynch) - awesome, story - looks good, gameplay - sux; get Spec Ops: The Line instead.Pros:If you are looking for a game with good characters (i like kane & lynch) and maybe a story then try to get it. Maybe the gameplay will not♥♥♥♥♥♥you of so much as me.Cons:The shooting system in this game is weird. Recoil on every weapon is weird, enemy can shoot you through whole alley, but you miss every shot. Enemies after getting 5 hits to the head, fall down, 10 seconds contemplate if they shoud die, then stand up and run around like nothing happened. Your partner is idiot, leaving enemies to flank you from side and shoot you from behind, he takes the only valuable cover leaving you to run around in the open getting shot and if you manage to get good cover, he wil stand in your shot just when enemies are shooting at you. You are getting hit by enemies you cannot see from a weird angle even if you are in the cover. Character leaves cover when he wants to, causing a lot of situations when instead of moving he will leave cover and even if crouched before he will stand up.I wil try to finish the game for achievs, but curretnly I am contemplating really uninstalling it from my library.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2011
												Unplayable piece of crap with broken and repetitive gameplay. The difficulty is unfair and plain stupid, it feels like you're shooting BB rounds, while the enemies can snipe and headshot you with crappy sub-machine guns from the other side of the map. Cover doesn't do jack sh*t, you'll get shot anyways, and that's pretty bad in a game which combat mechanic consists solely of covering behind things and shoot. And of course, what everybody hates, the graphics. This is like, the only game in history that eats memory to make the graphics ♥♥♥♥♥ier. It's supposed to look like it's a youtube video recorded with a cell phone camera. And it looks like it, but that only makes it all blurry and seizure inducing. I got this game during the special sales for less than 7 € and I regret it. I don't think anyone should spend more than 1 € for this thing.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 23, 2014
												This game holds it's prime with it's amazing atmosphere. The soundtrack really made you feel part of the situation and feel worried. Not to mention the soundtrack gave it a very dark feel too which I enjoyed very much. The story felt a little too predictable and has it's share of bugs and glitches. One of the major bugs I bumped into was in the last mission. When I had aimed down the sights of my gun, the whole screen went pink. It took me about 30 minutes of messing around with settings until I ended up restarting the game and it had seemed to work fine. I think it was the restart or the fact I was able to hit the next checkpoint. Towards the end of the game it'll get pretty challenging which I feel was pretty nice and bad. Enemys had more and more health and dealt more and more damage further in the game. On normal I felt like the last 3 missions were expert difficulty. So expect to die a few if not a lot, even on normal. So overall this game holds key it's atmosphere and it's ability to bring you in the game and really be embraced into the situation which I thought was really amazing. At the end of the day this game is a 8/10

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
												Kayne and Lynch 2 DEFEATED!!!What a mix of bad meets good.Pros:Smooth as butter gameplay on PC. Environments look great and combat takes place in plenty of locations. Lot's of powerful weaponry to use topped with great sound effects.Lot's of shooting for the shoot 'em up junkie.Partner AI Kane is actually useful and kills lot's of enemies.Don't ♥♥♥♥ with whitey.Cons:Short. But I paid 5$ for it so I'm not complaining.In one particular stage, your ability to aim is hindered by horrible cover camera angles and the crosshair being useless. How did this get pass testing?While combat is fun, the pacing is hindered by to many enemies at certain points, bringing a sense of boredom from repetition. The drunk camera while sprinting is wtf. I say it's worth the 5$ on Steam if you skipped this game. Go check it out. Outside of one particular level, the game isn't bad. It just isn't anything special.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												I think I got this game on sale in 2010 for about 5 bucks or so. Even at that price, I really can't recommend it.When I first tried playing the game, I got DESTROYED by run of the mill enemies that could seemingly shoot through my cover and flank me with the greatest of ease. I got frustrated and shelved the game for 5 years. I'm not sure what bug crawled up my backside, but I decdied to install the game and grind away until  I saw the game through completion. I really enjoy the atmosphere in this game, and I am probably one of the few who actually enjoy the 'shaky cam' aspect/angles they were going for. That is really where my enjoyment stops, though. The gunplay is dated, even for 2010. It takes a ton of bullets to take down normal civilians wearing nothing but clothes. You can take cover, but you will still be hit, and when you look out to shoot, you will nearly die... every time. It took me many tries just to get used to the shooting mechanics, and I failed over and over on the 2nd level of the game, completely frustrated. I got better as the game went on, and it became easier, but not any more fun.I've heard the multiplayer is really fun, but I can't bring myself to play any more of the game after the extremely lackluster single player campaign. 3/10

content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												               This could be a real gem. The plot isn't all that bad, the scenery is quite appealing and it's insteresting to play as kane and lynch because they kinda are the villains. But not enough time was put into the making of this game. the A.I. is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, when you take damage the entire ♥♥♥♥ing screen goes kinda red/purple and you can't see ANYTHING. You take damage while in cover  (?????)  , I actually DIED while in cover once. The mouths of the characters are disinchronized with the dialogue, the cutscenes are horrible (most of the time). Oh, and did i mention the controls are sorta confusing and respond POORLY?                 Kane & Lynch 2 : Dog Days has a real Grand Theft Auto vibe going on , but it loses it's magic really fast since the game was not made with enough effort and it ends up just making you extremely mad with it's flaws (that are many, as I mentioned).

												At a $5 price tag, this game is so worth it. It's on the short side and has no plot whatsoever, but has great non-stop gory action, good selection of different guns, and controlling two nude-crazed lunatics through the streets of Shanghai--just priceless. Lynch is a complete mad man--so much comedy listening to him rant. Add nearly 60 Steam achievements...co-op...and multi-player...what more could you ask for?WARNING: Whatever you do make sure you enable steadycam before you play this game, otherwise you will vomit in about 5 minutes; although it still won't help you through the cut scenes.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 7, 2012
												For as long as it lasts, Kane & Lynch 2: Dog Days is a good game. The story mode isn't likely to take much more than four hours on your first play-through; the Arcade mode takes even less time than that to get old; and while the multiplayer options are fun, they suffer from lag and there simply aren't enough of them to compensate for the shortcomings of the solo offerings. With a longer and more varied story mode and a better, lag-free suite of multiplayer options, Dog Days would've been very easy to recommend.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 12, 2013
												This one is controversial, but I recommend it since it provides a unique experience... and goes very cheap on sales.Yes, the game is very short (3-4h) - but it goes very well with the intensity of the gameplay and the unique camera work.The game is presented as if it was shot from a hand - the screen wobbles all the time, there are tears, artifacts... and pixelization of victims/nudity/mutilation. It can be nauseating (I had to make a break and finish the game on second evening), but it also provides a oddly realistic feel. Paired with some disturbing scenes it can be a strong experience.Gameplay is very hectic. We often have to push forward to avoid being overwhelmed - the covers are not impenetrable and we'll often get flanked. The enemies are rather dumb, but there's not much time to wonder about that.I had a great chance to play the game in co-op with a friend who already finished it once and it clicked with the game's plot - he was playing Lynch who lived in Hong Kong for some time, while I played Kane who was fresh from the airport :)Short, but very intense.

content:
Posted: October 14, 2015
												Despite a five hour campaign with flaws, I feel the gameplay and the moments is quite hectic and tense, and associates with the setting of Shanghi perfectly. Its a pity that splitscreen cooperation is left out despite the predecessor having the ability to play like so. In comparision to the original Dead Men, the original has narrative that spans across multiple countries and gives it freshness and varity as the sequel lacks it. The improvements in the sequel is the ability to be knocked down and not fallen down to be unable to be revived in safety and the complete frustration of the fact that it has AUTOMATIC cover system meaning some segements take a while to force the character to take cover and thus in a fatal situration be dead from the teammates inability to be revived for example after a a handful of missions the huge amount of ai being pitted against you in open space to take cover in a low cover wont register renderign you to get downed then die;the very ability to MANUALLY take cover allieviates the frustation while inaddition to the ability to move when knocked is an extremely helpful feature allowing the game to stay tense, and not frustrating knowing you can defend your self and not killed due to the ai after getting up or teammates dead from the inability to revive in time.is it worth $5 USD / $7AUD? For me use, the gameplay changes make it vastly less frustratiing, the narrative falls flat. So probably not since it was rushed sadly... After all its my opinon, you shall do what you wish with that information.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 27, 2015
												CONS:- You can't skip cutscenes.- Checkpoint save failed to trigger several times.- Enemies take 5-10 bullets to die, and you barely can hit anything beyond 5 metres. It's like playing Monopoly, you never know, if you hit them, or if they hit you.- Kane/Lynch is often useless. He too can kill only someone standing near to him.- Your teammates get back or run forward into group of enemies for no obvious reason. Thanks god, they're invincible.- AI sometimes it runs at you and instakills you, an it takes about 5 seconds for Kane to react to that.- If you ambush AI, or do something, that was not expected, which is about a half of the time, it stands next to you and does nothing, or it doesn't notice you, or just blatantly runs into you.- There are lots of laughably obvious scripts.- Enemies like to teleport or spawn from thin air.- Controls could be better, and cover button has problems to react in certain situations.- Physics of throwable explosive objects is rubbery and unusable.- Sprinting camera movement gives me motion sickness. Seriously.- 1 gun on the ground will replenish almost all your ammo. Which is understandable, because you will spend half of your ammo to kill 1 enemy.- There is a scene with a helicopter and it takes 20/40 mags of rifle/SMG ammo to destroy it. Helicopter is scripted and the scene is super slow and tedious.- Bugs and unfinished stuff...Pros:+ I like the setting of Shanghai and mature theme+ You can run while reloading. + Main menu is great.Gameplay consists:1. Run into new location2. Wait for them to assume their position, don't you dare run forward, left or right, or you will break the game.3. Wait for them to peak out of cover, shoot 5 bullets and hit 1.4. Repeat 10 times to kill one enemy. Repeat until all are dead.5. Don't leave cover! Few new waves of enemies will spawn.6. Move bit further or onto a new location.The whole game is tedious, unimaginative, obviously scripted and it feels like playing whack'a'mole. 3/10

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												I want to like this game, but I can't. What it lacked in gameplay in the first game, it just does it worse in the sequel. The only time I had somewhat fun in this was some of the multiplayer, which is actually fantastic, but here's where we get ugly. First of all, Eidos has just said ♥♥♥♥ this game and has forgotten it. When you start the game, it crashes, unless its been fixed, and I don't even want to start it again. So to play it you have to go offline on steam, or just disconnect your cable and plug back in. Thats the only way I was able to play with a friend for around maybe 25 minutes. Instead of maybe adding some new mechanics to gameplay, we just get "Hey look, your seperated, so you will have to fight alone and get to each other." The stories ok, but has ♥♥♥♥ing goofy♥♥♥♥♥♥throughout it. Im sorry to spoil it, but that ♥♥♥♥ing helicopter scene was the stupidest♥♥♥♥♥♥i've ever seen. The camera looks like your on acid, shaking like ♥♥♥♥ing crazy when sprinting, which is kinda cool, but annoying. The camera effects are cool as well, but it's supposed to be someone filming them on a hand held camera? The story just has dumb twists, Lynch complains about how Kane has ruined his life at one point, and they talk about seperating, but suddenly he just says ♥♥♥♥ that im coming with you. The ending is just...it basically isn't even an ending. The beginning of the game makes no sense depending if you got a specific ending from the first one, which I guess means I got the wrong ending. Believe me, the game has an ok story, but just has such dumb moments it will make you laugh and outweighs the good. There are some badass moments between them, but as said, dumb moments. Only thing you will find good is the multiplayer, and nobody plays it anymore, don't buy this mess, unless you really want to see how dumb this game is.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2015
												I think I got this game on sale in 2010 for about 5 bucks or so. Even at that price, I really can't recommend it.When I first tried playing the game, I got DESTROYED by run of the mill enemies that could seemingly shoot through my cover and flank me with the greatest of ease. I got frustrated and shelved the game for 5 years. I'm not sure what bug crawled up my backside, but I decdied to install the game and grind away until  I saw the game through completion. I really enjoy the atmosphere in this game, and I am probably one of the few who actually enjoy the 'shaky cam' aspect/angles they were going for. That is really where my enjoyment stops, though. The gunplay is dated, even for 2010. It takes a ton of bullets to take down normal civilians wearing nothing but clothes. You can take cover, but you will still be hit, and when you look out to shoot, you will nearly die... every time. It took me many tries just to get used to the shooting mechanics, and I failed over and over on the 2nd level of the game, completely frustrated. I got better as the game went on, and it became easier, but not any more fun.I've heard the multiplayer is really fun, but I can't bring myself to play any more of the game after the extremely lackluster single player campaign. 3/10

content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
Imperial Stormtrooper Training SimulatorThere were enough negative reviews of this game floating around to make me cautious. Yet the combination of a bargain price in the sales and the 2-player coop mode were sufficient to make me part with my money. Given what I'd read and heard, my expectations were pretty low, predicting something along the lines of Payday with a little more in the way of storyline and set-pieces.Despite setting the bar so low, Kane & Lynch managed to limbo right under it. There is very little about this game to recommend. One of the key features seems to be the gritty handicam perspective, which tries to make the game look like one long amateur video, replete with back angles, shaking and the pixelation of exposed genitalia and gunshot wounds. A marmite moveUnfortunately it's something of a marmite move, since the movement makes a lot of people feel confused or even nauseous. Turn off the dodgy camera options though, and you get to the meat of the game which is... patchy at best. The majority of the time you find yourself playing a kind of whack-a-mole down an extensive series of corridors. Sadly the mallet you've been given has a mind of its own, making the whole thing feel like a training programme for Imperial Stormtroopers. Perhaps 90% of the game you'll be standing at a corner pointing your gun at another corner waiting for an enemy to pop out so you can fire a bullet into a nearby wall and perhaps make him jump. A few magazines later and you might have cleared out enough enemies to progress to the next area, which apart from the slight scenery change will be nigh on indistinguishable from the previous section. Interestingly, whilst you're lucky to hit a barn door from ten paces, if you throw a gas can or fire extinguisher in front of you, you'll hit it no matter where it lands – even if it bounces completely out of sight!Wooden characters in a cardboard worldThat's just one of the many moments in this game which make it feel completely unpolished. The AI is inordinately stupid, which isn't unusual for an action shooter, but still jars with the gameplay. Enemies occasionally spot you from a country mile away, firing at corners before you appear, shooting through otherwise opaque objects. At other times they completely ignore players only a few feet in front of them, presumably because the scripting sequence hasn't been activated yet. The player characters will randomly call out 'It's this way!' even though both players are nowhere near the route, which happens far more often than in should. In an action shooter like this one, good level design should provide players with the semblance of freedom and openness, whilst subtly leading them towards the path they're supposed to take. In Kane & Lynch, the levels pull off the remarkable achievement of being obviously linear and yet simultaneously confusing. That's when the game isn't use crude and clumsy invisible walls to prevent players from interfering with an NPC's orchestrated death sequence.Forgettable coopOne of the main reasons I picked up this title was for the co-op mode, but this offers little in the way of variety. Many of the game's locations feel claustrophobically narrow, and apart from a few two-man doors, there never feels like a reason for needing your partner. It's possible to go down in this game, in which case you can either get straight back up again (presumably that bullet to the temple didn't hit anything vital), or you're told to press E, which appears to do absolutely nothing, as it's your partner who's the one to get you up. Even were they in a position to do so, there's barely any time to react, and some levels specifically split up the two players making this mechanic entirely useless.Clumsy controlsMaybe it's something to do with the German translation of the game, but it felt like many of the buttons displayed didn't do what they claimed to. Even where the controls do what they say on the tin, they feel clunky and cumbersome. Trying to get into cover often feels like tossing a coin as to whether your character will press his back to the exposed side of a box. There is no jump key, so hurdling over obstacles is generally limited to very specific areas (and confusingly involves the cover key). Even picking up weapons and ammo can be something of a headache, as moving around a fraction can mean the difference between replenishing your supply of rifle ammo and swapping it for a different peashooter.Perhaps this game's only saving grace is that it's soon over. You can easily complete it within 4 hours, during which time the virtually non-existent plot cleverly unfolds, going from being vague to hazy. To be honest, I can't see any reason why you would want to play it any longer than that!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												Having played the "flawed in everyway" frustrating first game I was not excited to play the second. Having purchased them together for $5 I felt obligated to play them both instead of them sitting there in my library never to be touched. When I started playing Dog Days it was like a completely different IP than the first.  Shooting was about the same but cover mechanics were vastly improved, with a dedicated into and out of cover button, and a whole array of new weapons, and most importantly a story you cared about... to the extent a game like this can have.  If this had been the first game in the series I'm sure it would have been much more successful. Although it was generally panned by most critics it improves over the first in everyway.  The pacing is tight and there is always the sense of "you have to keep moving" or the situation just gets worse.  Constant difficult battles, even on medium, challenge you to be frantic with your movements, and small amounts of ammo, combined with how innacurate most aiming is, constantly require you to go pick up dead enemies weapons or rush out into gunfire to collect ammo. The "found footage" style of the camera movements (sometimes nauseatingly shakey :D) and the quality of the picture make it seem like a documentary of two men that just can't catch a break playing back on a vhs player.  There isn't some grand epic adventure unfolding before you a la uncharted or gears of war.  It's just 2 guys trying to escape the streets of Shanghai and it's all gone to hell.  For how cheap it is you should pick this up.  You can skip the first game and just play this one without being out of the loop on things for the most part.  If you can stomach the first one play it to get a little backstory.  Or just read the synopsis on wikipedia. I'd give it a 7/10.  Not amazing but a solid game worth the money and few hours of insanity.  I think it took me 6-8 hours to beat.

content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												Sure, it's ridiculously short, has a silly plot, is mostly racist, gets Shanghai right only about 5% of the time, and the cover system is so-so. But i can't help but think back and decide that Dog Days is one of the most memorable titles published in the 2005-2013 era, aka previous generation as of this writing. For a third person shooter, it's lots of fun, and as undeveloped they are, Kane and Lynch are really quite OK characters. Plus the look and feel of it is just awesome to me. Replayed it four times now, three on 360, once on PC, and it was equal fun all four times. On easy it's about 3 hours, hard is really hard so maybe 5 hours if i remember correctly? In short, good shooting action, great art design, some nice destructability in environments, and easy to digest. Get it on sale, then it's a nice little trip down memory lane. Can't believe this came out in summer 2010. Time flies faster than the cliffhanger IO left it on, and it's a shame Kane and Lynch are unlikely to return.

content:
Posted: August 3, 2016
												Kanee, don't lose your mind! Kanee!Here we are, a new chapter was missing and a new chapter was finished, at hard difficulty. Kane and Lync 2 is a good side shooter that probably represent a secondary project. It started like a simple shooter, probably done under the shadow of another game (or at least this is my impression) and the final result is a fast and furious shooter that every hardcore gamer should engage. Shangai is the worst fetid and dark place ever created under the infinite rain of the metropolitan towns, and between the various clan of mafia that the player meets, between tons of bullets and blood that is spend all around the street, this game try to explain a sort of moral of two unsaveable killers. They did this♥♥♥♥♥♥for their love, they get mad for the same, and in a world full of weapons and drug traffic, probably they wash a bit the corners.Camera will move like a crazy horse to provide a cinematic feedback also during gameplay, and after a while you will accept it as a part of the story.This game is rude, graphically dark, and blood and bullets will cover the screen a lot of times. In any case it's enough playable to be bought in discount, for a week of fun. There isn't in any case the dare to do a "Big" title, but what you find is almost well done. Sound, scream, bullets, and environments that are enough destructable, are all at the good place.Play it, finish it, and proceed to something else. There is no more to say.Lord Hol Napult's experience: 7-/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 23, 2012
												Kane and Lynch 2: Dog Days is a much improved version of it's predecessor.  The ai has been improved, as has the cover system and hit detection.  What stands out the most about this title however, is the dramatic improvement in graphics.  The developers really have gone to great lengths to deliver a visual feast.  At times, the natural movement of the camera combined with the stylized but detailed graphics deliver an almost cinematic experience.  Like the original, Kane and Lynch 2 also featured an online co-op mode, Steam Overlay support, and of course widescreen resolutions.  The title is so improved over the original, I would endorse this title at full price.  Altogether the game is a solid choice at full price and a must buy on sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												At the risk of sounding like a rant, I'll like to begin with saying that there were a few elements in this game that I found attractive - especially with playing the first game by Square.  Now the beginning of this sequel had a lot of promise with it's cinematic feel and it's very realistic atmosphere - you feel like you're getting dragged into the game and caring for it's characters.  Unfortunately, this honeymoon period ends rather quickly with a very uninspired cover-shooter with a lack of fresh mechanics.  In trying to maintain realism, the game lacks any actual boss battles but this just means the gameplay is dampered by repeatedly shooting waves upon waves of generic enemies.  The camera becomes a problem in this thirdperson shooter - especially on cover mechanics where it won't shift over the left shoulder correctly at times and putting your avatar smack in the middle of the screen.  The hollywood-esque shaky camera is used often even when you begin sprinting which doesn't heighten the experience or make the action more frantic, it's just a cheap trick that invokes dizziness/confusion.Now the main focus of this game is the story - unfortunately it's like a hollowed out action movie's plot where it begins with some buildup then quickly deteriorates into "NOOOOOOOOOOO" territory.  The villians become one-offs that should just be dispatched like the hundreds of other faceless mooks rushing at you. The inbetween level voiceovers lose their charm after a few levels and 12 chapters later the game just abruptly ends with a credit screen into a return to the main menu and no actual closure.The game had the high production values (for it's time) and the potential to be much bigger but unfortunately it falls short in my book and I couldn't recommend it to others unless they were real fans of the first game and wanted to see a continuation.

content:
Posted: May 10, 2015
												I can't really recommend this game.I really tried to like it and push on in the campaign, but there is just some things that bug the **** out of me.- Story isn't good, but are not bad either. In the beginning it's confusing though.- The camera tends to bug and makes the game unplayable from time to time. (By not follow you in cover and by doing that, you are not able to take proper shots without having to stand up and expose yourself)- Cover system is not that good, i got killed several times without looking, no matter where the enemies stand. Oh yeah, 50% of all the times i looked i get shot isntantly with no time to shoot anybody.- SMG's.... they suck for you... but apparently the AI can headshot you from 100 kilometers distance without a sweat.- Shotguns should be a close quarters weapon.. can almost be used as sniper rifle.- It might be a 2010 game, but i've seen better graphics in games from before that time.- Somewhat boring characters.-There's no ending.. just a short cutscene with little to no content.Must say that the atmoshpere as a whole is quite dark, that's one thing i like about it. No heroic stuff like in so many games, and whole story isn't great, it's not bad either. Basicly it's just about 2 dudes who got themselves into some♥♥♥♥♥♥ but that's it.So buttom line is: Gameplay is choppy and buggy. Story is average.. AI is a bit stupid and predictable, but can also prove very challenging by headshotting you through cover. So, nope, won't recommend it. It's bad. And before you judge my review, yes i did complete the story mode. Replay value is zero.

content:

												Kanee, don't lose your mind! Kanee!Here we are, a new chapter was missing and a new chapter was finished, at hard difficulty. Kane and Lync 2 is a good side shooter that probably represent a secondary project. It started like a simple shooter, probably done under the shadow of another game (or at least this is my impression) and the final result is a fast and furious shooter that every hardcore gamer should engage. Shangai is the worst fetid and dark place ever created under the infinite rain of the metropolitan towns, and between the various clan of mafia that the player meets, between tons of bullets and blood that is spend all around the street, this game try to explain a sort of moral of two unsaveable killers. They did this♥♥♥♥♥♥for their love, they get mad for the same, and in a world full of weapons and drug traffic, probably they wash a bit the corners.Camera will move like a crazy horse to provide a cinematic feedback also during gameplay, and after a while you will accept it as a part of the story.This game is rude, graphically dark, and blood and bullets will cover the screen a lot of times. In any case it's enough playable to be bought in discount, for a week of fun. There isn't in any case the dare to do a "Big" title, but what you find is almost well done. Sound, scream, bullets, and environments that are enough destructable, are all at the good place.Play it, finish it, and proceed to something else. There is no more to say.Lord Hol Napult's experience: 7-/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												I like this game. It felt meta towards the end, a comment on video games in general. The entire time I listened to Kane and Lynch both complain about the game, the killing, the mindless drudgery and the feeling of "one last job" I felt the same. The gameplay is terrible, I fought to the end of each mission, massacring police and gang members to do the same in the next area. To do the same in the next. Then the next. Rarely mixing it up with an escort mission or turret segment.Towards the end the pair orally ask when it will end multiple times, pleading for it to be over and I started to feel the same. Relief at the end of a mission, a sigh at the beginning of the next. "When will it end?" shouted Lynch, as he prepared to fight yet another wave of Shanghai's police.Three and a half hours from the beginning, a cut to black and the end of the game where I felt relief the same as Kane and Lynch. It was over. There was no triumph, no lessons learnt, and no achievements; just a temporary escape until the next game. I think that was intentional, an artistic move on the part of the IO Interactive to induce the same feeling that the pair go through on missions, to highlight something about video games and gaming culture.That said, I still can't recommend it because it's three hours of shooting down corridors at waves of enemies. Artistic statements and interpretations only really end up working in games when the gameplay is good in the first place. This was a massive chore from start to finish.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												I vaguely remember the original Kane & Lynch being something of a mediocre shooter, mostly written off for being uninspiring with unrelatable protagonists. So when "Dog Days" came out, and the reviews trashed it for being nauseatingly bad, I felt no strong urge to pick it up. Then Eidos had that massive Steam-Bundle and both games were sort of shoved in there,which is how they ended up in my library. I feel like I specifically need to point this out, I did not go out of my way to get this game. It was essentially just a freebie that I decided to check out to see if it was as bad as everyone seemed to think it was.I kept an open mind and fired it up. First thing that struck me was the absolutely nauseating camera. That's not hyperbole either, the god awful "found footage" style wobble was so bad I felt physically ill. This is the first and only game that has ever had that effect on me, by the way, I typically don't get nauseous from bad camera work. Second thing I noticed was the audio engineering was all sorts of broken. Bad repetitive gunshots, weird ambient noise and a cacophony of shouts and screams made every waking moment playing this feel like an assault on your ears. It never let up except during the loading screens, and then the effect was is so jarring you feel like you experienced whiplash.The graphics are passable, for a PS3 port. There were minor issues of pop-ins and screen tearing, but otherwise it was fine. Overall the mood was they were aiming for was dark and grungy, and I suppose they did alright at that.The gameplay is probably the worst aspect of the Dog Days. All you'll be doing, from the minute you start until the final cutscene is third person running and gunning, broken up in only one area where you're stuck in a fixed position shooting out of a vehicle. Occasionally they will insinuate that you are supposed to be engaging the enemy from stealth, but I never seemed to be able to sneak up on anyone, the enemy always seemed to detect you, no matter how slowly you moved past them.When it comes to the cover based shooting mechanic, they manage to somehow mess up the two most fundamental aspects of the gameplay style. The shooting, and the cover.Sticking to cover, never seems to really shield you all that much from enemy fire, and you can't aim your gun to save your life. The targeting reticle is always so massive, and the firearms so inaccurate it feels like you are constantly blind-firing from the hip. I swear at one point I unloaded an entire SMG on an enemy no more then 10 meters away from me without any effect.Couple this with the fact that the enemies soak bullets like sponge does water and the main... no, check that, SOLE gameplay becomes an exercise in frustrating tedium.The plot to this game is fairly threadbare as well. Kane and Lynch meet up in Shanghai to sell guns and murder people, only they murder the wrong people and now they are being hunted. Lynch has a girlfriend, she gets killed, he goes nuts, badguy gets killed, and the credits come rolling down in what was such a startling surprise I actually laughed out loud.You can see that the time I spent playing this game was just over three and a half hours. That's how long it took me to complete the single player storyline. I didn't even consider checking out the multiplayer aspect.So yeah, avoid this game, unless you are morbidly curious about just how bad it is.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												I like this game. It felt meta towards the end, a comment on video games in general. The entire time I listened to Kane and Lynch both complain about the game, the killing, the mindless drudgery and the feeling of "one last job" I felt the same. The gameplay is terrible, I fought to the end of each mission, massacring police and gang members to do the same in the next area. To do the same in the next. Then the next. Rarely mixing it up with an escort mission or turret segment.Towards the end the pair orally ask when it will end multiple times, pleading for it to be over and I started to feel the same. Relief at the end of a mission, a sigh at the beginning of the next. "When will it end?" shouted Lynch, as he prepared to fight yet another wave of Shanghai's police.Three and a half hours from the beginning, a cut to black and the end of the game where I felt relief the same as Kane and Lynch. It was over. There was no triumph, no lessons learnt, and no achievements; just a temporary escape until the next game. I think that was intentional, an artistic move on the part of the IO Interactive to induce the same feeling that the pair go through on missions, to highlight something about video games and gaming culture.That said, I still can't recommend it because it's three hours of shooting down corridors at waves of enemies. Artistic statements and interpretations only really end up working in games when the gameplay is good in the first place. This was a massive chore from start to finish.

Posted: February 17
												This game is... unique. It's not 8/10 good, not even 7 in most eyes. But I consider this game an experience.The visuals  always gave me this weird vibe that I was constantly under threat, which kept me on my toes throught. There are this camera blur and pixelization efects on the whole game, and most peole complain about them, but you can turn them off. There is a big enphasis in cover combat, but that indescreptible feeling that it's you aganst the world kept me playing.  It's short, about 6 hours, but it's also cheap. I recomend it still for the scale of the game and the constant tension in the atmosphere.By the way, the visuals in the beginning...haunting.
